review_content: Na krakowskim Beerweek Festival 06, w 2021 roku, 100 ml przelane z butelki dwoma kielonkami. Hm no potężny stout, pity już na dość zrobieniu. Bardzo mocny, słodki ale nie lepki, w sumie to już wykracza poza kategorie piwne.. Rodzyny i karmel, gęściutkie (zatem bezpianowe i bezwysyceniowe), ładna mieszanka kolorów i feeria barw. No ok, spróbowane, choć powinieniem był to skosztować w lepszych/wcześniejszych okolicznościach.
Szanuję legendę, w swojej kategorii trunek wzorowy, rozgrzewający, przyjemnie bourbonowy, ale ja już nie mogie takich mocnych. Tylko na setki daję radę.
Mjuk, mörk sirap hint av kaffe. Lagrad i källare sen 2012. Ingen hint av den höga avb n förutom i huvudet 😉

Fles gedeeld door Keukeman geprobeerd met Benzai
 Het is een diep donkerbruin tot zwart bier met een bruinig schuim. Het heeft een bourbon achtige geur. De smaak is vol, bourbon, hout en gebrande mout.

Strong malty boozy aroma of cocoa, prune, raisin, vanilla, wood, bourbon, and caramel
Pours pitch black with small creamy head, looks thick. 
Flavor is rich with vanilla, cocoa, wood, prune, and bourbon. 
Full bodied with low co2, slight alcohol warmth, lingering sticky wood prune finish. 
Excellent beer.  Hits all the right spots for me.  I would love to try this aged in port barrel instead of bourbon.

Wat valt hier nog over te zeggen, dat het een fantastisch bier is, dat is het niet, het is qualitatief wel oké ,  maar veel te veel drop en leer, en is zwaar overgehyped, net als bij Westvleteren. Het is veel te duur en de cultus eromheen is al helemaal idioot te noemen, de hele nacht voor een bierwinkel wachten in de hoop dat je een flesje bier mag aanschaffen voor veel geld. Sorry....doe mij maar een KBS van Founder's of een Necessary Evil van Thornbridge,  stuk makkelijker verkrijgbaar en goedkoper.....

(2018 bottle shared @ Erik's tasting, Stockholm, July 13/19) Pours pitch black with a small pale brown head. Notes of deep caramel and and toffee malts soaked in chocolate and quite some bourbon, with fairly prominent dark fruit vinousness, vanilla barrel vibes, smoky charred oak, subtle coffee, quite highly sweet through the sip but finishes off dry, lots of oak and bourbon, low to moderate charred/roasted bitterness, slight alcohol warmth but not extreme given the ABV. Quite full oily viscous body with very soft carbonation. Certainly a very good 'malt and barrel' stout, not some sort of revelation at this point in the history of BA stouts but enjoyable on its own merits.
Good color, smell, and taste. It is thick and feels like you can almost chew it. Not easy to locate but after trying in I can see why it goes quick when you can find it.

2020 millésime, paid 20 euros for it on saveurbiere.com.
Nice imperial stout, lovely Bourbon aromas, chocolate and coffee, but widely overrated and expensive. Should cost 7 boxes
To jest moja subiektywna ocena, która nie musi pokrywać się z Twoją oceną. https://www.instagram.com/czgr_

Degustada com um charuto Flor De Lá Vega Toro Escuro, na cor um preto muito opaco sem nenhuma transparência, no aroma lebra muito um Bourbon (obiviamente) mas fica muito em destaque o amadeirado, defumado e coco
PS: Não é um estilo q costumo gostar mas com toda certeza está no meu top 5

Bière stout impériale,première fois au Québec, on n’as des notes de chocolat au lait avec un bon mélange de torrification.Les goût est tout simplement onctueux malgré le taux alcool quon ne s’en pas ,

Butelka 1 pinta, czyli 0,473 litra.
Barwa intensywnie czarna, z brązowymi refleksami, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa, średniej wysokości, ale bardzo małej trwałości, nie zostawia żadnych śladów na szkle. Aromat jak dla mnie jest obłędnie słodki, mocno kompleksowy, szlachetnie alkoholowy, likierowy, deserowy, a nawet bombonierkowy. Jest w opór mlecznej czekolady, melasy, cukru muscovado, karmelu, toffie, czerwonych owoców jak wiśnia, czy śliwka, jest nawet odczucie zapachu nadzienia z tych owoców. Do tego akcenty pumpernikla i dymu. Wszystko wieńczy piękna i wyraźna beczka po bourbonie, mocno waniliowa i świeża. Mnie ten zapach pochłonął! W smaku też poprostu wow! Jest spora, likierowa słodycz, potężna dawka deserowej czekolady, budyniu czekoladowego, melasy, cukru muscovado, karmelu, toffi. Dużo czerwonych owoców w typie wiśni, czy dymionej śliwki. Świetnie uwydatniona beczka po bourbonie i wynikająca z niej moc wanilii. Na finiszu czuć świeże dębowe deski i lekką cierpkość. Jest gładko i kremowo w odbiorze, ale troszeczkę wychodzi alkohol, co nie dziwi przy tym woltażu. Goryczka średnia, dużo ciała. Nisko wysycone. Wypiłem już parę piw w swoim życiu, ale taki efekt wow mam już rzadko!

2020 release BCS 
I had to give this 5 because it’s easily the best beer I’ve tried. SO delicious and satisfying, it’s quite an adventure to drink. The depth and complexity is truly wonderful: I picked up lots of cherry as well as vanilla, but not in a sickly sweet way. It’s very hard to describe such a fantastic beer! I had questions about the price of this (£20) but would pay that again as an annual treat. One of life’s real pleasures.
12oz bottle poured into a Tulip glass, Black in appearance, aroma is rich, coffee, chocolaty and sweet. Flavor is rich, roasted, coffee, licorice, sweet, sticky and boozy. Will recommend to friends.

Un f ing real!
The intense flavors are bouncing all over my mouth.
I’ll be sure this is stocked in my beer frig.

Taste: rich roasted dark malts, smooth, dark fruit, smoked, bourbon notes, woody oak, boozy. Same with the spicy nose. Black, opaque, with delicate head and lace film from barrel aged ale like this. Full body. I had this in 2020 but it could age another year.
Earlier Rating: 12/5/2018 Total Score: 4.6
Taste: rich, complex, toasted, dark chocolate, sweet, vanilla, massive, malt, tobacco, warming. Bourbon, oak wood, boozy, vanilla, maple, nose.  Black/brown reddish hue, mostly opaque, tan head some lattice. Full body.

Quasi totalmente scura con testa color nocciola dalla texture irregolare e dalla veloce evanescenza. Profumo molto intenso ed elegante di cioccolato, toffee, vaniglia, frutta a guscio e frutta sotto spirito, legno e bourbon. Al palato ingresso dolce, cioccolato al latte, melassa, frutta a guscio, datteri, ciliegia, prugne ed uvetta, vaniglia. Finale con note di cenere e tabacco. Tutta la bevuta è abbracciata da un sontuoso abbraccio etilico che riscalda ed invoglia a riportare alla bocca il bicchiere.
Corpo pieno e rotondo vellutato, carbonazione bassa.

DATE: November 3, 2020... OCCASION: four years of the last presidency led to a beer I have cellared for almost as long... GLASSWARE: Duvel tulip... pours a jet-black body with a quarter-inch ochre-tinted swirl that roils stoically... first waft: bold bourbon, heavy brown sugar, vanilla, leather, raisin, toasted malts, caramel and toffee, with hints of woodiness and chocolate.... a thick, viscous burn finishes a fiery, grand gesture--the teeth acknowledge the hop profile, while the body coats the mouth like the best medicine... full-bodied, weighty, each sip a ponderance of the more than three years it has sat waiting for this night--a bit creamy and dry its pull... vanilla, boozy, toasted malts, caramel--almost an ice cream finish that satisfies like a dessert... the chocolate and brown sugar builds a powerful impact, lingering and uplifting... this is indeed an epic beer, with wine-like hubris and scotch-like respect... Goose Island may catch flack for their In-Bev association,  but this is a legit beer for a special occasion like this...

Bottle of the 2019 iteration poured into a snifter. Black with a quick, fizzy brown head. Aroma is bourbon, wood, dark and milk chocolate, and a hint of roast. Initial taste is exactly what is in the aroma with more of an emphasis on the sweeter notes in the middle. Fades to sweet chocolate followed by dark roasted coffee. Silky smooth, slick palate and just a hint of carbonation. Sweet Jesus this is the stuff. If I have a criticism it's that maybe there's too much bourbon up front... Maybe.
Bottle. Black with slightly tan head. Big boozy powerful nose. Incredibly smooth. Rich and complex and huge. Excellent.

Bourbon and stout beer had a love child together. Seriously Folks. Creamy, mellow, definite bourbon flavor with a bourbon bite, hint of smoke, and no bitter aftertaste, although those remarkable flavors linger... can’t go wrong here.

Right on the money. From start to finish, everything came together. Thick and dark, the complexity increases throughout the drink. At 14% it is a big beer, but not at all overwhelming. One of my very favorite pours.

Monthly Beer Share (five of us); Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. 27th July 2020. I brought the bottle back with me from the US to share with friends. It was the 2019 version (14.7% ABV) with a BBD of 29th Jun 2024. Black body, tanned topping. Bourbon to the fore, harsh sugary feel too. Loads going on really, chocolate, coffee and other stuff trying the get passed the Bourbon and sweetness. Liked it.

Christmas present from my son. Cheers Dantomlinson! 🍻. 2019 vintage @ 15.2%.
Foamy tan head left a rich dark mahogany coloured body.
Huge aroma of liquorice, malt & dark spirits.
Full bodied, smooth, oily & sticky on the back.
Sweet dark berry, malt, liquorice, vanilla, demerara, raisin & bourbon tastes.
Outstanding
Black appearance. Aroma is rich, coffee, chocolate and sweet. Flavour is rich, roasted, coffee, sweet, sticky and boozy.
17/20 Very smooth, huge bourbon taste with a bit of liquorice and chocolate. It's excellent

Rocznik 2017. Nalewa się czarne, z ciemnobeżową pianą, która dość szybko opada do obrączki, a potem całkiem znika. W aromacie czekolada, kakao, piekna wanilia, która wzmaga się z czasem. Jest też nuta ciemnych owoców i alkoholu. W smaku praliny, czekolada deserowa, wanilia, burbon. Bardzo gładkie, pełne, ale nie gęste, alkohol wyczuwalny, rozgrzewający ale nie ordynarny, nie dałbym mu prawie 15%. Super ułozone i zbalansowane piwo, z fajną beczką i pazurem jednocześnie.
TITANIC boozy upfront nose and taste, hard to hide 14.7%. All the best BBA flavors plus some, giggity.  Don't skip if u can find this bad boy

2018 on tap. Pours pitch black with a small mocha head. Bourbon barrel aging is noticeable in aroma with chocolate, coffee, toasted grains coming through. Taste is sweeter than expected with an underlying dryness. Full body, smooth on the palate, and good carbonation. A very good imperial stout.

vintage 2018
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with creamy brown head, no lacing.
外观：深棕黑色，不透明。细腻棕色泡沫，无挂杯。
4/5
Aroma: Toasted malt, dark chocolate, raisin, vanilla, cinnamon, coconut, caramel and nuts, with massive soy sauce.
气味：烘烤麦芽、黑巧克力、葡萄干、香草、肉桂、椰子、焦糖和坚果香气，伴有巨大的酱油味。
9/10
Taste: Dried fruits, nuts and dark chocolate with bourbon oak and sherry. Sweet-bitter with savory soy sauce and significant alcohol burn. Lingering bitter hot boozy finish with coffee and bourbon.
味道：呈现果脯、坚果和黑巧克力，以及波本桶和雪莉的味道。甜与苦交织，伴随着咸鲜的酱油味，还有明显的酒精灼热感。尾韵持久而苦，带有灼热的酒精感，呈现咖啡和波本桶味。
8/10
Mouthfeel: Full bodied, moderate carbonated. Oily texture and smooth.
口感：酒体饱满，杀口感适中。呈现油润感，顺滑。
5/5
Overall: Nice balance between sweetness and bitterness, but nothing could cover up such a big alcohol. 
在苦度和甜度之间平衡的很好，只是这么重的酒精感实在是没法遮掩。
16/20

vintage 2017
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with lasting creamy brown head, no lacing.
外观：深棕黑色，不透明。持久、细腻的棕色泡沫，无挂杯。
4/5
Aroma: Toasted malt, dark chocolate, raisin, vanilla, cinnamon, coconut, caramel and nuts, with hints of charred wood.
气味：烘烤麦芽、黑巧克力、葡萄干、香草、肉桂、椰子、焦糖和坚果香气，伴有烤木香气。
9/10
Taste: Dried fruits, nuts and dark chocolate with bourbon oak and sherry. Moderate to high sweetness balanced with bitterness. Distinct alcohol. Lingering savory warming finish with dark chocolate and bourbon.
味道：呈现果脯、坚果和黑巧克力，以及波本桶和雪莉的味道。较高的甜度被苦度平衡。酒精感明显。尾韵持久而咸鲜，温暖，呈现黑巧克力和波本桶味。
9/10
Mouthfeel: Full bodied, moderate carbonated. Oily texture and smooth.
口感：酒体饱满，杀口感适中。呈现油润感，顺滑。
5/5
Overall: Well balanced, more delicate and rounded compared to vintage 2018. 
很好的平衡度，比2018款更优雅、圆润。
17/20

vintage 2016
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with very thin brown head, no lacing.
外观：深棕黑色，不透明。微量棕色泡沫，无挂杯。
4/5
Aroma: Toasted malt, dark chocolate, fig, cinnamon, liquorice, crackers, toasted bread and peanut butter, with slight hints of soy sauce.
气味：烘烤麦芽、黑巧克力、无花果、肉桂、甘草、饼干、烤面包和花生酱，伴有轻微的酱油味。
9/10
Taste: Malt, cocoa, pastry and spice with subtle bourbon oak. Moderate sweetness balanced with bitterness. Lingering savory warming finish with dark chocolate and soy sauce.
味道：麦芽、可可、面点和香料伴随着微妙的波本桶味。适中的甜度被苦度平衡。尾韵持久而咸鲜，温暖，呈现巧克力和酱油味。
9/10
Mouthfeel: Full bodied, soft carbonated. Oily texture and smooth.
口感：酒体饱满，杀口感柔和。呈现油润感，顺滑。
5/5
Overall
Malty bready nutty profiles with precise and well intergrated bourbon oak, balanced and enjoyable. Tasted March 2021. 
麦芽、面包和坚果主导的风味，伴随着精确而融合的波本桶味，平衡而愉悦的一支酒。
17/20

vintage 2015
Appearance: Pours opaque dark brown to black with lasting creamy brown head, no lacing.
外观：深棕黑色，不透明。持久、细腻的棕色泡沫，无挂杯。
4/5
Aroma: Toasted malt, dark chocolate, raisin, blue berry, vanilla, cinnamon, caramel and butterscotch, with hints of charred wood.
气味：烘烤麦芽、黑巧克力、葡萄干、蓝莓、香草、肉桂、焦糖和奶油硬糖香气，伴有烤木香气。
9/10
Taste: Dried fruits, dark fruits and dark chocolate with bourbon oak and sherry. Moderate to high sweetness balanced with bitterness. Lingering savory warming finish with dark chocolate and bourbon.
味道：呈现果脯、深色水果和黑巧克力，以及波本桶和雪莉的味道。较高的甜度被苦度平衡。尾韵持久而咸鲜，温暖，呈现黑巧克力和波本桶味。
9/10
Mouthfeel: Full bodied, moderate carbonated. Oily texture and smooth.
口感：酒体饱满，杀口感适中。呈现油润感，顺滑。
5/5
Overall: Bourbon oak fully melted into the base beer, alcohol was hidded, perfectly balanced. At it's peak, tasted March 2020. 
波本桶味与基酒的味道完全融合在一起，酒精感被隐藏，形成了完美的平衡。此酒正值巅峰，2020年3月品鉴。
18/20
Got a growler at the local ShopRite liquors.  One of the best, ever.  If I could find kegs, I’d keep this on tap at home.

2019 edition. Black with thin head. Aroma and flavour have light toasted wood and coconut. Dry alcohol taste washed away by sweet caramel, vanilla and chocolate. Very rich.
Earlier Rating: 2/15/2020 Total Score: 4.3
Black with thin head. Aroma and flavour have light toasted wood and coconut. Dry alcohol taste washed away by sweet caramel, vanilla and chocolate. Very rich.

Fles. 15,2% Editie 2019. Zwart bier met een randje bruin schuim. Geur: koffie, alcoholisch, melasse, hout, hint van vanille. Smaak: zoet, stroperig, kandij, koffie, wat rood fruit, alcoholisch. Volmondig. Matige koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk alcohol verwarmend, licht kleverig.

2018 Edition.
47,3cl Bottle @ Saveur-Biere, Fretin, France.
Black colour with a thin tan head.
Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, bourbon.
Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, vanilla, mugicha, oak, bourbon.
Full body, soft carbonation.
Bold bourbon notes with a velvet chocolate bod. Finish has a cake like taste.
2018 vintage. Chocolate, vanilla oak, licorice, candied sugar. Chewy body and prominent barrel notes. No flavour depth though and no expected complexity. And way too much booze. Very disappointing.
Pick black, creamy, malty smooth.  Almost like a cross between a barley wine ale and and an imperial Stout.  YUM!

Cracking this with two good mates on my 40th birthday as a night cap after a day of solid beer drinking. This big, bad boozy bastard is a huge beer. It’s thick and warming. It’s quite sweet, almost molasses in sickly sweetness. I understand why this is so highly sought after, it’s a great beer and a perfect way to end my 40th birthday.

Appearance: black, little to no head and some lacing. 

Smell:  Smokey, boozy (alcohol), soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, bourbon 

Taste:  Bourbon, alcohol, soy sauce, teriyaki sauce, chocolate, coffee

Mouth Feel:  finely carbonated, smooth

Overall:  suggest to lower the alcohol content, eliminate soy sauce aroma and taste, and improve head and retention.

Bottle order from the lcbo. Thick syrupy sweet imperial with boozy bourbon hit. Oakiness, chocolate and coffee, and a little vanilla in the finish. Little sweeter than I would have expected. It's quite good, though it tough to compete with the hype.
this is a beast amazing stout with huge bourbon character well hidden alcohol and silky mouthfeel
From 2018 pours pitch black with a thin tan head. The aroma is sweet chocolate and bourbon. The flavor is first bourbon, followed by some coffee and chocolate. This is one of my favorite beers
Big Bottle, birthday gift from my parents! (2019 Vintage, 14,7 % ABV)Black with little head. Roasted malts, coffee, liqorice, bourbon, oak, booze, leather, tobacco.

Pours deep coffee with a nice tan head. Aroma presents roast malt, coffee, bourbon and woody tones with an earthy hint. Flavor yields rich roast malt, bourbon, chocolate, woody and earthy tones - fab! Texture offers thick, viscous body and lively fizz. Come to Bourbon County!
Earlier Rating: 12/5/2014 Total Score: 4.9
Comes out of the tap rich coffee brown with a dark tan head. Rich aroma fills the nostrils with coffee, roast malt, bourbon-soaked wood, and subtle chocolate and caramel notes. This aroma screams "Drink me!" Bold flavor has rich coffe, toasty malt, sharp bourbon, oak, and chocolate notes that roar across the palate while caramel and molasses whispers tiptoe in the background. Thick, heavy, viscous texture has a fair if not strong fizz. I have been hunting this for some time, and he has been - ahem - a wild goose chase. Until now. This is a goose worth chasing!

Goose Island Beer Company’s Bourbon County Brand Stout 15.2% ABV 60 IBU. This imperial stout pours a opaque brownish black color with a khaki mocha colored head that dissipates rather quickly leaving some lacing on the glass. The aroma is of bourbon roasted grains vanilla and anise with hints of burnt sugar molasses toffee and oak. The flavor is of dark chocolate bourbon vanilla and oak with hints of burnt sugar dark fruits like raisins prunes figs dates dried cherries with nutty tones along with hints of char molasses tobacco coffee anise brown sugar coffee with a slight hop bitterness on the finish offsetting the sweetness nicely. The mouthfeel is full bodied with a syrupy consistency with not much carbonation and with a slight burn from the high abv. This might be the best bourbon barrel aged stout I’ve ever had it’s so complex and delicious but it’s a sipper. 9.7/10

on tap at toronto brewhouse. line of head. big bog coconut and bourbon. yielded in smell and taste. above average mouth.
Earlier Rating: 1/28/2006 Total Score: 4.4
A big beer. Very thick, full of chocolate, some wood, slight smoke, the bourbon and booziness. Knock yourself out. Rich and deep intensity of flavours, I got the caramel, coconut,. A very fine effort, a top stout. Recommend with food to give your brain more range of flavours.
Conclusion of my Take #4 Stout-themed home reception, got lucky to have tumbled on this beer recently, incredible beer. Fantastic!

Pours black, fading head.
Nose shows liquorice, cocoa, booze, coffee liqueur,, insanely sweet and rich smelling.
Flavours include coffee, coconut, chocolate, heavy booze, a bit solvent-like in the finish.

16oz bottle at the Goose Island Brewpub, Shoreditch. It’s black and thick and rich as usual. Really nice, but I’m not sure it quite deserves the hubbub. 
Earlier Rating: 11/25/2017 Total Score: 4.2
Keg at Goose Island Taproom, Balham. Thick black pour, with no head. Huge aroma of bourbon, vanilla, liquorice, leather, treacle and oak. Strong flavours of espresso, burnt malt, not too sweet vanilla and chocolate, fruit cake and prunes. Really smooth and warming with a big, boozy kick up the ass.
2019 version is exquisitely chocolatey...everything you have come to expect from Bourbon county. Absolutely delightful experience.

65cl flesje. Helder donker bruin kleur, fijne bruine schuimkraag. De geur van whisky en vanille. Smaak is zoet, whisky, chocolade, vanille en pruimen. Vol lichaam, veel koolzuur
Earlier Rating: 1/5/2019 Total Score: 5
65cl flesje. Helder donker bruin kleur, fijne romige bruine schuimkraag. De geur van whisky en chocolade. Smaak is zoet, whisky, vanille, zoethout en cacao. Vol lichaam, veel koolzuur

Wersja 2016. Aromat wyraźnie beczkowy, waniliowy,  kokosowy. Dalej czekolada, kakao, kawa, melano, paloność, alkohol. Barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta. Prawie bez piany. Smak słodki z czekoladą, melano, karmelem, kawą. Sporo alkoholu. Goryczka słodowo-alkoholowa, nieco zbyt palona i alkoholowa. Pełnia wysoka, wysycenie średnie i wyraźnie alkoholowy finisz z bogatą nutą słodową.
W wersji 2017 aromat zbliżony, choć bardziej beczkowy. W smaku bardziej gładkie,  czekoladowe, choć alkohol dalej grzeje. Zasługuje jednak na podwyższenie oceny z 3,9 na 4,3, ponieważ i piana się pojawia. Z kolei mocniejsza wersja z tego roku jest bardziej słodka, gęsta i bourbonowa. Znowu puknt wyżej.

Who on earth thinks this is 100/100? I question your judgement. It's good, but I wouldn't pass up a Dragon's Milk for one, that's for sure. Especially not at twice the price. I've never been a huge fan of Goose Island, and I think that's because of the water (water is 95% of what you brew). And I like the Bourbon Country Stout. But not that much. I think maybe because I'm not a huge fan of either nitrous or pastries, and the 2019 gives you plenty of both. The 2018 is far better than the 2019, unless you really like chocolate-flavored sugar stout. The 2019 has a gritty mouth and a sweeter scent. The 2018 is a bit smoother (and fresher) on the tongue, with more of a whiskey finish. And at these prices, I'll stick with Boulevard (try their BB Stout). Imbibe and enjoy.
The best beer that I have ever tasted. If you haven’t then you need to. The only thing that sucks is that it is so hard to find🥴!

Goose Island Bourbon County Brand Stout 15.2%. Black, complex aromas of dark chocolate, toffee, dried fruit, oaky, full bodied, dark roasted malt, bitter dark chocolate, toffee, dried fruit, bourbon, burnt sugar, vanilla, complex flavours, gorgeous smooth mouthfeel. Absolutely stunning bourbon barrel aged stout from Chicago, USA 🇺🇸
W aromacie solidny bourbon, kokos i czekolada. Niesamowicie gęste, oblepiające. Mocno kawowo czekoladowe, ze zdecydowaną beczkową wanilią. Troche sos sojowy ale nie za mocny.
2018 batch. Black pour, bourbon nose. Thick, sweet and boozy, wow; this is by far the best BA stout I’ve had!
Intense rich sucker punch mouthfeel backing up a strong flavour rounded off with booziness perfection. The sip journey is a myriad of dark fruit and chocolate.
So much history and never disappoints. Caramel, beautiful toffee, oak, yeasty. I wonder if there is an undesirable hint of acidity.
Pours like engine oil with minimal beige foam. Aroma is burnt fruit. Taste is oily bourbon and caramel/toffee. Not a massive fan.

Friday, November 1, 2019. Bottle, 454mL. 15.2%. Purchase (webshop "saveur-biere.com, FR). @Naintré with my dad ! A sparkling black beer with a medium beige foamy head ; medium retention ; light lacing. Prune, light caramel, bourbon, (alcohol). Made me feel of Pim's cake. Chocolate, light red berries. Medium to heavy round sweet, warming, light to medium dry, light fresh bitter. Good body, oily texture, soft gaseous to flat, fruity round finish. Overall, superb, delicious !

Still to this day this is by far one of my favorites to have. I opened a 2007 bottle and poured in to the glass with no head. The aroma was bourbon and chocolate. The The beer still had carbonation after all of these years and had a strong taste of bourbon.

Still holding on to my BCS Rare 2010 hoping that it will blow my mind as it did the first time in 2010.
Dark black appearance with thick lacing. Strong bourbon aroma with notes of chocolate. Bourbon taste at front and finish. Very good barrel aged beer

Aroma is coacoa nibs, licorice, dark chocolate, molasses and bourbon. Taste is dark, thick malts, caramel, chocolate, molasses and coacoa nibs. A nice warm licorice finish is here with a nice accent of bourbon whiskey.
2018 batch. From the look to the aroma to the taste and the after taste. Amazing!

Jet black. Thin tan head. Woody bourbon aroma. Rich mouthfeel. Has chocolate flavors with vanilla overtones alongside a pleasant wood note on the finish. Lingering bitterness. Hides the quite high ABV well. Really awesome stuff.

31/12/2020. 500ml bottle. 2019 vintage, 15.2% version.
Black with a small brown head disappearing quickly. Aroma of bourbon, caramel, chocolate, leather. Taste is boozy, warming bourbon, oak, leather, chocolate, caramel, dried fruits and a hint of tobacco and vanilla. Medium-full bodied, very smooth. Fantastic BA stout, great depth of flavour, very boozy but in a good way.
9-4-9-4-19 - 4.5

20/09/2018. 500ml bottle, 2018 vintage, 15.2% version. Rating #4000.
Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of bourbon, dried fruits, chocolate, figs. Taste is sweet, chocolatey, massive dried fruits, raisins, figs, caramel, oaky, bourbon, boozy warming finish. Full bodied, viscous, very smooth. For 15+% the booziness is quite well tempered. A truly spectacular beer.
9-4-9-5-18 - 4.5
Wspomnienia z degustacji podczas epickiego panelu który odbył się 14.09.2019 r. :)
Pours dark with thin head.  Aroma of chocolate and strong bourbon.  Flavor a little to bourbon boozy for new.  Sweet sticky finish.

Great bourbon barrel stout.  2017 vintage just a bit more pleasing to me than 2016 or 2018.  Strong caramel and coffee overtones with hint of bourbon.  Long lasting finish.  Like to mix with a hoppy IPA about .25 to 1 to tone down aftertaste.

Butelka wersja 2018 (15.2% ABV):
Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, praktycznie bez piany. W zapachu wanilina, burbon, tytoń, ciemna czekolada. W ustach półsłodkie, pralinkowe, daktylowe i waniliowe, z posmakiem espresso i burbonu. Dość pełne w odbiorze, lekko alko, nisko wysycone. 4.4pkt


Butelka wersja 2016 (13.8% ABV):
Barwa czarna z brązowym refleksem, piana nieduża, szybko też znika. W zapachu wyraźna wanilina, lody czekoladowe, irysy i whisky. W smaku słodkie, mocno waniliowe, kakaowe, pralinkowe, z nutą słonego karmelu, kawy, daktyli i burbonowym finiszem. Palona, niska do średniej goryczka, niskie do średniego wysycenie, oleiste w odbiorze.

Chyba jeszcze fajniejsze, bardziej ułożone od wersji 2018. 4.6pkt

500ml bottle. 2018 vintage. (15.2% ABV) Pours an opaque black with a small, creamy, short lived, brown head that laces. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, caramel, bourbon, oak, vanilla and light smoke. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, caramel, licorice, bitter coffee, vanilla, oak and mild smoke in a dry, bourbon warming finish. Full body with a thick, creamy, oily texture and soft carbonation. Lots of complexity, great for sipping. A world-class Impy.
Malt chocolate caramel aroma. Dark brown colour poor head and lacing. Malt caramel chocolate flavour with bourbon aftertaste. Smooth lingering palate.
Bottle. Deep, dark brown with a light brown head. Aroma was complex, with dark roasted grains, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is mocha, vanilla and malty good.

Acheté au Beverage Boss à New-Haven lors de mon périple au États-Unis avec ma charmante copine. Cette bière est exquise !! Elle est d’un noire très opaque avec une mousse brune sublime mais malheureusement très éphémère. Au nez, des arômes de chocolat noir, de bourbon avec une pointe de mélasse. En bouche, des notes de vanille, de caramel et de chocolat s’accorde à merveille !! Vers la fin, le goût du bourbon viens nous réchauffer l’âme. Cela faisait longtemps que je n’avais pas découvert une bière aussi incroyable. Cette application me l’avais suggéré avec une note quasi parfaite (Et avec raison). Il s’agit d’une des meilleures bières que j’ai goûté. J’espère pouvoir remettre la main sur une ou deux bouteilles un jour.

Shared bottle (2018, 15.2% abv) w/Stephen for S&S Festival of 50. In porter glass, pours near black w/tan head. Black cherry & roast malt feature in aroma and rich taste. Sweetness seaps through bitter choc backbone.

1 American Pint (cca 500ml) bottle (14,1%) as 2017 Release bottled 14/07/2017 from trade with Werckmeister, huge thanks man, my #4800, #190 from USA.
F: no real only fragments of thin tanned film.
C: black, opaque.
A: very complex, chocolate, bit smoked tones, coffee, vanilla, bit sherry, spicy, liquorice, perfumed.
T: rich chocolate, bit sherry, vanilla, light woody tannins, smoked tones, bit coffee, dark caramel, bit warming alcohol, raisins, dark dried fruits, oily mouthfeel, nice full complex body, almost no carbonation, very good balanced as I expected, great one, fully enjoyed.
Smell of burnt toffee and caramel, rich in colour and flavour. Strong aftertaste. Not my favourite stout but worth trying.

Wow, was not expecting it to be this good (even given the ratings). This is smooth on the palate, with those bourbon tones playing out real nice. Heavy tho, not one you can drink a lot of bit definitely one to savour.

16.9 oz. bottle. 2017 on the neck label. Pours a deep black color. No light coming through when held up. Aroma is toffee, wood, alcohol and dried fruit. Brief tan head. Full bodied. Flavor  follows the aroma with the dried fruit. The underlying alcohol makes it presence known after the swallow. Sticky mouthfeel. Some of the wood comes out after the swallow as well. Excellent!!!

1 pint .9 fl. Oz. Bottle.

I have tried the last 3 years of vintage (2017, 2018, and 2019) and have rated each vintage separately as I tried them.  Although, with the exception of a few tasting notes and the alcohol content, I can't say that there has been much difference between the vintages.  This is (and apparently always will be) a big, boozy, beer that is extremely sweet.  I enjoy it immensely, but I do find that the syrupy sweetness becomes a little overpowering by the time I am finishing the beer.  Basically, it is liquid candy for adults!!

2019 Vintage (18AUG24) - 14.7% abv
AROMA (9):   Big, boozy notes of soy sauce, vanilla, and alcohol with some slight smoke undertones.

APPEARANCE (4): Pours an opaque black with a weak, dark tan, head that dissipates quickly.  Granted, I am drinking this almost 2 years after the bottled date, but given that the label says that it develops in the bottle up to 5 years, I would expect more body and life from the head.  Lacing is almost non-existent too.

TASTE (7): Very sweet with huge flavors of dark fruit (e.g. raisins) and caramel, with just a hint of vanilla and smoke on the back end.

MOUTHFEEL (4): Thick bodied with a creamy smooth texture.  Carbonation is average and the finish is medium and sweet.

OVERALL (18): I really like this beer but it is almost too sweet for my tastes.  Even though the alcohol content is less, I am really not detecting any difference between this and the 2018 vintage.  I would prefer it if this one were less sweet and had more smokiness.  Or at least something to offset all that sweetness.


2018 Vintage (17SEP18) - 15.2% abv
AROMA (9):   Big notes of soy sauce, vanilla, and alcohol with some slight smoke undertones.

APPEARANCE (4): Pours an opaque black with a weak, dark tan, head that dissipates quickly.

TASTE (7): Very sweet with flavors of dark fruit (e.g. raisins) and caramel, with just a hint of smoke on the back end.

MOUTHFEEL (4): Thick bodied with a creamy smooth texture.  Carbonation is average and the finish is medium and sweet.

OVERALL (18): I really like this beer but it is almost too sweet for my tastes.  Compared to the 2017 vintage, this one seems to have even less smoky flavor, and the 2017 didn't have much to begin with.  I would prefer it if this one were less sweet and had more smokiness.


2017 Vintage (04AUG17).
AROMA (9):   Big notes of soy sauce, caramelized brown sugar, alcohol, and dark fruits (e.g. raisins).

APPEARANCE (4): Pours an opaque black with a weak, dark tan, head that dissipates quickly.

TASTE (7): Very sweet with flavors of dark fruit and caramel, with just a hint of smoke on the back end.

PALATE (4): Thick bodied with a creamy smooth texture.  Carbonation is average and the finish is short and sweet.

OVERALL (18): I really like this beer but it is almost too sweet for my tastes.  I would prefer it if it were a little less sweet and had just a pinch more smokiness.  But all in all, a fantastic beer.  I can’t wait to try the 2018 vintage to see how it compares!
I enjoy stouts and barrel aged beers. However, this beer was too heavy and sweet. It tasted more like a syrup, not a beer. It was rediculously expensive and disappointing.

Absolutnie urywa wszystko, co może urywać. Pita wersja 2017, 14.7% alkoholu. Gęste, smoła, z beżową pianą. Aromat wywala z butów - prawdopodobnie najlepszy profil beczki, z jakim miałem do czynienia. Kokos, kandyzowany cukier, cukier muscovado, praliny, wanilia, ekstremalnie słodko i intensywnie. Bardzo gęste, syropowate, wszystko to co w aromacie, mega długa gorzka czekolada, kawa, mnóstwo kokosa znowu. Goryczka również konkretna, aczkolwiek całe piwo bardzo mocno po stronie #teamsłodyczka. Niesamowicie gładkie, wysycenie bardzo minimalne, no po prostu niesamowite.

Absolutely flawless. Super dark body that is salty like soya sauce with well balanced vanilla sweetness. Carbonation is just right, palate is clean and the best thing about this all... The warm bourbon burn. Just delicious!

2017 release. Aromas of sweet dark fruit and molasses. Big flavor with boozy dark fruit and hop notes. Nice rich mouthfeel. Aftertaste is boozy and hoppy. Great beer, if you like strong, sweet imperial stouts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle, 2017 vintage, April 14th 2019. Pours pitch black with a dark tan cap. Chocolate, dark chocolate, walnuts, coffee, raspberry, cherry, strong vanilla, fudge, not much booze and a controlled sweetness. Thick fudgy body. Incredible. 
 On tap at Rattle N Hum West, 2014 version, May 12th 2019. Pours black. Chocolate, bourbon, sweet vanilla, little coffee, lots of cherry, raspberry, redcurrant, blueberry, big roast. Great body, not quite as thick as the 2017 bottle though. Flavour is potentially better. 4.6 still correct but would shift to 9/5/10/4/18 for this one.
[2018] Bottle at home. Dark dark brown and headless. Smoky appearance. Scent is big, gorgeous, juicy caramel notes. Taste is huge caramel brownie sweetness. Finish is clean. Great beer.
2012 version. Huge bourbon aroma. Dries fruits dominate on the palate. Have been saving it for a few yrs.
All kinds of cherries and dried fruit, dates and just a bit of port, definetly a big beer, not quite black and a bit oily, a little too sweet but fits the abv. This is on Tap at Wexford Pub.
2018 batch. Huge bourbon aroma straight away, followed by super thick body and boozy chocolate at the end

No complaints here....just is super-sweet and STRONG!  More of a dessert beer.  Neighbor who works at Total Wine & More was lucky enough to bring one home and shared.   Probably could split this 3-4 ways, as it adds up after a few sips.  Heavy bourbon aroma up front. Flavor is the same...whiskey, smoke, chocolate, coffee, molasses, etc.  I could see this being better with age though.

22 oz bottle, 2018.  Pours black with tall, long lasting, creamy, brown head and nice lacing.  Aroma is of chocolate malt, toast, dark fruit, bourbon, vanilla and spices.  Body is full, creamy and smooth.  Taste is of bourbon, nutty, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, brown sugar, dark fruit, vanilla and spices.  Finish is long, massive and spicy. Delicious brew.
Black color, no foam. Sweet alcohol and chocolate aroma. Very alcoholy strong and sweet taste. Too strong, too sweet for me. I don't get why this beer has so huge rating. It's really hard to drink.

Svart med fingerhøyt lys brunt skum. Lukter fat, eik, vanilje, bourbon, blomster, mørk sjokolade, kokos og melasse. Fyldig. Lett bitterhet, mørk sjokolade, søt kakedeig,, vanilje, salt lakris. Tykk, fløyelsmyk. Lang, alkoholvarmen sitter lenge.

Ciemnobrunatne prawie czarne nieprzezroczyste piwo z niezłą beżową pianą, która opadając nie zdobi szkła. Aromat intensywny na pierwszym planie bourbon z czekoladą, potem wanilia i ciemne suszone owoce, w tle nuty palone i trochę kawy. W smaku mocarne, króluje bourbon z deserową czekoladą, trufle czekoladowe, karmel i ciemne owoce. Posmak kawy i słodow palonych. Finisz wytrawny przełamany słodyczą, lekko alkoholowy. Ogólnie super piwo, ścisła czołówka imperialnych stoutow
B2018. Pięknie pachnie wanilią i czystym kakao. W smaku potężna dawka gorzkiej czekolady, pralin, wanilii. Wysoka pełnia idzie w parze z wytrawnością, ładny balans i tylko nieco alkoholowe.

2018 batch. Pours a lovely black with little brown head. Nose is vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and maybe a hint of caramel. The caramel is far more pronounced in the taste, it runs through drink and lingers after. The malt and bourbon come in to start but fade as the chocolate and vanilla emerge. Full bodied. Hides the booze fairly well. It's a little on the sweet side but is otherwise entirely lovely. This is a good beer and I'd buy more next time I see it.

50 cl bottle (2018) split with Gyhallmanti, A3aan_uit and Emjolnir. Appearance: pitchblack with medium sized beige head. Aroma: bourbon, smoke, coffee, roasted malts, some vanilla, some red fruits even. Taste: high sweetness and pretty high bitterness. Notes of roasted malts, lots of dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, red fruits/cherry, some smoke and a hint of almonds. Palate: full bodied, creamy and sticky texture, and soft carbonation. Warming and fruity finish. Overall: lovely, just lovely. Intense yet much more smooth and refined than other stouts. The fruitiness is remarkable

50cl bottle split with SimonBlok, a3aan_uit and emjolnir. Pours jet black colour with almost no head. Aroma of roasted malt, raisins, plums, caramalt, vanilla, bourbon, oak. Taste is medium to full sweet, medium bitter with a medium dry finish. Notes of roasted malt, dark malt, syrup, slight kirsch, oak, slight vanilla, candy sugar. Texture is thick, full bodied with soft carbonation

Real dark beer. Rich cocoa smell with a hint of vanilla. Just enough carbonation for a good mouthfeel. The taste is a rich and sweet cocoa taste with a vanilla twist. At the same time there is a hint of cherry to it. All in all a very good and tasty special beer.

Courtesy of @Simonblok drank with @emiel @gyhallmanti. Smell: not as intense as I had hoped. Appearance: pitch jet black. No foam. Taste: dark chocolate and rich cherry notes. Long finish buttery you feel in the back of your throat. Palate: THICC

Old rating rerated 09.02.2019, 12 oz bottle (2012 vintage) @ home:

Nice light brown slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head, deep dark pour. Aroma is rich and sweet boozy, dark sugar, dark malts, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, oak, "knekk", nuts, toast, bark, burnt caramel, mocha, old rope. Taste is sweet sour-ish boozy, dark sugar, mild bourbon, oak, dark malts, vanilla, old rope, bark, toast, nuts, burnt caramel, coffee, soil. Medium bitterness, sweet boozy mouthfeel. I say god-damn what a rush...

1pt 9 fl oz bottle from Beer Hawk. 2017 Vintage. Rating #4500. Pours black-brown in colour, with a brown foamy head that diminishes and aroma of bourbon, sweet malt & caramel, vanilla, oak barrel, fruity, booze. Flavour is mellow sweet, bourbon, chocolate malty, molasses, caramel, vanilla, dark fruits, liquorice, woody, oak barrel, with earthy spicy boozy bitterness. Silky smooth mouthfeel, full bodied, soft carbonation, dry roasty fruity bitter finish. Nicely complex, very drinkable.
Pours black thin head smell of coffee roasted malts vanilla dark chocolate can definitely smell the alcohol taste roasted malts coffee chocolate vanilla get that kick of alcohol at the end

Ca 50cl (49,9 pint) flesje via Hopt
Alcoholpercentage van 15,2%
Uitgeschonken in Brand Porter glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met cremelaag die snel weer wegtrekt 

Aroma en smaak: neus is vol vanille, bourbon, smaak is vanille, bourbon, gebrande mouten, warm van de alcohol, eiken, zoet van karamel

Conclusie: hoge verwachting, ingewilligd

Aroma: roasted malt, caramel, vanilla. 
Taste: roasted malt, vanilla, hints of dried fruits.

Fles van Hopt.nl U: Zwart met een dunne beige schuimkraag. G: Vanille, bourbon, houtskool, geroosterd, tikje gerookt, donker fruit en alcohol. S: Zoet met wat moutbitterheid. Geroosterd, tikje gerookt, donker fruit, bourbon en vanille. Alcoholwarmte. M: Volmondig, licht sticky en lichte carbonatie.

500ml bottle, 2018 vintage. Poured an opaque black fading to deep brown at the edges. Minimal head leaving a sparse ring of tan foam. Rum, bourbon, raisin, prune, blackberry, espresso, roasted malt, dark chocolate. Flavours echo the aroma with a noticeable vanilla overtone and liquorice. Full body, medium carbonation, an oily, palate-coating full body and lingering finish of both bourbon and espresso.

Botella 66 cl del Gato que bebía cerveza Valladolid tomada en Valladolid 15..01..2019. Edición 2018. Embotellado en 10..7..2018. (r2856). Color negro intenso con poca espuma beige oscuro que desaparece al poco casi por completo. Aromas y sabores intensos destacando sobretodo bourbon. Toques maltosos tostados, vainillas y cierto dulzor de caramelo tostado. Notas de maderas algo carbonizadas, alicoradas y con una sensación alcohólica enorme desde el principio. Cuerpo intenso, alicorado, fino poco denso y con mucho sabor. Muy alicorada con 15 2 maravillos vol. y con mucho sabor. Perfecta vamos.. Todo un cervezon y más aún ara los amantes del bourbon.. Para repetir sin duda alguna.

2017 versie (14.1% ABV) Vol dik, Romig en gitzwart! De schuimkraag is zeer snel weg... niet raar met 14.1 procentjes. Super smooth en zacht en warm. volledig in balans. Oak met zuurtje, Bourbon/vanille, vol choco, Donker fruit en zwarte bes.... hint van zoethout en black molasses. Dit blijft gewoon smaken .... de nasmaak is mega lang. Mooie roasty bitter en zeer lang dat mooie hout achtige met vanille. wat een topper.... deze maakt alles waar wat er over gezegd wordt! Ronduit heerlijk.... Wel een zipper.... behoorlijk stevig en warm. ik ga deze gewoon de volle 5 geven !! Why not !

2018 batch. Since it didn't require any chasing around this year with plenty on the shelf, I decided to buy a couple; one to drink, one for the cellar. Aroma is whiskey with roasted malts, caramel, vanilla, dark fruits. Deep black with just a slight brown tinge around the edges with a back light. Short tan head dies quickly to a ring with an island in the middle. No lacing. Thick, chewy, substantial body initially on the tongue. Deep flavor of whiskey, roasty raisins, caramel, vanilla, and alcohol. Sweet and delicious. The finish is mild (low bitterness) with an alcohol burn.  This stout is dangerously easy drinking and smooth. I had to keep reminding myself of the ABV... slowly, sip slowly!

1 pint bottle served in a snifter. 15.2 % abv, vintage 2018. Poured completely black as pitch with small one finger mocha tan head that dissipated immediately. Minimum carbonation. Aroma: dark chocolate, bourbon, roasted nuts, vanilla, espresso, caramel fudge, pipe tobacco, leather, charred oak, sultana, plums, licorice. Taste: Awesome! Dark bitter chocolate, roasted espresso beans, bourbon, charred oak, vanilla, caramel, fudge, toffee, raisins, plums, leather, muscovado sugar, burnt molasses, umami/soy sauce, nougat, roasted chestnuts, sultana, brown sugar, ginger, chocolate milk, dates, Perique pipe tobacco. Chewy, silky and oily mouthfeel. Full body with roasted bittersweet finish with the bourbon complimenting it all subtly and gently in the background. Very complex. Absolutely one of the best, if not THE best imperial stout I ever had the pleasure of tasting. Completely blown away by this piece of dark art, what a beautiful experience...

New Years Day tradition to have an Imperial Stout for breakfast. Bacon, eggs, toast and Stout. 1st time I've been able to try this one. Black, Brown head. Smell chocolate, cream, dark fruits, hint of coffee, don't smell much bourbon. Taste is sweet and chocolate and the heat of the bourbon comes through. It's fine but I guess I don't get the hype.

Bottle, 2018, 15.2%. Edit 21 jan 2021: Bottle, 2017, 14,7%. Color: Black, thin beige head. Aroma: Bourbon, vanilla, roasted malt. Taste: Roasted malt, mocha, hints of chocolate. Very nicely combined with Bourbon, vanilla and boozy notes from the BA. Medium sweet, moderate to medium bitterness. Great balance, nice complexity. Creamy and warming mouthfeel.  Full body, soft carbonation. Great beer.
1/3 in tap east. Intense raisin and plum aroma. Deep, heavy mouthfeel. Delicious. Not too booze heavy. Perfect really.

2017 vintage. Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, coconut, bourbon and wood in nose. Pours black with tan head. Taste is sweet with chocolate, coffee, vanilla, roasted malts, bourbon and caramel. Medium bitter finish, soft carbonation, full body. Overall excellent sipper.

2018 bottle. Smells of dark chocolate, berries, Bourbon and coconut. Pour is pitch black. Barely any head. Taste is oaky, dark fruit, dark chocolate, Bourbon, coconut, vanilla, and finishes like melted caramel. Very good barrel aged for not needing any additional flavors or frills. Feel very lucky to finally find this bottle. Barely taste the strong alcohol.

500mL bottle from Bucket Boys, Sydney
15.2%abv Bottled 31AUG18
Pitch black, thick, scary, ominous, deep tan head dissipates.
Wow - aroma is insane - fuckloads of rich dark roast coffee, cocoa, milo, dark brown sugar, bourbon is intense - lots of toasted coconut, dried fruits, biscuit, vanilla for days...
Very rare to come across something of this viscosity - its unctuous, luscious, lingering, dangerously drinkable for this strength; low carbonation seems to help everything.
Big sweetness & richness, almost cakey, lots of chocolate, & bourbon, and dark sugars & raisins and prunes and brownies - it lingers, it plays, it warms the cockles of the heart - this is just sensational really!

16.9 ounce bottle at home. 2018 Bottle. Sweet scent of bourbon and malt. Pitch black in color. Beige head. No film on glass. First taste the malt, then goes into a medium bourbon taste. Bourbon after taste for sure. Thick in body. Just an amazing beer. Cheers!

Pitch black color, small brown head. Complex and heavy bourbon aromas with dark chocolate, dried figs, wood, dates, molasses, vanilla, toffee and powdered sugar. Taste of bourbon, chocolate, syrup, alcohol, molasses, arrack, dates, vanilla, dried figs and toffee. It lives up to the reputation.

Ładne czarne, beżowa piana. Mega kokos, wanilia, mleczna czekolada, choć wyczuwalna również nuta sosu sojowego. Intensywny smak. Bardzo dużo słodyczy, kokos, wanilia, praliny. Na finiszu trochę kawy, bourbon rozgrzewa w przełyku. Słodkie, pełne, gładkie. Zdecydowanie topka piw jakie piłem, choć liczyłem że urwie ciut bardziej

Nalewa się oleiste czarne, piany brak, ale to nie problem. W zapachu dominuje beczka- kokos, wanilia, drewno, marcepan. Odczucie w ustach jest pełne, bardzo słodkie ponownie na pierwszym planie kokos i wanilia.
(all dingue-dense-wow, choco-dessert, cara, bourbon, fumé, carbo super, costs an arm, ab-inbevisée ?)

Honestly, I don’t know what the big deal is with this beer. Taste like a burnt oak milkshake with 4 shots of bourbon. 

All the good ratings are made by hipster beer snobs that think they’re cool for drinking specialty beer. Btw, where are these hipsters finding $75 to buy this crap?!? Overall, this is all subjective so formulate your own opinion

On tap at Craft Centric, Asheville, NC. 2018 vintage.  Glad I got it before it disappeared! Pours nearly black with light tan head. Strong nose of bourbon, chocolate, vanilla and roasty malts. Massive taste profile, mostly sweet... additional notes of caramel, soy, raisins, figs, molasses and booze. Hides 14.7% alcohol well. Viscous, but a bit thinner than expected. Low carbonation is a setback.  It's hard to believe this is a beer... it's more like a sauce or an elixir.  Still one of the best of its kind on the planet. Hip Hip Hooray!

God damn this is good. I have been putting this off for far too long. I really dont know why. I coach my sons hockey team and this weekend we won our first tournament with me behind the bench. I broke open a 2014. Pours engine oil black, viscous liquid with a small brown head. Aroma is big bourbon sweetness, roasted malt. Taste is sweet, succulant, just plain beautiful bourbon, pairs awesomely well with the roasted malt. Warming alcohol bite and some bitterness from the hops. Awesome!

2017 from tap at Shoreditch taproom. Complex, rich, velvety, notes of caramel, nuts, chocolate, fudge, vanilla. Aftertaste that lingers forever, with a smoothness that touch every single one of your taste buds.

2018, 15.2% version. Black pour, minimal head, minimal lacing. Aroma dominantly raisin, followed by chocolate. Syrupy mouth feel, extra sweet, a boatload of vanilla but still an abundance of flavors beyond that. The alcohol comes through in the aftertaste. Really good.

Draft version, listed at 14.7%, part of the Black Friday celebration at Brew Belly in Olney. ALMOST lives up to the hype. Glad I just got a taster, or I'd have been in trouble. Also picked up a bottle of the 2018 version, which lists the abv as 15.2%. Looking forward to that one.

2018 14.7%. Sweet caramel vanilla aroma.Woody. Cherry. Bourbon booze a bit. Cocoa. Taste is rich, velvety smooth, sweet and balance. Marshmallow toasted. Licorice. Rich caramel,dark chocolate, not super boozy. Really nice. First time for me,sold behind the counter of course.
2018 Edition on tap. Smells like caramelised bourbon fruit cake. Thick and dark, with warmth from the high alcohol. Great for a special occasion

I was one of the first to try this beer. And I won’t be the last. In fact, I feel like people all around the world will be lining up for this incredible vanilla, coffee, tobacco feast of a stout. It’s goddamn amazing.

I have had this beer several times over several years. I've found it consistently amazing, as much as it pains me to say that since this is an InBev product (but this certainly isn't Budweiser!). The bottles I've had in recent years have clocked in at 15.2% alcohol -- and the boozy warmth at the finish is indicative of that. This 16-ounce bottle (bought for a very fair price of $10.99 at a local beer purveyor, Richard's Bait and Tackle) pours pitch black with some brown highlights; while there's a trace of brown lacing, there's no head. Aroma: prune juice, molasses, smoke. Flavor: figs, dates, prunes, raisins, well-roasted campfire marshmallows, blackstrap molasses, vanilla beans, dark chocolate-covered toasted coconut, espresso bean, dark chocolate, wooden char, bourbon. Mouthfeel: full-bodied, thick, almost a chewing beer, with an oily and slick finish. I started drinking Goose Island beers long before they bottled and long before they were in bed with InBev (about which I feel guilty even supporting, but this stout is just really good beer). I discovered Goose Island when they were a smallish brewpub in a pre-gentrified part of Chicago. All that has changed, yet they are still making some decent beer, and some of it is excellent. This Bourbon County Stout is evidence of that.

Jakby ktoś wrzucił mleczną czekoladę do beczki po bourbonie. W smaku ogrom mlecznej czekolady, kokos, wanilia, nuty beczkowe, do tego lekki orzech laskowy. Gęste, gładkie i aksamitne. Jak na woltaż to mega ułożone. Piękne piwo !

Draught. 2016. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma is bourbon, caramel, vanilla, light chocolate, some fruit, and a touch of oak [8.5/10]. Taste is bourbon, chocolate, light fruit, oak, roast, vanilla, caramel, and light molasses. Full body. Soft-to-moderate carbonation. Sticky, creamy mouthfeel.
More likely to feel at home on the shelves of the local Caltex next to a 4L bottle of Castrol Activ 15W-50.

2017 14.1%
Aroma: Caramel, smoke, wood, chocolate, vanilla, rye bread, hazelnuts, cacao, cranberry. Very strong bourbon and whisky notes.

Appearance: Opaque dark brown, nice tan head.

Taste: Sweet, medium bitterness, somewhat boozy, some roasted malt acidity.

Palate: Very smooth, oily, thick, full body, fantastic mouthfeel. Low carbonation.

Overall: Amazing imperial stout, chocolatey base with tremendous bourbon influence. Obviously, it is a bit boozy, but it's not that bad for 14.1%.

2018 14.7%
Aroma: Caramel, chocolate, cacao, cranberry, booze, coconut, vanilla. Strong whisky notes.

Appearance: Opaque dark brown, nice tan head.

Taste: Sweet, bitter, roasted acidity. Quite boozy.

Palate: Great mouthfeel. Thick, smooth, full body.

Overall: More boozy than 2017 version, apart from that very similar. Still an amazing BBA imperial stout. Recommended!

2017 14.7%
Aroma: Vanilla, bourbon, coconut, chocolate, cocoa, almond, nuts. Exquisite.

Appearance: Opaque black, no foam.

Taste: Slightly sour, medium bitterness, sweet.

Palate: Thick and silky, low carbonation.

Overall: Fantastic, surprisingly not much alcohol in taste. The best BCBS I have tried so far. More nutty and chocolatey than younger versions.

2018 15.2%
Aroma: Coconut, whisky, bourbon, wood, cocoa, coffee, liquorice, some alcohol.

Appearance: Opaque black, minimal head.

Taste: Sweet, slightly boozy, average bitterness.

Palate: Smooth, full body, low carbonation.

Overall: Another great BCBS, pure class.

2019 15.2%
Aroma: Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, wood.

Appearance: Black, some brown foam.

Taste: Medium bitterness, sweet, boozy.

Palate: Smooth, full body, average carbonation.

Overall: Quite boozy, less impressive aroma than in older versions. Still good though.

Larger bottle as a gift from Highendtully. Shared in a snifter glass. Deep black color with minimal, almost non-existent head. Aroma is vanilla and chocolate with maybe a hint of caramel. Nose sets up alcohol presence forthcoming. Taste is big and boozy. Plenty of vanilla and chocolate coming through as advertised in the aroma. Alcohol felt but mellows as it warms. Bourbon definitely plays a role. This is ridiculously delicious. A sipping beer for sure.

Bottle.  2017 edition.  Thick black pour with only a small khaki ring for a head.  Aroma is spicy with soy, earth, dark cocoa, molasses, oak, nuts, vanilla, and booze.  14.7% abv is warming but not hot.  Big on chocolate and earthy flavor.  Lingering bitter and herbal flavor.  Sweet with vanilla, dark sugars, and prune.  Is thick and nearly syrupy, especially after well into the bottle.  Tastes linger and develop.

Wspomnienie - wersja 2017

Pyszności, pięknie gęste, dużo czekolady, wiórki kokosowe, trochę kawy, intensywne w opór.
Fajny, słodki, beczka, duzo czekolady, trochę gorzkiej. Wiurki kokosowe. Dużo ciała, nie zalega, kwaśna kawa. Świetne.

Extreme chocolate cake, cocoa, some coconut even, wooden barrel, vanilla, just lovely. Pitch black oily color with medium sized brown head. Oh gawd, that's the earthy tone i like about imperial stouts. Alcohol is fascinating well hidden. Chocolate, cocoa, barrel, vanilla. Full body, soft to flat carbonation, creamy, really creamy, oily, no alcohol warming. Unbelievable. //bottle thanks to Veco

568ml bottle from beerhawk.co.uk. Black colour with small brown head. Big sweet dark roasted malts, big sweet bourbon barrel, wood barrel, big sweet milk chocolate ice cream, vanilla beans, mocha ice cream, espresso, dark fruits, bourbon soaked dark chocolate cake, sweet coffee liqueur, light cinnamon, light set honey, pralines, light banana candy, dark chocolate brownies, brown sugar, light dark cherry, so much bourbon here. Body is like motor oil. Extremely complex + well balanced, super long aftertaste, somehow barely any booze despite being 14.1% abv - wow, this lives up to the hype. The barrel is maybe the best thing about this one, apparently this is the first BA imp stout and this still might be the best example of barrel ageing I've seen in a beer - the bourbon barrel is extremely rich but never gets too cloying or overpowers the base beer. Apparently the base beer was purposefully made to compliment the bourbon barrel and it shows. A lot of recent imp stouts can feel to me like they've just been barrel aged because that's what everyone does with their imp stouts these days, everything about this one feels really deliberate though. Now I really want to try a version of this from before AB InBev bought Goose Island or one of the special editions, pretty sure I'll never see either of those though.

Poured from a bottle. Typical stout look and aroma. Taste is probably a little less than average for a barrel aged stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black with a brown head - Good malt and wood, bourbon aroma - DArk malt body with bourbon and a spicy wood flavour - The dark malt bourbon and wood goes into the finish - This was real good
I had this at Brewoomba beer festival on 4 August 2018 at Goose Island Beer College and it certainly lives up to the hype. Cannot fault this beer in anyway.

Pours very dark with almost no foam. Smells wonderful, bourbon, prunes, raisins, tobacco, leather, and more. Have to wait a few minutes to let it get to temperature. First taste is complex but the alcohol does not overpower. Vanilla, brown sugar, caramel, roasted malt, bourbon. As it warms, the alcohol becomes more upfront. This is a great beer.

Taster form bottle, vintage 2017, courtesy of Sander, many thanks! Pours a nearly black red-brown with a tan colored head. Aroma of mild bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, raisins, brown sugar and some alcohol. Full body with a medium sweetness and a light to medium bitterness. Flavor of bourbon and sweetish roasted malt - chocolate, lots of nuts, molasses, brown sugar, vanilla, coffee, some tobacco, earthy. Finishes with a light roasty bitterness, coffee and nice bourbon notes, which are more present than in the aroma. Hardly any alcohol for the relatively high ABV. Overall very tasty and smooth with nice notes of sweetish roasted malt and lovely bourbon aromas. Very good.



Aroma: 9 
Appearance: 4 
Taste: 8 
Palate: 4 
Overall: 18

29-06-18 // taster at the Farewell Tasting for Cris. Cheers to you mate! 2017 bottle thanks to a trade with Jdizzle1.Perfect. Still top class. The creaminess, the chocolate sweetness, the bourbon barrel.

Draft third of 2017 at Beer Hawk South Bank. A deep, dark beer in the glass with a little head and some lacing. The nose was malt, vanilla, whisky and alcohol. The taste was all of those, but with the volume turned up to 11! In fact, all those flavours were a bit overpowering when combined with the rich and juicy mouthfeel. All very nice, but I was glad when it was over...... At least it wasn't overly sweet, but it was lacking some subtlety.

Bottle shared at beer merchants tap. Lovely. Aroma is sweet, maple, vanilla, pancake, brown sugars. A thick mahogany brown coloured pour with a tan head. Aroma is sweet, brown sugars, vanilla, maple, pancake,, rum barrel.. Palate is medium sweet. Moderate carbonation. Thick and sticky.,
2017 Bottle: Black color with an aroma of brown sugar, vanilla, and booze. Sweet flavors of sweet malts with lots of alochol. Mild chocolate finish. An absolutely amazing beverage.

Draft (2017). Pours dark brown-black with thin, tan head. Bread crust, vanilla, and oak on the nose. Rich, sweet bread crust malt with subtle chocolate notes upfront. Vanilla and some citrus follows with a touch of alcohol in the long finish. Viscous, and somewhat oily mouthfeel. Excellent.
2015 bottle from my friend in Charleston....what a beer..pours thick and dark...vanilla, caramel, etc...delicious

Very smooth. No overwhelming buttery, oak, or bourbon barrel tastes like I've come to expect with other bourbon-barrel brews. Nice sweetness and chocolate notes balance a mild bourbon-alcohol flavor profile which masks the high ABV very well. I highly recommend this brew!

Very strong aromas of vanilla, caramel, oak and just alcohol generally. Thick, engine oil texture, full body. The flavours that really came through were very intense caramel and vanilla, but less of the bourbon and smoky flavour that the smell suggested. It took me 4 hours to get through this but I'm glad I got hold of this.

Aroma: coconut, vanilla, oxidation cherry notes, semi-sweet chocolate. Taste: liquor, sweet, some delicate bitter aftertaste. Carbonation is at low level. Head isn't impressive, beer is oily, black.
UPDATE: version 2017 14.7 - a bit of alc. aroma and taste, but still gentle.

Got a second bottle of the 2017 edition of Bourbon County Stout locally after picking up the first on Black Friday last year. This makes drinking the beer a higher priority than before. Not inexpensive for a 16.9 oz serving, just saying. My serving glass will be my ABGB snifter, the favorite for stouts. Do not know whose bourbon barrels were used this year, curious about it but I couldn't tell the difference anyway. The lid comes off and I will attest that this brew is fragrant, Strong alcohol, not a criticism, caramel, hard candy, woody. After the pour, a coal black body topped by a here-and-gone medium-tan head. Now the big test, holy crap, what a fine taste. Stiffly chocolate initially, the caramel shows up again, burned toast, malt, a slow burn as it goes down.Truly a great combination of the stout completed by a shot of whiskey. Touches all the bases for me. Do not know when I will have the other bottle, maybe after the release next year.

W aromacie dużo czekolady, pralin, wanilii, delikatny kokos, dębina, lekki bourbon. W smaku słodkie, praliny, wanilia. Na finiszu gorzka czekolada. Alkohol szlachetny, dość intensywne piwo, sporo ciała.

Barwa czarna nieprzejrzysta i brak pianki. W aromacie suszona sliwka, rodzynki i przyjemna palonosc (dobrze doslodzone wloskie espresso), poza tym duzo pralinek, migdalow, debiny. Klasa. W smaku przyjemna palonosc, duzo migdalowych i bourbonowych nut + wanilia. Cialo takie akurat oleiste. Mega klasa. Mokre drewno. Swietny lezakowany ris i zasluzona swiatowa czolowka.
Dark fruit, coffee, chocolate and coffee liqueur on the nose. Palate so silly and beautiful. Big but worth resting on. Boom!

2012 vintage bottle, thanks Mike! Aroma is crazy bourbon barrel, full of coconut, vanilla, wood, some dark chocolate, dark fruits. Taste is intense, sweet but not very, gives quite warming feeling. Smooth, not very dense, lots of chocolate, some coffee, dark fruits, bourbon, a tiny alcoholic note.

Bottle pour into tulip glass from Whole Foods, Lynnfield (2017 vintage). Appearance is opaque black with nice sparkle at the sides of the glass, ephemeral reddish-light-brown head and no lacing. Aroma is dark fruit, dark chocolate, wood, subtle bourbon, roasted malt. Taste is richer dark chocolate than the aroma, dark fruit, bourbon, late roasted coffee. Palate is medium-to-full bodied with silky smooth texture, soft carbonation, pleasant alcohol warmth and sweet chocolatey, fruity finish. Overall, perhaps letting it age more would have given even more nuance (just couldn't wait), but nice richness and complexity and balance without going over the top in any direction.

Delicious stout. The bourbon barrels really smooths it out. Great beer for such a big brewery. We love it! Cheers.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2017. Inky Black pour with a thin light brown head. Aroma is a huge blast of chocolate, bourbon, and molassess. Syrupy molasses and toasted caramel assault your tongue with a hint of smoke. Finish is alcoholic heat and sweetness. Oily thick mouthfeel perfectly appropriate for the beer. This is good.
Aroma full of bourbon barrel, vanilla,sweet dark chocolate.Taste is very complex ,bourbon,vanilla,chocolate liqueur,cocoa, sticky,oily, warming alcohol,perfect.
Older vintages are head and shoulders better than newer years. At it's best, this beer is the standard by which all BA Imperial Stouts should be measured.

Aroma: bourbon, roasted dark malts, bitter chocolate, vanilla, caramel, dried red fruits.
Appearance: jet black and brown head.
Taste: bourbon barrel, vanilla, rich dark chocolate, cocoa, oily, warming alcohol, velvet, semi-sweet.
Palate: full body and medium carbonation.
Overall: what a great rich RIS, intensive bourbon notes, bitter chocolate.

Dark , rich, very complex stout. Pronounced flavors of malt, caramel, dry fruit with notes of bourbon. Delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, 2017 year version (14,1%). Thank you Justing for sharing this. Pours dark brown, almost black. Some light brown foam there but not too much. Soft toffee nose, light booze and toffee mixed, liquid chocolate with some vanilla. Taste is interestingly spicy, good heat and nice cocoa there. Bourbon vanilla and booze is strong and warming.

Fat @ Milk and Hops - Chelsea, NYC. 2017 version. Svart med ett litet men beständigt beige skum. Dofter av bourbon, karamell, choklad och vanilj. Smakinslag av choklad, bourbon, läder, karamell, russin och jord. Stor och fin kropp. Oljig munkänsla. En makalöst god öl.
2016. Rasins, cocoa, chocolate, rum, plums. Very nice and complex. Quite heavy, sweet. One of the best, if not the best, I ever had.

Vanilla, oak, smoked, chocolate, dark fruits, dates and raisins, dark malts, black with a thin beige head, full body, oily, low carbonation, an explosion of bourbon and hundreds of other sensations....there are many whales outhere but i think that this boy can still compete.

2017 was much better than 2016 well rounded and great mouthfeel only wish it was a little less boozy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2017 vintage. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of dark fruit, oak, chocolate, and smoke. Taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter.

2016 vintage. Massive, giant stout, no less potent or fierce for having fifteen months on the shelf, a glorious burst of chocolate syrup, caramel, anise, black cherry, currant, and oh so much bourbon. Sweet—more so than I’m usually willing to accept—yet the stark oak-and-hop bitterness never allows any cloyness to set in, while the bourbon never asserts itself to the point of overtaking every aspect of the beer. Lovely pint, probably why I’m going to be napping through the second half of the Super Bowl.

Bottle. 2012. Oak, bourbon, chocolate, toffee, dried fruit. Full bodied. Strong, but very well balanced. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: Strong oxidation notes - dark fruit, maybe a very mild soy sauce, bourbon barrels, vanilla, wood, chocolate and cocoa, pretty sweet aroma, very very intensive. Appearance: BLack body, low head, creamy and brownish. Taste: Wow, that's something, so full and sweet, rich, some roasted bitter notes. Palate: A very long sweet finish, low carbonation, very high body.

1/14/18
Had on draft at Whole Food Pub in Plymouth Meeting waiting on Abby at D&B. 

Dangerous looking jet black with a tiny brow head. 

Nose is big chocolate and cherry dark molasses malt. Smells big. 

Taste is very bourbon-like. Chocolate + dark fruit, caramel and vanilla with a noticeable alcohol presence. Sweet and not very bitter. 

Palate is medium with little carbonation. This is definitely a slow sipper. 

Overall, this is the biggest, most flavorful beer I’ve ever had and definitely both different and exceptional. Too much to have often, but wow! This is a hell of a beer.
This a great imperial stout for sipping and just enjoying the deep rich flavors of bourbon barrel age stout beer. It's time to have a fire, sitback and enjoy a great beer that Americans makes.

2017 bottle bought in Australia, shared in Japan. Pours a deep olive brown, little highlights, next to no head. Sweet bourbon aroma, well pronounced but not overpowering, dark malts, vanilla, caramel, a little burnt note and light smoke. Really ace flavour with barrel oak and vanilla popping, plenty of sweet booze and caramel balanced with dry savoury malt notes. As it warms it reveals layer upon layer, really deep complex notes. Super smooth feel, almost flat, flavours spreading over the palate, no burn just warmth. No need to age this, it's perfect right now, ace balance and depth. Loved it.

This is hard to come by in New York's capital region... until the end of 2017 when it seemed everyone had it. Having known about this brew for some time, it did not disappoint. Even a friend who is not eager about craft brews simply gushed over its flavor. There's coffee, roasty, caramel, herbs, leather, earthy, raisin, smoke, vanilla, and the most wonderful mouthfeel ever.

1st of 2 2017 bottles, drinking 1/8/18. Pours a dark, dark brown with no head. Nose is big - has a boozy smell, with some black licorice. Taste is huge - chocolate is the strongest, but there is also some vanilla, and you can taste the hop backbone but it remains very smooth the whole time. The alcohol is really well hidden. It’s really good but a drop too syrupy. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Jet black pour, no head. Nose of bourbon, rich malt and vanilla. Taste follows with a big bourbon presence but not too much. Very nicely blended and no flavor stands out. Creamy mouthfeel with a boozy finish. Superb
Solid 5 for sure! One of the best barrel aged stouts I’ve had. It only comes around the Corona area near Black Friday.
A great stout,  bourbon,  chocolate,  vanilla,  char, raisins, hard to get out here in San Jose,  shows up around black Friday,  doesn't last long.  Very enjoyable.
this is the holy fucking best stout i have tasted amazing body and aroma huge chocolate

Vintage 2012, strax över 5 år gammal, 15%. Stort tack Simon för flaskan! Kolsvart med en liten beige krona, och knappt det. Doft och smak av toffee, kandisocker, bourbon, fat, kokos, choklad och massor av viol och vingummi. Fortfarande ruskigt potent alkoholpunch trots att den stått till sig fem år. Ruskigt fin och välbalanserad och samtidigt märkbart att det är en större imp stout. Håller ihop väldigt fint och är definitivt en kvalitetsstout, även om det idag kanske finnas mycket som kan utmana den. Smaskigt!
Pours a dark black with with a small khaki head. The aroma is bourbon, chocolate, coffee, alcohol, and dark roasted malts. The flavor is more of the same.

Bottle shared with maffa cheers Andy. Black slight head. Aroma lots of bourbon some soy sauce. Taste heavy booze bourbon soy mosllases leather stewed fruits good sweetness dark treacle long roasty bitter finish. Oily mouthfeel. Very good bit too much bourbon for me never the less very good.
Sweet, bourbon an vanilla on the nose. Chocolate, molasses, coffee and treacle with a boozy kick. Super rich and thick and smooth. A delight

Aromat intensywny, wprost kojarzący się bourbonem, nuty drewna, wanilii w tle. Nuty palone i czekolada.
W smaku potężne, bardzo czekoladowe z nutami kakao i palonymi na drugim planie. Bardzo intensywna wanilia i kokos od beczki. Pralinki czekoladowe. Finisz długi czekoladowo-bourbonowy. Alkohol ułożony i szlachetny.
Cocoa, rather light blak malts, bit alcoholish, lots of barrell, lots of bourbon

2017 bottle from Whole Foods. Pours thick and nearly black with a small brown head. Aroma is smoked meat, peat, earth, wood, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon. Flavor is heavy chocolate, bourbon almost immediately afterwards, along with smoke, oak, earth, alcohol. Very nice, though a bit sweeter than I'd like.

2017 bottle poured in snifter. Pours very dark with reddish undertones and creamy caramel head.  Vanilla and caramel on the nose. Syrup like mouthfeel, with heavy roasted malt taste, along with same vanilla and caramel, some charred wood. Extremely well balanced. Lingering flavor of dates and raisins on the tongue.
wow, very awesome. very dark coloured beer.  smells strongly of bourbon. strong bourbon taste. lovely warming aftertaste. 2017 version.

2017. Complex nose of cocoa, cherry, oak,and molasses. Thick, soothing palate which coats like pepto bismal. Taste is simply delicious. Like covfefe but sweeter, oakier and fruitier. Really good and worthwhile of the high score. Bugger off bud.

Cerveza color negro oscuro. Con corona de espuma de moderada retención color café oscuro de burbujas compactas. Con aromas a vainilla, café, chocolate, madera y alcohol propio del bourbon. Al paladar consistencia cremosa más continua siendo fácil de beber con notas al paladar con café, chocolate, vainilla madera con un retrogusto propio del alcohol del bourbon y notas ahumadas y de maltas tostadas. Excelente cerveza que se disfruta ampliamente
