One of the best, I’ll give em that.. points taken away for selling their soul to ABInbev. I won’t mention any other beer review sites.. however, this beer is legendary. It started the bourbon barrel stout genres. Hard to find out west, except for a few days around Black Friday. But you all know this brew. Taste is objective. Make a long story short.. it’s good. Damn good!
2012 års version som inmundigades innan Brewskival 2017. Mother of all... Vilken öl!

Batch 2016. Słodki, palony, klasycznie jak na stouta. Mógłby być gęstszy, jak na parametry, to sprawia dość wodniste wrażenie, co nieco zmniejsza przyjemność z powolnej degustacji. Beczka wyczuwalna głównie na finiszu, tylko subtelnie podkreśla palono-słodki smak. Dobry, ale nie sprostał oczekiwaniom. 3,9


Batch 2017: Sporo powideł śliwkowych, sos sojowy lekko, gorzka czekolada, palonosc dość dziwna, trochę jak spalone siano, może to drewno z beczki. Geste i esencjonalne, bardzo przyjemne. 4,1

Pours a jet black with a thin tan head. Aroma is vanilla, bourbon, cola, chocolate, and toffee. Flavor is similar, sweet, and hides the ABV incredibly well (but boy do I feel the ABV). Silky smooth with a full body. Delicious.

Pours like an Alaskan oil spill in a brandy snifter, pitch black, no fizz with surprisingly sparse lacing for a stout. Scent of vanilla and coconut. Big boozy in yer face flavor, with elements of brownie batter and raisins. Strong, rich decadent bourbon char on the backside to warm yer cockles by the fire. A slow sipper, not for the faint hearted. Simply flawless...Cheers Goose Island!
Thick, complex barrel aged stout. Toffee, caramel, malt, dark fruits and vanilla. Smells great and tastes even better once it has warmed up to around 55-60 degrees. A great staple after Black Friday.

Bottle, 500 ml from City Beer, SF. 2016. 13.8% Shared with Max, JFK10000, Sandi. Huge bourbon in nose, chocolate, nutty, cocoa, bourbon, bit warming. Some dried and dark fruit. Low carbonation. Oily. Alcohol well hidden. Full bodied. 
On tap 2012 at 4th Avenue Pub, NYC. Hmm black, beige head. Chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, smooth, just a bit low on body compared to 2016. 9-4-8-4-17=4.2 Seems 5 years is bit too long to age this.
Bottle, 2018, courtesy of Max. Bourbon, chocolate, oily, some dark fruit, medium sweetness. Bitterness in finish. Full bodied. Still top stuff.

Pours a pitch black coloration with a small creamy head. Incredible aroma of bourbon, chocolate and vanilla. Taste follows the nose, with a rich, but not overpowering bourbon flavor backed by lots of chocolate, some vanilla and molasses. There's a very slight boozyness to it, but it's such a nice shade of bourbon that it's not unpleasant at all. Great, creamy, velvety mouthfeel. This is without a doubt the best stout I have ever tasted.
The aroma is a sweet roasted bourbon malt. The body is a jet black with minimal head. The taste is a warming bourbon influenced roasted malt. It is very palate warming.

2016 bottle at 13.8% abv. Ink black with a small brown head that disappears quickly. Roasted malt and strong bourbon aroma with creamy dark chocolate, oak, vanilla, raisins, mocha, toffee, bit syrupy, some liquorice, more bourbon and wood in the finish. Flavour is sweet with a mild bitterness and warming booze. Body is full and thick. Mouthfeel a bit sticky. Great balance and smoothness, heavy on the bourbon but no sign of sharpness. The definition of fabulous barrel aging.
2018 bottle sampled on 23-11-2018, still quite young. A bit sharper and less smooth than the aged 2016.
pours jet black, nose has strong bourbon vanilla and oak. taste has a smooth bourbon chocolate and oak. very smooth not any booze taste. very well made
moderate coffee and faint coffee notes. pitch black in color with huge long lasting brown head. full body. taste is richly of chocolate, raisin, plum, faint vanilla and bourbon.

It pours thickish like a true imperial stout and has the smooth velvety sip as a smooth beer and then the kick of bourbon hits your throat and then the other flavors smack you like a high roller at a strip club and then the smoothness works down your throat and then the alcohol content hits you like your drunk hitting on a dudes wife 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Was pleasantly surprised to find a lone bottle hiding out in my local Whole Foods wannabe market. It pours a luxurious velvet brown black with a medium head that sticks around a bit. The aroma is some strong alcohol, berries, mocha, and toffee. The taste is, as my "garbage water" stout skeptic better half stated, like some great whiskey was dropped in the worlds best stout ever; it has a warming alcohol feel that is well balanced with an almost fruity red wine like body and a typically strong choco coffee stout base. It lives up to the lofty rep for the most part and deserves to be savored (can't imagine chugging this and doing too well). Good for an evening of paper editing, resin mining, and European train cam streaming.

2017 bottle (Slowbeer). Black, a tan head doesn't hang about. 3+ Bready, booze-soaked but not quite hot aroma akin to liquor marzipan stollen - dried fruit, mild spices, vanilla, sugar. There's a little roast malt and coffee there too, but you have to squint. Full bodied [edit - but well short of syrupy], lowish carbonation. Sweet with a bitter finish. There's no naked alcohol although there's a big warming burst at the end that's skimpily attired. There's more of a stout presence than suggested by the aroma although the Bourbon is more than prominent. Bread, medium roasted fruit coffee, some dried fruit. Bitterness is discreet but freshens things up nicely. Great beer. I guess I like more stout than barrel than this and it surely doesn't need to be 14% ABV, but it does what it does beautifully.
Bottle in Florida. Lovely dark black pour. Overly sweet aroma. So rich & strong. I felt buzzed halfway through my glass. Great beer but bit too sweet

0.355 bottle @ Sztamfer  Black with a small, tanned head. Aroma of dark malts, dark fruits, marzipan. Taste is sweet, heavy, alcoholic, chocolate. Full, creamy, lively. Finish is long, sweet, and alcoholic. Overall, terrific.

2017 bottle - 14.1% ABV. Pours thick black with brown, one finger head. Aroma is bourbon, roast and vanilla. Taste is Taste is sweet caramel, brown sugar and vanilla to start, moving to roast and finishing with bourbon. A beautiful, warming and relaxing stout. Elite.

2018: Dark brown, no head, very thick. Aroma of vanilla, wine, cookies, ripe berries, a bit of alcohol. Full body, sweet texture, more vanilla and cake, nice bitterness on the end. Still no bourbon, but seems a bit less sweet than last year's

2017: Dark brown, small coffee head. Rich aroma of wine, fruit, oak. Sweet, full bodied, extremely dense even, roasted, silky, with a hint of cake and alcohol in the end. Didn't feel any bourbon though, but can say it's bad. One of the best imperial stouts I've tried so far.
9-4-9-4-19 = 4.5

2015:Pitch black, small coffee head. Intensive aroma of tar, wine, dark ripe fruit, prunes. Sweet and very dense, chocolate, cake. You can't taste alcohol, but you feel it in every sip. Same as in 2017 - not much boutbon. Extremely rich beer.
9-4-9-3-18=4.3

Looks like I liked 2017 version more due to the density. It seems to be more drinkable and easy going with all the outstanding qualities of perfect imp stout

This is a perfect beer. It has a velvety chocolate yummy texture.  The beer is so complex - bourbon forward, creamy, full, with dark fruity esters, semi sweet. It is midnight black. It is rich and robust, with just the right amount of warmth.  I smell a bit of yeasty cheese wafting in the air as it breathes.  Sip!

2016: dark, Intense barrel, fruits, bourbon, chocolate, cacao, wood, vanilla, syrupy, coconut. Very sweet, heavy body, oily. Superb! 4.3

2017: Much bourbon, chocolate, coffee, cookies, bitter toffee. 4.5

2013: Chocolate, vanilla bourbon dessert 4.3

Free sample from bottle at Ghost Whale. 2015 vintage. Jet black with a small dirty tan head. Aroma is a big chocolate and molasses base with coffee, coconut and bourbon. Taste is really complex with lots of chocolate, molasses then the bourbon kicks in with a mellow boozy zing then more chocolate and a little coconut and coffee. Really thick and viscous. Lovely stuff.

On tap at Dutch Trading Company. Pours black motor oil with minimal beige head. Nose is heavy bourbon, molasses and dark fruit. Taste is fucking sensational. Layers of dark chocolate, balsamic vinegar, vanilla and dark fruits. Really well balanced. I feel privileged to be consuming this beer in Australia. Yours sincerely, Jonnyguns. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I don't know if this is the best Imperial Stout I've had but it's up there. Aromas bursting with smoke, dark fruit, molasses, cocoa and bourbon. Pours black with a big frothy tan head that leaves a lot of lacing. Complex flavors of wood, smoke, dark fruit, vanilla. The high ABV provides a nice warmth. Mild bitterness at the end. Low carbonation with an oily body. A very expensive beer but it lives up to the hype

2014. W aromacie sporo kawy, piękna beczka. W smaku sporo alkoholu. Zaznaczony bourbon. Sporo kawy, gorzka czekolada. Generalnie tej wersji dałbym tak 4-4.1.

2015. Ale super jest to piwo. W aromacie praliny czekoladowe, kawa, wanilia, kokos. W smaku cudne praliny, walilia, kokosik. Jest gładkie, wyklejające. Brak alko w smaku. Super/10. Zasługuje na jakieś 4.7 w mojej skali RB. 

2016. W zapachu coś niepokojącego. W smaku chyba nawet lepsze niż wersja 2015. Jeszcze gładsze. Pyszne.
Aroma is dark fruits,chocolate,coffee and smoke.Taste is quite the same.Nice color with amazing body.Amazing beer

An orgasm of coffee, chocolate and oak in the scent. The taste is heavenly good. Coffee, chocolate and oak barrels. Awesome good aftertaste that fills the whole mouth forever. Understand why this is one of the world's best beers. Perfection! Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

THE BEST stout on the world
Amazing bourbon aroma and taste followed by chocolate coffee and dark fruit taste 
Appearance is black with huge body

2012 edition- Smokey roasty, smooth. This basically describes the beer. Oak and Worcestershire sauce with wood, cherries, banana, coffee and blackcurrant with a hint of smoked meat. Vanilla and leather elements as well on the nose. The taste is of strong whisky, roasted malt and pomegranate. The potential on this is amazing to see what happens to it.

2014 - loads of barrel influence (vanilla, coconut, leather, wood) along with decent amount of chocolate both in aroma and in taste (even stronger). Smooth, dense, intense and with huge depth. What makes it even better that the depth is created solely by malts and barrel aging. no coffee, no cocoa or spices, yet the flavour and intensity surpass most regular stouts. Very good beer.

2008 Edition. Bottled on: 08/01/08. Batch: 1640.
Enjoyed in International Stout Day 2017
Thanks to fiulijn
Black color, no head, very low carbonation. Aroma with notes of roasted malts, spiced wine, ¿vermouth?; after some minutes we can note that roasted malts dissapear but chocolate hints appear. Flavor is slightly bittery, with a high coffee presence, strong notes of coffee beans..., licorice hints and strong alcoholic presence, perhaps unbalanced, high presence of Bourbon notes. Final is mild bittery with a high presence of alcohol. Dense and creamy mouthfeel.

2011 Edition. Bottled on: 11/11/11. Batch: 1847.
Enjoyed in International Stout Day 2017
Thanks to -I'm sorry but I don't remember his name, he is from Minnesota and I got during his visit to Spain in 2012-
Black color with a small presence of a beige head that quickly dissapears, maintaining a circle on top of beer just close to the glass. Dense while was poured. Aroma has notes of roasted malts, less than 2008 edition, any way the notes of chocolate are more noticeable with a high alcoholic presence. Some minutes after appear some notes of molasses, black ripe fruit and dry figs. Flavor is toasty, roasty, slightly sweet, no cloying, with a light presence of coffee beans, licorice and chocolate malts, its 14.5% of ABV perfectly hidden. Final is slightly bittery with roasted malts, Bourbon notes appear on palate. Creamy and smoothy mouthfeel, very dense.

From Jan 2008

I got this bottle in a trade with Hoppymeal. Thanks Derek!

The only other GI brew that I've had was the Imperial Stout and that one was delicious. Here goes:

It pours from 12oz bottle(2007) a very thickish looking pitch black with a small, rapidly receding head of tannish foam but there's some good lacing to be found here.

The smell...well, it hit my nose buds as soon as I popped the cap. All sorts of things going on here. Dark fruit, caramel malt, chocolate, vanilla, and, what about that rambunctious nose of bourbon??

The taste is both outrageously tasty but also smooth. Big bourbon notes along with raisins, vanilla, chocolate, a really nice bitter chocolate flavour that adds a nice balance to the sweetness...wow!

The mouthfeel is so thick and chewy and it finishes with that bitter chocolate and a good kick of that bourbon. Man. This is some crazy shit and I'm loving it. The abv is slightly noticeable during the swallow and a little more noticeable after the swallow but heck, I still find it very drinkable. I suspect that some aging would make it even more drinkable but I just couldn't wait. ;^) I can see why so many BAs rate this one so highly, like it's special. It truly is. As a caveat, I'm *not* a Bourbon fancier so my loving BCS is all the more impressive.

Thanks again, Derek, for another wonderful drop!

On tap. Pours a black color with a faint tan head. Aroma dark fruit, malt, vanilla and hint of bourbon. taste of dark fruit, bit of dark chocolate, roasted malt with trace of vanilla. Mild bitterness with a dry finish. Full body, thick, smooth and creamy with only a hint of the alcohol. Very enjoyable.
Aroma - chocolate, coffe, wet wood. Taste - bourbon, vanilla, milk chocolate. Realy, realy good

2016 vintage.
Pours pitch black with little tan head. Thick motor oil with heavy lacings. 
Aroma has huge bourbon, vanilla, dried dark fruits, 
Taste is lots of bourbon, bitter chocolate, molasses, dried dark fruits, thick, smooth.

Mega czekoladowe, bourbon i beczka. Do tego kawa. Aż oczy się otworzyły. Do tego suszone owoce, migdały. Piękne piwo.

2017>2018>2016

2016 Świetne piwo. W aromacie bardzo intensywne. Dużo bourbonu w alkoholowej przyjemnej postaci, poza tym kawa, kawa, palone nuty, suszone owoce, żurawina. W smaku podobnie intensywnie, zdecydowanie wielowymiarowe. Na początku atakuje fajne ziarno kawy, później wanilia i mleczna czekolada, następnie migdały i kokos, a na koniec w kontrze pojawia się dużo drewna i lekkie rozgrzewanie.

500ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Pitch black color. No head. Sweet, caramel, toffee, alcohol, woody and oak in aroma. Caramel, roast, sweet, alcohol, vanilla, dark chocolate cake in taste. Roast, caramel, dark fruits in aftertaste. Sweet and caramel in aftertaste. Tad too sweet for me. Mellow mouthfeel. Very solid brew.

500ml bottle, thanks martjoobolut. Pours almost full black, small beige head as ring. Aroma of roast, sweet cocoa, chocolate, some woodyness. Taste is chocolatey, bourbon, some alcohol, woody. Full body, below average carbo. Nice imp stout, it's good, really, but worth the price?

500ml bottle. Dark brown beer, almost no head. Nose is bourbon, oak, vanilla, booze, sweet notes. Flavor is caramel, vanilla, bourbon, sweet, some alcohol notes. Boozy and bourbony finish. Pretty sticky and oily.
Bottle (from billie's at antwerpen). Pours black. Aroma is vanilla, and roast, malt. Flavor is sweet and bitter, roast, chocolate, malt, booze. Overall: very good.
Taste like Heaven! I've been waiting patiently all year for it to come back!!

This is the best overall beer I have tasted. Puts other bourbon barrel aged stouts to shame. Powerful bourbon aroma and flavor.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a near black from a tap with a head the color of coffee with too much cream. Nice oaky, roasted malt aroma, hints of charcoal and even salted caramel. Flavor is similarly complex with a fair amount of oak and some rich chocolate. Thick with a boozy burn. Very good beer.

2016 - 13.8%. Randomly got to taste this... thanks Iznogud, JFK1000, Maks & Sandi! Each. As I got a taste from each of their glasses for some reason. :D Anyway, black, still, no head when I got to it, but that wasn't immediately. Full aroma... heavy maltiness, figs, vanilla, bourbon. The taste... wow, silky, warming, bourbon barrel, vanilla, figs and a dose of cocoa, with slightly rough alcohol around the edges, I feel like this was still just a bit raw, even though it was genuinely elegant. Excellent beer, not 100% my style, but still - wow!
Bottle, 2016 vintage. Aroma is lots of bourbon and vanilla, also chocolate, warming alcohol, a bit of buckwheat honey. Pleasant creamy texture. Very good.

(2016 vintage, bottle )
Aroma: chocolate,pure bourbon, very woody, sweet vanilla, barrel char, dark fruits.
Appearance:black color, small dense head.
Taste: sweet, flavour of sweet chocolate,huge vanilla,wood,coconut,bourbon, dark fruits, loong vanilla finish.
Palate: full body,thick texture,low carbonation,
Overall: Uber rich, woody, bourbon-driven stout. LOVELY !!!

I was able to get my hands on 5 bottles from 2015 and still have one left. Beautiful dark color. You can smell the sweetness right away. Very thick and syrupy which is not my thing but for the style it is very good. Taste is a vanilla, raisins, and a ton of molasses. Didn't get much of the bourbon taste

From tap at Doolittles. Zowie, this is good sh*t. Pours nearly black with little or no head. Thick, rich flavors - dark fruits, vanilla, chocolate, sweet roasted malt, oak, whiskey, caramel, charcoal, smoke and alcohol. Full bodied. Huge, awesome.

Chocolate & molasses on the nose with a ton of bourbon jumping out the glass. Tons of chocolates and caramel on arrival. Raisins in the middle with a touch of tobacco. Sweet vanilla/maple notes coming from the bourbon barrels at the end. Thick, mouth-coating body that’s slick and rich. Warms up beautiful with all the flavors and intensity kept together. Absolutely amazing beer—I don’t care if it’s not "craft"! 100/100!
2016 vintage. Dark fruit with cherry dominance, very rich, molasses and delicate caramel mix and leave you with lovely coffee and raw coca finish

Rocznik 2013: Czekoladowe praliny z lekkim alkoholem, beczki nadaly szlachetny posmak bourbonu, duo tanicznosci i wanilii. Dosc slodkie z dobrze podkreslona lekko palona goryczka na srednim poziomie. Duzo kawy i lekkie utlenienie ze wzgledu na rocznik. Pelne i oleiste cialo zakleja podniebienie. Przepyszne i warte swoich pieniedzy.

Bottle courtesy of wombat23. 2015 vintage. Pours black from the bottle; the thin light brown head soon dissolves. Aroma is molasses, licorice, chocolate, and noticeable barrel. Taste is bittersweet, turning warmer, more alcoholic and increasingly bitter going into the finish. The taste of bourbon lingers long after the swill. Full bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich, thick, clingy. And sticky. Overall a real slow-sipping treat. Great stuff.
Bardzo dobre piwo. Naprawdę fajna czekolada ciemna, kakao, trochę beczka, ale lekka, nie przeszkadza. Generalnie super piwo. RIS, któremu nic nie brakuje.

Puur zwart bier met mokkakleurige schuimkraag. Donker fruit, chocolade, koffie, eik, lichte roasttoets, bourbon. Een genot om te drinken. Heel erg zacht voor z’n abv. Vol en licht romig in de mond. Mooie afdronk. Topstout.

2013 vintage bottle shared at tasting. Black colour, small beige head. Strong aroma of pralines, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, toasted coconut, mild mocca. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter, rich dark chocolate, pralines, bourbon, vanilla, a hint of oak, coffee, light roasty, a bit warming finish with notes of wood and chocolate. Full body, oily, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Delicious - an essence of bourbon barrel aged imperial stout.
Great beer, a lot of vanilla, chocolate, pralines. The aroma is awesome. Carbonaton is a bit too high in my opinion.
(2016) Really nice and thick in the mouth. Great barrel (wood, vanilla and bourbon) aroma. Classic presence of alcohol in the throat. Worth the money.

Rocznik 2016: Super beczka, wanilia, czekolada, gładkie, kremowe, świetne piwo z ukrytym alko.
Rocznik 2014: Lekkie utlenienie, kakao, czekolada, fajne ciało, ciemne owoce, ta beczka schowana nie tak fajna jak w świeżej wersji i bardziej popiołowe, ale i tak klasa. 
Zdecydowanie im świeższe tym lepsze.

12floz bottle 2012 vintage (BOD: 11.20.2012), paid about $20 for a four-pack at the time...Jet black in color with nary any head, such as it is BIG stout. Boozy bourbon and toffee aroma intimidates as much as it invites. Heavy on the palate meant for sipping with flavors of vanilla, toffee, hazelnut, and smooth roastedness imparted by the malts and bourbon barrel aging. This beer when I’ve had it is superb year in and year out. It ranks right up there with the very best BA imperial stouts available.
Lekkere stout, goede smaak. donkere smaak. Mooie fles. gedronken op een temperatuur van 7 graden

2015 bottle 13.7% "cellared" at room temp. Poured with a dark brown head that quickly faded. *Needs to warm up* Great chewy mouthfeel, great big aroma of boozy chocolate & brownies. First sips when colder were very woody/tannic but this has faded as it warms up. Still fairly boozy.

First off if youve never had it and bought a bottle !!!!!STOP!!!!! and put it in the cellar for a minimum of 12 months before you decide if the hype is real because it definitely is. Fresh draft this stout is an amazing treat but as it ages in a bottle it becomes a masterpiece thickening into a bourbon infused thick fudgy motor oil. Variants are good dinosaur barrels are cool but the OG that you let age for as many years as you could stand before you cracked it open is the real treat.

Bottle 2016. A black opaque liquid with almost no head. Nose is vanilla, caramel, woody notes and bourbon. Taste is booze, bourbon, caramel, small smoky notes, woody, medium sweetness. The perfect balance between, vanilla, sweetness and bourbon in mouth. Warmth alcohol feeling in the throat remembering us that it’s 13.9%

Przepiękny aromat bourbonowej beczki – kokos i wanilia, później praliny w czekoladzie, delikatna kawa, zapowiada, że będzie bardzo słodko i tak jest, oleista, gęsta, oblepiająca język faktura, daje smak pełen niuansów wanilii, kokosa, marcepanu, wiśniowych czekoladek – bogato i intensywnie, ze świetnie ukrytym alkoholem, lekko rozgrzewającym w przełyku, dość szybko znika ze szkła. Dobre piwo na zwieńczenie majowego weekendu.

on tap vertical flight 13 thru 16 black pour thin tan head aroma of chocolate and booze taste of cherries wood chocolate and vanilla finish is booze definately felt the older was smoother than the newer

2015. Słodki Jezusie Pantokratorze. Piękny i bogaty zapach, we wszelkie pyszności i bogactwa takie jak pralinki, bombonierki, czekoladki zalane bourbonem, mleczna czekolada. Gładkie, oleiste, smukłe, gęste, pełne i seksowne ciało. Pełne od mlecznej czekolady, pralinek i bombonierek, czekoladek zalanych bourbonem i szlachetnym alkoholem, ciastem czekoladowym, następnie wchodzi kakaowa polewa i bounty oblane gorzka czekoladką :3 Tu jest naprawdę jak w fabryce Williego Wonki. Alkohol absolutnie niewyczuwalny, piękne, zmienia myślenie o piwach opisanych jako "bourbon barrel aged".
Dark, oily appearance with a very thin beige head. Sweet, boozy aroma, raisin, chocolate. Taste is sweet, vanilla, bourbon. Very nice.

2015 bottle. Aroma of tart red fruit, maybe infected? Looks like bourbon county, who gives a shit, this is a chug. 500ml chugged in 11s. Doesn’t taste infected, fairly smooth if a bit metallic. Low carbonation which is great for a chug. Gagged once. Would chug again.

Vintage 2017. Chyba trochę gorszy - więcej karmelu i paloności, beczka raczej na tym samym poziomie. temu dałbym z 4.0.

Bottled 2015. Pitch black with small, light brown head. Nice, smooth, rich. Full of chocolate, some biscuits. Moderate to light heavy sweet, with long and stable duration. Moderate to high vanilla, coconut and barrel notes. Moderate to full body, silky and semi-thick texture, soft carbonation. ABV is extremely well hidden here. In overall very rich in bourbon and chocolate imperial stout.

2015 bottle (bottled on 01OCT15, 13.7%). Bought in August 2016 by my sister at Top Hops in New York as a gift for me. First of all, I’m crazy happy it’s not infected.
This is a great beer for sure. Bourbon. Chocolate. Liquorice. Toffee, sweet caramel. A lot of nice smoke. Vanilla. Warming. Full bodied, thick, sticky. Not overly sweet, right in my favor. A near perfect BA Imperial Stout, I could have it more often.
Bottle at home. 2015 vintage not infected. Taste of liquorice, toffee, salt and bourbon.
2012 (15% ABV) version. Aroma and Taste: Bourbon, vanilla, oak, dark cherry and cocoa. surprisingly sweet for an imperial stout (Makes an excellent after dinner beer).

The aroma is perfect for the style with roasted malt coffee and chocolate. The appearance is almost black. The taste is perfect for the style. The plate is thick. Overall a near perfect stout just a bit heavy on the alcohol for me.

Bottled on 10/7/2016 #1301. Dark appearance. Too damn boozy, too dang sweet, too freaking strong, the vanilla hits you in the face, my lips picker and my throat closes with every sip. But damn is it smooth as it all works extremely well. I’ll try it again next year....at least it’ll make it to my cellar that time...maybe.

Goose Island brews a limited supply of the Bourbon County Stout. So limited that many bars place a restriction of one per person. I had the privilege of sampling it at the South Side Grille during their Goose Island Tap Takeover yesterday.

Pour: Half-finger espresso creme head. Black tar body.

Bouquet: Roasted coffee and cacao bean. Earthy, sweet. Caramel and vanilla bean. Oak bite. Smoke.

Sip: Coffee and dark chocolate. Buttery caramel. Toffee nut. Morphs into a molasses syrupy viscosity. And finishes with a bite of smoky bourbon. Bourbon flavor really opens updating as it breathes. Mid glass it bites like a rye.

Mouth-Feel: Luscious, full bodied, velvety, creamy like butter. This is a beer that is very “in the nose” you can feel it it your sinuses. It had that quintessential bourbon whiskey burn that seems to encompass you, and kindles a fire in your chest.

Overall: I imagine a nice steak, or duck fat braised pork chop going nicely before drinking this. This is an after-dinner beer, it is a show stealer and needs its own space to shine. Drink it like a digestif.

Vintage 2016 (13.8%) : Aroma is massive chocolate notes with vanilla and bourbon. Deep and rich bourbon notes with sweetness as well. Taste is very wide with lots of malt, brown sugar sweetness, molasses, vanilla. Light alcohol, but absolutely not disturbing. This was awesome!

Rami Rami is drinking a Bourbon County Brand Stout (2016) 13.8% by Goose Island Beer Co. at Personalna

Urywa dupe. Beczka, wanilia, gladkoscia, pralinkami... syropowe... alko sie paleta nielekko moze teoretycznie jako mikrominusik. Klasa

Rami Rami is drinking a Bourbon County Brand Stout 2016 Matured For 24h On Kamis Vanilla Beans That Survived At Least Two Vanilla Holocausts On Madagascar And Luckily Avoided Being Put Into Polish Milkshake IPAs by Goose Island Beer Co. at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku

Wanilia nie zdominowala (2 laski na dobe) ale jest ewidentna - inna niz beczkowa. A dalej po prostu bcbs. Jakby ciut mocniejsze alko

Purchased at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku


Rami Rami: Fajne praliny
Pours black with no head. Aroma is caramel malt, vanilla, bourbon, and oak. Flavor is sweet caramel malt, molasses, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, and oak. Sticky, sweet mouthfeel.

APARIENCIA: de color negro totalmente, apenas algunos ligeros destellos marrones en la partes superior; corona de espuma color marrón de burbujas compactas y abiertas, de baja retención la cual rapidamente se disipa a sólo un anillo alrededor del líquido.

AROMA: dulce y licoroso con mucho carácter de la barrica, notas a bourbon intensas, madera carbonizada, vainilla y ligeramente coco tostado, caramelo, chocolate amargo y dulce, algo de café, ligeramente ahumado, cuero y tabaco además de presencia tenue de frutos oscuros como pasas, ciruelas y dátiles. 

SABOR: una buena combinación de la cerveza base y las características que aporta la barrica; notas intensas a bourbon, madera carbonizada, chocolate amargo, y semiamargo, algo fudgie como brownie, vainilla, caramelo, atrás ligeramente toffee, algo de coco tostado, café, notas ahumadas, cuero, tabaco y ligera presencia de frutos oscuros como pasas, ciruelas y dátiles; en cada trago destacan diferentes notas, a veces el chocolate, otras veces el caramelo/toffee y vanilla, y en otras ocasiones el bourbon y la madera; en el retrogusto queda un amargor ligero, totalmente opacado por la permanencia de las notas a bourbon, madera, vainilla, caramelo, chocolate amargo y semiamargo los cuales quedan pegados al paladar.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio alto, sensación untuosa y sedosa en boca, baja carbonatación. El alcohol se percibe en cada trago sin llegar a ser agresivo, además de una sensación calurosa en garganta cada que pasa el líquido.

RESUMEN: un clásico excelente y ejemplo de como debe ser el estilo.

Back to back two great IMPS. Perfect dark chocolate, pure cocoa, vanilla, black smooth coffee and ofc awesome BA note. This is more sweetsided, but ABV very well hidden -gives only light warmth. Perfect balance with light bitterness. Nice dried fruit note. Love it!

2014 release consumed 2/26/2017. Pitch black with thin quickly dissipating khaki head. Fairly thick and oily. Huge delicious barrel character and a very long finish. Rich warming sensation. Getting some dried fruit and boozy character. Excited to retry this release in another year or two or maybe do a vertical tasting...we’ll see.

2017 Vintage: 
Intense, rich, chocolate, sweet bourbon barrel, cacao, dark, toasted malts. Hazy, very, dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More rich chocolate, sweet, dark, dried fruits, soft carbonation, full bodied, prunes, caramel, toffee, molasses in the finish. Absolutely stunning Impy, lives up to the hype, rich, well-balanced, complex, beautiful. Keg at CBR17, Shoreditch. 4.5
2019 Vintage:
10Dec2019 Intense bourbon, sweet oak, chocolate, sweet molasses wood, caramel. Hazy, very dark brown, small, frothy, beige head. Light bitter. More dark malts, cacao, chocolate, oak, bourbon, soft carbonation, full bodied. Absolutely outstanding. Draft at St. Gambrinus Beer Shoppe, Brooklyn. 4.3
2019 15.2% vintage:
28Feb2020 Intense chocolate, cacao, sweet oak, intense bourbon, molasses, alcohol. Hazy, very dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Heavy sweet. More sweet, dark chocolate, cacao, lightly zesty orange peel, dark molasses, bourbon, soft carb, full bod. Outstanding. Draft at BrewLDN, London. 4.5

Tap@Vintner, NYC, USA. Batch 2013. Strong aroma with licorice and bourbon. Pitch black color with small light beige head. Strong, balanced and very stylish taste with pungent combination of licorice and bourbon. Some coffee and slightly roasted malts. Wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with licorice, malts and some bourbon. Strong, bit oily body and medium carbonation. Overall, nicely combines sweetness, roasted flavors and boozy twist of the bourbon. Could have slightly more malts, still world class.

Eerste indruk: Holy Fuck. De neus is een en al Bourbon. Vanille, chocolade, caramel en zoethout. Mondgevoel plakkerig en stroperig. Maar... na verloop van tijd en lichte opwarming van het glas, komt het zoethout te hard (naar mijn smaak) opzetten en wordt het mondgevoel te plakkerig. Het geheel overall té zoet.

Oh my word! This is a heavy, thick concoction! If bourbon barrel ages stouts are your thing, THIS is going to rock your world. Just short of motor oil, this stout pulls every bit of flavor from the barrel. And at 14% is is likely to kick you in the legs too!

2015 edition consumes 2.2017 Opaque pour, tan foam. Aroma raisins, molasses. Tastes clean milky caramel. Some woodiness. Nice light carb. The abv is very smooth. I’d think it was more like 9%. Respectable and good but I see little reason to try it twice.
Aroma is chocolate, bourbon, and roasted malts, taste is amazing, huge bourbon, vanilla , oak and coffee, taste really hides the abv well! Not sure it gets much better.
Good and a landmark beer. Smooth beer with a dark brown color and small. Hints of chocolate and toast. 2015 seemed better than 2014.

4.2

Pours an opaque dark brown with nearly no head. Nose is bourbon, fudge, and chocolate. Flavour is fudgey, chocolate, rich, smooth, complex, though hints of soy sauce, but is delicious.
