Backlog Beer Rating

500ml bottle @ home. Bottled Oct 11, 2016

Pours an opaque dark brown with a small brown head. Nose is chocolate, bourbon, dark fruits, with a slight vanilla note. Flavour is rich and smooth, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, dark fruits. Full bodied and delicious.

500ml bottle shared at home (2015 edition). Pitch black with almost no head. Full body with low carbonation. Insanely well balanced sweet and bitter tones, very smooth moothfeel. Roasted malts, bourbon, brown sugar, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, subtle coffee and spices. Amazing!

RELEASE 2015: bottled on 8th november; 14,3% abv.: pours black oily color, clear, with foamy brown head, which immediately transforms to a ring around the glass. aroma: intense bourbon aroma, very gentle, not harsh presented and at the same time supported with roasted, dark malts aroma, which takes on espresso coffe, chocolate, chocolate cake, vanilla, cinnamon, oak, tobacco, port wine,...Flavor: Intense malt flavor, with notes of chocolate, espresso coffee, vanilla, molasses, hint of cinnamon, supported with gentle note of bourbon, vanilla, oak. finish is sticky dry, body is full texture soft, carbonation is low, alcohol note is gentle hidden, but evident. I would give it a score 5, but I got only one bottle of this imps. But for sure is f...goooooooood, Damn!!!!!!! OVERALL SCORE FOR 2015: 8-5-10-5-19=4.7.
RELEASE 2014 in City beer in SF, betwen 20-24th january 2017 from 0.12oz. Bottle:
Pours oily black, slightly clear, with foamy brown head. All components in aroma-flavor were perfectly balanced, bourbon note gentle but still noticeable, body full, texture super smooth, carbonation low. OVERALL SCORE FOR 2014 RELEASE: 9-5-10-5-18=4.7.
RELEASE 2016 from Heatlhy spirits, SF: this year 13.8% abv. Very similar components to release 2015. 2016 RELEASE SCORE: 8-5-9-5-18= 4.5; 2017 RELEASE with 14.7% abv. 8-5-10-5-18=4.6

Draft Half Pint at White Horse American Beer Festival 2010, Parsons Green, London in July 2010 - Pitch Black in colour. Viscous, syrupy. Very very Malty; roasty/burnt malts, lots of chocolate, lots of coffee, caramel, toffee, molasses, charred oak, vanilla, smoke. Fruity; dark fruits, raisins. Hoppy; slightly spicy hops. Sweet roast malty, chocolate and coffee. Wonderfully warming. Alcohol very evident; not too surprisingly it is Bourbon. Great stuff. Truly, a Stunning Beer! (2010-07)

Pitch black color. Dark brown head. Pours like motor oil. Heavy nose of bourbon, dark chocolate, dark fruit and roasted malt. Very full body, but hides that ABV beautifully. This is definitely a sipper and a good winter beer. Velvety smooth mouth feel with good bourbon, chocolate and roasted malt notes. Modestly sweet, but never too much and never too cloying. Very well integrated. Smooth bourbon and chocolate finish. A benchmark for sure.

Butelka wersja 2016. Deugstacja @ DobryZbeer

Co te piwo to ja nawet nie! Kolejny piwny gral zdegustowany. 
Faktura piwa jest gładka, kremowa i mega oleista. Po otwarciu butelki buchają aromaty czekolady, kawy, wanilii i kokosa. W ustach mega wyklejające i słodkie.
Mistrzostwo!

Aroma:


Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and roasted malts.




Appearance:


Opaque black beer with no/a slight brown/darm brown head.




Taste/Palate:


Starts heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla and chocolate; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.




Overall:


This beer is intense, complex and balanced. That bourbon is extremely noticeable in this beer. Lovely aroma and an even better flavour. The head disappears fast, but the appearance is great for what it is.
Pours a rich dark black. Aroma is sweet vanilla coffee, rich bourbon. Tastes delicious. Have a 2012 bt put away.

Bottle 2012. (Bottling 09/26/12) Pours motor oil black in the glass with thin bieige head. Amazing aroma of bourbon, vanilla, wood and a hint of alcohol. Full body with low carbonation and oily texture.Taste of bourbon, booze, chocolate and wood. I’ve had 2x2014 and a bottle of 2015 last year. This one blows them away.No signs of oxidation because of the ageing. Amazing World class beer.
On tap at World Of Beer. Such a big beer, the ABV is well hidden and with so many big flavours this is a real winter warmer.
Bottle pour with virtually no head. Sharp aroma of dark chocolate. The taste is amazing with a large amount of vanilla sweetness.

500ml bottle at Ilya’s. Vintage 2015 (30-Sep-2015). Pours an almost black with a weak brown head. Aroma is bourbon, dark fruits, lots of nuts, leather, molasses. Taste is very sweet, pretty similar to aroma with chocolate notes. Too sweet, not very much of bourbon character (middle level), but, of course, very good.

Poured from tap at a tasting a black with mocha head. Aroma was deeply roasted malt, not overwhelming Bourbon, licorice, vanilla. Taste was bourbon, roasted malt, licorice, fig and dark fruit. Finish was an oaky vanilla and Bourbon. Not boozy at all.

Jan 1 doing 365 beers in a year!
Beer 1, 364 to go!

16oz pour at Otts Medford
Deep black with thin tan head
Bourbon and oak smell
Wonderful mix of bourbon and roasted malt taste!

Follow all my picks on FB
Mark Dashner

Twitter 
@rastadash
For more detailed accounts!

Butelka. Edycja 2015. Na całe szczęście niezakażone. Czarne, nieprzejrzyste, Piany brak. Aromat zdominowany przez bourbon, mokre drewno, wanilię. Pod powyższymi ukryte ciemne owoce, oraz masa gorzkiej czekolady, pralin. Aromat wspaniały. W smaku bourbon, gorzka czekolada, wanilia, ciemne owoce. Dają o sobie znak jeżyny. Konsystencja likierowa, lepka, gęsta. Wysycenie i goryczka średnia. Podsumowując należy przyznać, że jest to wspaniałe piwo, kompletne, przesycone bourbonem i wanilią. Alkohol doskonale wkomponowany w całość. Daje o sobie znak dopiero po ogrzaniu trunku do temperatury pokojowej w postaci lekkiego grzania w przełyk. Posmak pozostaje w ustach na długo w postaci czekoladowych pralin i oczywiście bourbonu. Zacne piwo. Przyjemności dodaje pojemność, którą warto delektować się jak najdłużej. Zacny trunek na rozpoczęcie nowego roku!



PS. Chodzi mi po głowie niedawno degustowany BrewDog Black Eyed King Imp Vietnamese Coffee. Wrócę do niego i czuje, że dokonam edycji oceny :)

2013-as verzió. Az év utolsó söreként jobbat nem is kívánhatnék, egy Bourbon County levadászása ugyanis innen Magyarországról egy fehér oroszlán foglyul ejtéséhez hasonló egyszerűséggel bír, többek között ezért tartottam különösen nagy becsben a tavalyi évben beszerzett palackot. Olajos, éjfekete teste egy gondolatnyi hablepellel bír csupán, mely hamar elillan, nemígy illatai, a fahordók dongái közé ivódott vaníliás, kókuszos aromák, kekszes, marcipános foszlányokkal körülölelve. Malátaszirupos kortyai éppoly vaníliásak, mint aromái, s nemkülönben olajosak, bársonyosak, kenhetőek, valalamely alkoholos desszert töltelékeként szolgálhatnának, ha létezne olyasféle férfias karakterű cukrászati remekmű, amely méltó otthona lehetne a mennyei tartalomnak. Ez valóban a legek itala, különleges alkalmak imperial stout-ja, a tonnás súlyú kókuszos csokoládés, kávés, vaníliás bourbon-jegyek fesztiválja, utánozhatatlan tekintély, felsőbbrendűség megnyilvánulása. Varázslatos zárása az óévnek.
Hell yeah, i cannot wait for this drink every year. great barrell taste great price
Pours oily black, no carbonation. Aroma is chocolate and bourbon. Mouthfeel is very thick, like drinking liquid fudge. A pretty hefty bourbon taste on the back.
Opened a 2013 bottle for Christmas with an old friend. Boy did it age nicely. The flavor was enhanced with age. I’m glad I have 7 bottles left.

Realizing there is a lot of hype around this beer, it is still a great beer. Aromas of booze, vanilla, raisins, must. Back pour, brown head. Fudge, dried plums, raisins, vsnilla, bourbon. Oily on the palate, warm finish. A must have every year.
Bottle shared at mikkeller bar in Copenhagen. All this bourbon stuff make me crazy, love.
Wonderfull. Rye bread, licorice, dried fruit, figs, syrup, honey, booze and a ton of bourbon.
Strong bourbon flavor but not overpowering. Pours dark black with no head. This honestly is a highly overrated beer and there are numerous other BBA stouts that are equal or superior.

Pint bottle poured into a snifter. Pours jet black with a one finger copper head that quickly vanishes. Big, BIG aromas coming from the glass. I can basically smell this thing from across the room. Vanilla, bourbon, custard, soy sauce, and booze on the nose. Taste is rich bourbon, buttery caramel, and vanilla, with a subtle smokiness. Suprisingly supple mouthfeel for a brew that is so big. Outstanding. I was genuinely upset when I finished this.

aroma is intense and sweet fine bourbon vanilla, taste is full of subtle bourbon flavors but even more chocolate and vanilla, very sweet , still not too much, very balanced, aftertaste is like a vanilla or cottage cheese pie dessert with long lasting alcohol heat , which is otherwise very well integrated in the profile. This was a 13.7% ABV from sept/2015, the best bottle I had so far.

Poured a viscous very dark brown with a minimal, rapidly disappearing tan head. Aroma of coffee, mild dark chocolate and roasted malt. Full. smooth body, flavour of sweet vanilla smooth milk chocolate and sweet alcoholic goodness. Very sweet alcohol end. Lovely.

2016 bottle purchased at Fort Point Market in South Boston, MA. Pours jet black, smooth, cappuccino head with small frothy bubbles. Dissipates very quickly. Smells like burnt wood, vanilla, roastiness with bourbon sweetness and booze as well. Love it. Nice roasty flavor, smooth vanilla. Those come first and are quickly replaced by ample, everlasting dark chocolate flavor. Sweet bourbon barrel throughout and slight charred wood. Not the thickest mouthfeel but I wouldn’t say light either. Medium. Overall not all too complex, balance is ok. The flavor is great and it definitely saves this one from being mediocre. In terms of overall quality it’s definitely missing balance, a little complexity and a little on the mouthfeel. Delicious nonetheless. I enjoyed this one.

12 oz bottle dated 29 August 2014 served in a Belgian snifter. A second 2014 bottle served in July 2018. 
Removing the cap indicated a secure seal, but this has very little 
carbonation. This is not ideal for the appearance, but the low carbonation seems about right for the smooth, full, high ABV body. Boozy and woody aroma with dark roasted grains and molasses. Sweet bourbon dominates the rich flavor. Moderately woody with faint vanilla and coffee in the finish. Mild bourbon barrels and dark bread in the aftertaste.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Genialne. Perfekcyjnie gładkie, oleiste, kremowe, eleganckie. Piękna wanilia, szlachetny alkohol, potężne nuty Bourbonu, odbeczkowy kokos i genialna jak na tę moc pijalność. Wybitne piwo, jeden z moich ulubionych stoutów ever. Jeśli nie ulubiony :)
Pitch black, very strong whisky scent. Taste is very sweet and there is also heat from the 14%, tar like texture, very roasted and bourbony flavour. A true sipper, incredibly heavy and warming beer.
Mini-snifter at Pazzo’s. Lots of caramel and vanilla. Taste is sweet but not overpowering.
This is a chalky brown beer without head. It’s delicious. There is flavor to spare. It’s totally smooth too. Would go awesome with a cuban.

From 22oz bottle to snifter, 2016 vintage. Pour is an intense black, thinner tan head that dissipates quickly. Large notes of roasted malt, coffee, caramel, molasses, booze. Taste is sweet with touches of bitter, heavy body. Oily mouthfeel with a lingering warmness from the alcohol. Unreal beer. The complexity is outstanding. Already looking forward to the 2017 batch.

2016 bottle poured into a snifter showing pitch black with no head. 

The nose shows a lightly sweet caramel note permeates through the center surrounded by strong alcoholic bourbon presence. 

The palate is full bodied, thick, sticky and oily with a light carbonation. Moderate sweetness appears on the mid-palate but mostly calm and clean bourbon through out - smoke, vanilla, and charred wood. Despite a strong ABV, it doesn’t become apparent until the finish which leaves a pleasant alcoholic spicy warmth. I can definitely see why this did so well

2016, 13,6%, dark brown black color, with a dark beige head, with a light boozy bourbon oak barrel, subtle maple syrup, fruity roasted, black, toasted malty nose, with a faint molasses, toffee, light coffee, burnt toast accent, and a mild vanilla, subtle burnt fruitcake, burnt toast note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth bourbonish, vanilla, subtle grated coconut, chocolate character, with some sweet fruity roasted, black, chocolate, toasted malty, faint toffee, molasses, coffee flavours, leading towards a warming smooth bourbonish, vanilla, coffeeish, chocolatey, lingering sweet fruity roasty maltiness finish.

Aromas of massive bourbon, chocolate, dark cocoa, toffee, figs, raisins, dark malts, leather, caramel, vanilla, hints of toasted coconut and oak. Pours pitch black with a thin brown rim and noticeable alcohol legs. Taste brings thick chocolate, dark malts, toffee, chocolate syrup, cocoa nibs, dark chocolate upfront. Mid palate offers heavy bourbon, barrel wood, vanilla and faint coconut. Finishes heavily boozy with complex dark malts, chocolate, fudge, malt syrup, figs and caramel. Overall, what else is there to say? It’s a legendary beer for a reason. Always a treat. A+ rating.

Bottle from Kroger. Black, thick, and oily with a very tiny short-lived tan head. Very smooth. Aroma of roast, whiskey barrel, and a hint of cocoa and dark fruit. Very rich chocolaty roasty taste with a light woodines. Excellent stout for sure, and no complaints, but not quite as bold as I’d hoped.

Why I found a bottle of this sitting alone on a shelf at my neighborhood Kroger will forever baffle me. Pours black with a dark tan head, cascading slippery lace. Aroma of wood, smoke, bourbon, cherry, licorice and chocolate.... Inviting enough. Super creamy and full on the tongue.... But still some pleasant carbonation. Heavy on the bourbon, you can taste the age in this beer... Chocolate covered cherry, vanilla, nice lactose edge wrapped it up. Quick burn as it slides down. No medicinal notes like you often get in beers like this... barely boozy. World class, but not top 50 in my opinion.

Poured 55 degrees into a pint ale glass. Appearance, opaque black almost no head. Aroma, vanilla, sour dough bread, and black licorice. Taste, light sweetness, smoke, and medium dark chocolate. Finish, clean with strong smoke, black licorice, and alcohol. A good stout but the 2016 bottle probably needs stored to mature.

11/25/16 2105 draft at Sams Quick Shop. 11/26/16 2016 draft at Beer Durham. Not surprisingly, 2105 was rounder with better blended flavor. 2016 had many distinct parts that fought with each other some. As advertised both were huge big beers. Bourbon aging and the booziness were prominent but not overwhelming. Roasted malt backbone was impressive.

on tap at belmont station. poured black as night. aromatics weren’t over the top but bourbon, vanilla, and a little woody licorice were discernible. when you take a sip of this magical elixir it just coats your mouth with a slightly oily, viscous sweetness, but well short of being cloying. great carbonation and hides the ABV very well. simply put, one of the most delicious beers i’ve had...ever.

2016 stout on tap and bottle. Tap was 14.4%, bottle was 13.8%. Aroma is bourbon, cherry, chocolate - very satisfying. Pours viscous, oily, and jet black with minimal head. Taste is bourbon up front, followed by a very pleasant lingering chocolate. Also detect notes of vanilla and oak. Mouthfeel is very creamy and luscious, with the perfect amount of carbonation. Overall a top world class BA stout. It is only slightly behind Bell’s Black Note for me, but I would still spend my black fridays chasing this instead of shopping - Cheers!

10/16/2008 bottle shared at Thanksgiving in honor of Cubs’ World Series triumph. Where to start for this 8-year-old? A little fitzzz upon opening let us know there was still a bit of carbonation in this jet-black beauty (but not enough to generate a head). Aroma of chocolate, molasses, vanilla, coffee and booze. It actually made my tongue and lips tingle each time I took another sip. Super heavy body. Long, sweet finish. Excellent. No more this old in the beer cellar, but looking forward to 2012-15 bottles waiting patiently.

2015 bottle shared at one year old. Lots of coconut on the nose, plus notes of vanilla and tobacco leaf, and hints of dried fig and old leather. On the palate it is rich and thick, syrupy and drying, with more coconut, touches of cocoa and vanilla. The finish is again cocoa and coconut plus a very dry and sweet aftertaste.

2014 bottle shared at deanso’s thanks to RandomStrangerNL! Pours black with a quickly fading tan head. Lots of roasted malts, molasses, bourbon and vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee and some toffee and fudge notes. Very sweet, medium bitter, nice bit of booziness to round it off. Full body with soft carbonation, drinking very smooth with a longlasting finish. Definitely prefer this mellowed out version to the 2015 version I tried last year.

2014 bottle (2 years old) shared at deanso’s thanks to RandomStrangerNL, thanks! Pitch black pour with a thick tan head. Notes of dark fruit, cocoa, chocolate, dark cherries, chocolate. Full body, medium carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish. A world-class beer.


2017 bottle at home, about 6 months old. Very dark brown pour with a tan head with poor retention. Compared to the 2017 vintage, it looks thinner and the head retention is poorer. Tons of bourbon, toffee, caramel in the aroma and taste, followed by vanilla, oak, coffee, burnt sugar. Compared to the 2014 vintage, this seems a bit lighter in body, boozier, less intense. Not much chocolate and no bitter cherries. Still very good, but feels a bit rushed. 4.3/5
A trully amazing imperial stout! A perfect brew indeed. A thick stout with tons of vanilla, raisin, woody, caramel, chocolate, coffee, nuts, and roasty aromas.

Bouteille 2015, pas infectée. Merci SlovakSniper! 

Apparence : Noire, léger col brun foncé sans réelle rétention sinon un anneau sur le pourtour du verre, carbonatation faible. 

Nez : Riche chocolat, vanille, bourbon, alcool. À un point, une image m’est venue en tête: un brownie avec des noix grillées dessus! 

Goût : Entrée de chocolat à la vanille, assez sucrée, bois, bourbon. On a par la suite droit à une deuxième vague distincte dans laquelle le chocolat est noir avec une légère amertume pour contrôler le sucre. La finale est assez douce marqué par le malt grillé et le fut alcoolisé. 

Sensation : Plutôt dense, effervescence faible, chaleureuse, longueur assez bonne, alcool qui monte au nez (ce n’est pas négatif). 

Bref : Je ne réécrirai pas l’histoire en disant qu’il s’agit d’une excellente bière! L’équilibre qu’on trouve entre le chocolat, l’amertume, le fut et la présence éthylique ne sont pas loin d’être parfaits. Exemplaires à tout le moins. S’il y a un léger déséquilibre, c’est en direction du sucre. Celui-ci tend à se balancer avec le reste des saveurs et des arômes plus la bière se réchauffe.

2015 bottle. Still nearly as hot as I remember it being a year ago, although it’s improved. Aroma is malty, chocolately, and even a bit nutty. Taste is malty caramel, rich chocolate, with medium-full mouth feel. But so so hot still. Maybe its the rose tinted glasses but i remember past releases so much more fondly.

Silny zapach bourbonu ktory w miare ogrzewania wchodzi w ciastko czekoladowe, a w smaku to wlasnie ciastko, gigantyczna kawa kawa, pralinki, oleista faktura i uogólniając, genialna rzecz. Zero alkoholu, zero uwag ode mnie, ciężko opisać, trzeba wypić.
Full bodied and midnight dark. Rich caramel and molasses with a bit of warmed wood and chocolate. Looks beautiful in the bottle and the glass.

Beer #2000 on Ratebeer:
Appearance: 2015 version. Brewed 09OCT15, luckily not an infected bottle. Very dark brown, basically black. Very dark tan head, short lived.
Aroma: Barrel, dark dark malt, prunes, vinous.
Taste: Dark malt, barrel, dark fruits. Toasted, vinous, warming. Hides alcohol very well. Great!
Bought: Trade with RobertDale - thanks a lot!, 500 ml
Info: 29/10-2016, BB: ??/??-????

Rate of the 2014 version:
Appearance: Very dark brown, near black. Dark tan head. Oily.
Aroma: Dark malt, roasted. Faint barrel.
Taste: Dark malt, roasted, slight barrel, but not too much. Sweetness. Still very good!
Bought: Trade with RobertDale - thanks a lot!, 355 ml
Info: 24/12-2018, BB: ??/??-????

12 Oz bottle. Pours pitch brown black ties no head and no legs. Aroma of bourbon, cinammon, coffee, alcohol, smoked bacon. Flavor is super sweet, chocolate, alcohol, bourbon, vanilla, finishing with roasty bitter. Full body with a heavy, oily mouthfeel and no carbonation. Overall, super complex and full of character. A little more sweet than I normally like, but awesome.

(2015) totalmente negra, espuma marrom de pouca formação e persistência. Aroma de côco, caramelo, chocolate, café, vanilla ... Complexidade difícil de igualar. Paladar de dulçor intenso, alcaçuz, medio amargor torrado. Corpo licoroso e baixa carbonatação. Final de longa persistência, caldo de cana, malte, café, chocolate, bourboun fica mais evidente com tempo de copo mas bem inserido, mantém a complexidade em todos os momentos, deliciosa.
Wow. Bourbon followed by Caramel and chocolate. Great balance of flavour. Poured dark with light thin head. Bottled 11/15.

Split with Sébastien from Beergium.

2015 version, not infected. Just a friggin taste bomb. Insanely thick. Epic.
Beautiful beer, dark, rich and full bodied. I drank it at room temperature and it was devine

Originally rated on 12/5/08. Wow ! what a beer, it pours out like syrup thick and heavy all the way. Blacker than night with a very thin dark tan cap, Aromas a plenty, molasses, raisin, vanilla, burbon soaked oak, and even a little coconut. Flavors were many and complex, At first sip the sweetness of molasses mixed with oak, chocolate and spices, with a slight coffee aftertaste, the alcohol wasnt really noticeable, only a slight burning in my belly and a plesant glow upon my face. Wish i had some more of it :)

16.9oz bottle of the 2015 batch. Pours like motor oil. Very small head. Smells of charred oak, vanilla bean, coffee, nice bourbon aroma as well. Tastes of coffee, cocoa, milk, figs, nice bourbon. On the finish. One of the best beers I have tasted.

Alkohol:  14,3% obj. 


 Data butelkowania:  20.10.2015 


 Kolor: Nieprzejrzyście czarny, smolisty, jak na szlachetne piwo przystało.  

 Piana:  Tego parametru obawiałem się najbardziej. Piana od samego początku syczała niesamowicie głośno i nawoływała do szybkiego zrobienia zdjęcia.
Była ona drobniuteńka, delikatna, beżowa i szybciutko redukowała się do niewielkiego krążka. Po zakręceniu kielichem pozostawały tylko nieliczne kropeczki na ściankach. 


 Zapach:  Po zrzuceniu magicznego firmowego kapselka poczułem najpiękniejszy i najbardziej wyraźny aromat bourbonu jaki kiedykolwiek czułem w piwie. Zapach mocnej dębowej beczki, mokrego drewna i destylatu tego szlachetnego alkoholu.
Aromat był tak głęboki i piękny, że bałem się nawet zakręcić butelką, aby wydobyć kolejne składowe. 
Po kilku chwilach poruszyłem lekko butelką i zaczęła się kolejna euforia zapachowa. Czego tutaj nie było: potężna waniliowa petarda, lody śmietankowo-waniliowe, cała paleta najlepszej jakości czekolady i trufle z czekoladą.
Na dalszym planie rodzynki, śliwki w polewie również czekoladowej i tylko szczypta paloności.
Zapach mnie ujął i złamał mi serce. W tej kategorii oceny komplet punktów: 10! 


 Smak:  Nie mogło być inaczej! Smak jest potężny i wielopłaszczyznowy. Króluje tutaj beczka po bourbonie. Szlachetny destylat wyczuwalny jest w smaku już od samego początku.
Czuć także wpływy beczki, jej przemoczone drewno, dąb amerykański oraz niekończący się posmak waniliny.
Na dalszym planie pojawiają się akcenty czekolady nadziewanej, mlecznych pralinek, truflii czekoladowych, karmelu, wiśni i śliwek w czekoladzie tudzież baryłek z alkoholem w środku.
Z daleka wyczuwalne są także na języku wiśnie i odrobina lukrecji.
Zdumiewający jak dla mnie jest fakt, że jest tutaj minimum posmaków kawowych, tak bardzo charakterystycznych dla 90% RIS-ów.
Smak jest niesamowicie kompleksowy i wielowymiarowy.
Goryczka jest średnia z długim czekoladowym i likierowym posmakiem w ustach. Alkohol jest delikatnie wyczuwalny, ale nie wymagam od tego piwa cudów, w końcu to 14,3% obj. alk.!
W niektórych 9%-wych Imperialnych Stoutach był on bardziej wyczuwalny.
Jest on rozgrzewający, ale nie gryzący i absolutnie nie rozpuszczalnikowy. Nadaje dostojnego tonu temu trunkowi.
Faktura gęsta, oleista, bardzo zbita. 
Odczucie w ustach pełne, wyklejające, ale nie zamulające.
Wysycenie niskie w stronę średniego.
Nieprawdopodobny mocarz, wielki RIS! Wybitny przez duże "W". 


Wysycenie: Niskie, idzie w stronę wysokiego.

 Podsumowanie:  


Genilany, wybitny i jedyny w swoim rodzaju trunek. 
Nie osiągnie co prawda statusu najlepszego RIS-a w moim życiu, ze względu na fatalną pianę.
Z pewnością będzie jednak 
w Top 5 RIS-ów.

Mogę również z niezmierną satysfakcją określić go jako najlepiej wyleżakowane piwo w beczce po bourbonie.

W żadnej innej mojej degustacji ta beczka nie była tak mocno wyczuwalna, tak trwała i tak głęboko zaznaczona.

Piwo ma szeroki wachlarz walorów smakowo-zapachowym. Nie sposób ich wszystkich wymienić.
Jest tego mnóstwo.
Przeczytajcie wszystko powyżej, ja jestem pod ogromnym wrażeniem.
Takie RIS-y kocham najbardziej i serce mi się tylko łamie, że są one tak słabo dostępne i tak limitowane...:(

2007 bottle. The aroma is smokey, and a little caramel, chocolate and coffee. Pours black, no head and good lacing. The taste is bitter. The body is full, the texture creamy, the carbonation soft and the finish long. Very Good for 2007!

Aroma of bourbon, brown sugar, almond, vanilla, oak, pipe tobacco, fudge, chocolate. 
Pours almost pitch black with a film of beige head. 
Taste follows the nose with huge depth and complexity. Loads of bourbon coming through and warming sweet alcohol that compliments rather than detracts. Intense sweetness balanced by nice smokey and charred notes. 
Medium plus body, soft carbonation, velvety mouthfeel. Awesome stuff!

2014 bottle. Pours black with a slight brown head that quickly dissipates. Little light passes through the edges of the beer. Bourbon/oak, chocolate, almond nose. Coffee, vanilla flavor with layers of flavors found on the nose. Thick mouthfeel. Long hot bourbon finish.
Tap at Whole Foods, Omaha location. Poured black, lasting tan head. Aroma was bourbon, smoke, chocolate and vanilla. Taste was sweet bourbon, bitter chocolate, boozy.

2013 bottle. Pours black with a thin, tan head. Aroma has great, smooth notes of bourbon barrel, roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, wood spice, molasses, and that slight tart fruit I get from barreled beers. Taste is balanced well and not too sweet. Dark chocolate, bourbon barrel, wood spice, caramel, dark fruits, and a smooth, bourbon filled, alcohol warmed ending. Full body with a medium-low carbonation. Syrupy but not cloying in the mouth with a dry finish. Overall a really big beer with lots going on. I’m sure I’ve missed things. Dark chocolate, roast, bourbon, toffee, caramel, wood spice, and faint alcohol. Delicious and nicely aged.

Bottle. Thanks to Werckmeister. Black body tan head. Aroma is cocoa fruits with wood and bourbon. Taste is coffee dark caramel burnt wood dried fruits. Aftertaste is nice some alcohol some burnt malts some caramel malts. Nice.

500 ml bottle, bottled Sep 15.

Black body, with a small, dense, coffee-colored head.

Aroma of bourbon, dark chocolate, cocoa, liquorice, coffee, some alcohol.

Taste follows this, with additional vanilla and more booze.

Full, oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.

Finishes boozy, but smooth, with cocoa, coffee, dark chocolate, some liquorice, some dark fruits.



Tasty. Very well integrated bourbon notes, overall really smooth, except that the alcohol is a bit too present for my liking. Overall great stuff, but not among my favourite Imperial Stouts.

0,5l at home shared by 4 from trade with amazngwrldfood, big thanks. Vintage 2015. Bottled 22.09.2015. ABV 13.7%. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells of vanilla, wood, bourbon, alcoholic, light dark fruits, raisins. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dark fruits, raisins, light vanilla, licorice, spices, wood, bourbon, some alcohol. finishes rather alcoholic with notes of spices, vanilla, licorice and some bourbon. good stuff, a bit alcoholic, but every nice.

Aroma chocolate, roasty, vanilla, woody, bourbon, 
Appearance black, minimal head, tan foam, brown foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate full body, thick feel, 
Overall this is one of the infected batches so it’s hard for me to give a honest opinion. To me the taste is full flavor of barrel bourbon and booze. I can’t tell if it is infected because this is the first time having it. Not getting any tart flavors. I think it’s a really good stout that I would like to try uninfected. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Bottle from 2012. Thanks chris! - Sweet bourbon and oak. The complexity from the bourbon comes through, big time! Chocolate syrup. Flavor has tons of vanilla, milk chocolate and coffee. Bourbon and more chocolate. This was hands down amazing. One of the best beers ive tried. Lives up to the hype!

Bottle 0,355. 2012 edt. Vanilla, cocoa, raisins, alcohol is noticeable. Taste is alcohol, vanilla, coffee and a hint of chocolate. The alcohol is overwhelming, it’s almost like drinking liquor. To much alcohol, otherwise quite good. Full body, oily and sticky texture, soft carbonation.

Great beer as always. Disappointed they produced so much in 2015. Hopefully their quality isn't going down.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015. Aroma of pralines, cherry, vanilla, roasty, coffee. Taste is sweet, light bitter at end. Flavor of chocolate, bourbon, Barrel, vanilla, chocolate cake, pralines. Full body, oily and velvet texture.

2012. Very smooth, full body, oily and great.

2015 bottle. Could easily pass for chocolate liquor. Tried it out because of the hype, I find it too sweet. While it feels smooth and oily with a warm aftertaste, there’s not a lot of room left for other details because of the sweetness. Wouldn’t recommend.

This is over rated, over hyped, and way over priced. I cannot understand the huuuuuge following. I read/skimmed a thousand ratings of this and only found a few that made sense to me. Looks great. Ink black. Poured into a tulip with no head at all. Smelled musty. Taste was overly sweet and I wondered if it was attempting to be a sour gone bad. Compared it to Brer Rabbitt molasses and that wasn’t it. Compared it to Sorghum and it was spot on except BCBS is much darker. Felt oily and syrupy. Looked for the strong bourbon flavor and alcohol that are mentioned in so many reviews, but don’t find it. I like a good bourbon and this shows none of it. Lingering medicinal taste on the tongue. I’ll never recommend this to anyone and I’ll never purchase it again. Unfortunately I got caught up in the hype and have two more large bottles. Guess I’ll need to "share" them with our beer club or give them away.

2014 bottle shared. Thanks Gregg! Pours a jet black with a tiny ring of tan head that lingers for a little bit. Molasses, cacao nibs, vanilla, toasted caramel and bourbon notes dominate the nose. Light tobacco and soy sauce are in the background but fairly well-balanced and leans to the sweet side. Average carbonation and a chocolately finish with some warming bourbon notes. Fairly creamy on the palate as well with the vanilla notes shining. World class for sure.
On tap to mini snifter. Pours black, brown ring head. Aroma of chocolate, barrel oak, creme brulee, bourbon. The barrel flavor is huge but smooth and balanced.

Awesome stout. Tried multiple times. Barrel flavor is huge, a bit boozy and hot, dark chocolate, roasted malt, and everything good is in this bottle. 2009 vintage bottle was the best I’ve tried, and that bottle probably deserved a solid 4.7. But in average, I say 4.3

Pours cola black with thin head. Aromas of vanilla bean, cacao, caramel, and bourbon; this is truly incredible. Taste is nearly identical to nose, but so smooth and creamy that it shouldn’t be possible. Vanilla, caramel, slightly smoky, the barrel-flavor present but not overbearing. Worth waiting for, and worth the price if you can find it.

Hazy, dark brown to black, thick and syrupy, flat, small to no head. Aroma is of brown sugar, molasses, caramel, some chocolate, roasted malt, strong vanilla and bourbon barrel, light alcohol. Taste is very sweet brown sugar, molasses, caramel and some chocolate, strong vanilla and bourbon, oak, roasted malt, medium roasty bitterness, some alcohol but mostly very well hidden, some warmth in the finish, long lasting aftertaste. Full bodied, flat, thick and bit sticky.
(bottle from the brewery from a colleague who did some commissioning there)
Drank from a sample glass, shared amongst friends. Pours black, zero head. Amazing aromas of chocolate and caramel. Nice flavor, a bit of a burn from the bourbon but nothing extreme. Well done!

#3000, edit---BCS 2015 variant, schenkt stroperig dik zwart met kaki kraag. Aroma van donkere chocolade, koffie, mout, geroosterd, en een heerlijke Bourbon.
Smaken zijn behoorlijk aan de dikke kant, romig mondgevoel, enorm veel donkere chocolade, behoorlijk zoet, enorm plakkerig, super zachte en gebalanceerde Bourbon, gebrande mouten, koffie, molasse, vanille, hout, zeer lichte bitterheid die in de afdronk erg zacht blijft mede dankzij de bourbon, volle body, zachte co2, smooth... werkelijk een fantastisch bier... zonder de speciale gelegenheid een 4.8
--2018 variant, 15.2%, alcoholisch en vrij scherp, voor mij mist de zachte balans, ik vond hem te scherp alcoholisch. 3.75, hoge rating van 4.8 aangepast naar 4.5

A: Pitch black with a nice brown head
N: Bourbon, coffee, vanilla, chocolate
T: Vanilla, coffee, bourbon, molasses, caramel, liqourice
O: Very thick and creamy mouthfeel. Excellent mouthfeel!

Big. Boozy. Complex. Balanced. Lots of chocolate and bourbon and dark fruit. Nice little alcoholic warmth. Real treat. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
2015版bcbs，饮用于北京醉开始。外观：深黑色酒体，稀薄的棕色酒头。 气味：奶香，太妃糖，烘烤麦芽，可可，酒精味中等，可能因为陈放时间不够。口感：酒体适中，二氧化碳含量较低，沙口不强，巧克力、麦芽的香甜，有轻微的酒精刺激感，收口微苦，尾韵长。 非常平衡而出色的一款过桶帝国世涛，必饮款。

Catch up rating from Saturday’s RIS bottle share. Big boozy aroma, taste with plenty of burn. Muddy, black pour, kind of dull, but looks as expected. Sip slowly to savor the flavor, but not slow enough to singe your nose hairs with the burn. Will warm you up fast. 2008, 2015, 2018 and 2019 vintages sampled.

The 2015 from the bottle is dark chocolate brown with very little light penetration, the aroma is bourbon and oak, the taste is a rich chocolate with a little bit of raisin overtones and deep malty flavor, the mouthfeel is velvety thick and very very smooth. The finish is like a bourbon with a warm alcohol feel that lingers in the back of the throat.

27/03/2016 - 33cl bottle shared by Jürgen Simoen @ Estaminet & Brouwerij d’Oude Maalderij.
Dark brown to black with just a small lacing. Nose is some toffee, vanilça, huge alcohol. Taste is chocolate, toffee, lots of booze, burning like hell. Way too heavy on the booze. On the second sip, I thought, maybe if I’m at ease @home I would like it more, but not for this time. However, thanks to Jürgen for sharing this. Another Inbev rating, I didn’t pay for.
16.9 ounce bottle purchased at Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL for $9.99 Excellent!

Bottle shared with douchs courtesy of Alex thx mate A: chocolate, licorice, caramelized sugars, dates, alcohol, bourbon App: pitch black small beige head. T/p: full body with sweet medium long finish. Some warmness from the alcohol. Soft carbonation. O: really an amazing brew. Big, powerful all the flavours are really well integrated. Better than sex. 
 1500th rating

Draught at NYC Craft beer festival.
Dark black, brown head
aroma of vanilla chocolate bourbon
taste velvet smooth, vanilla, sweet slight chocolate
Love

Bottle, v2012 (drunk in 2014). Pours pitch black with small beige head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, roastiness, molasses - great blend with bourbon dominating but not overwhelming other notes. In taste medium sweet, full of vanilla, wood, chocolate and coffee. Full bodied, bold, smooth mouthfeel. Finish is roasty and bitter. Ideal mix of dominant bourbon and other RIS notes.
Same batch drunk in 2015 - bourbon notes much less dominant, the beer was much more balanced, all flavours were more blended. Still great but I prefer more fresh version myself.

Flaska från 2012. Svart öl med ett lättare brunt skum. Doft av malt, choklad, lättare rostade toner och bourbon med inslag av vanilj. Samma återkommer i smaken. Mjuk och balanserad trotts den höga alkoholhalten. Lagringen har nog bidragit till detta.

From tap at hoppyloft brussels, aroma is huge, bourbon, molasses, toffee, caramel, alcohol. Taste is very sweet, very thivk smooth mouthfeel. Amazing bourbon stout finish. Prefer when it’s aged more, 2014 bottles are an even bigger blast.

Pitch black color with brown foam head. Round vanilla barrel nose and light smoke. The taste is spikey with a light chili spiciness, vanilla and smoke. The aftertaste is calm, roasty and with a bit of chocolate.

Jet black pour with a thin, brown head. The aroma bourbon, molasses, vanilla, wood, and a hint of raisin. It has a full body with smooth texture and average carbonation. The taste is roasted with some dark fruit flavor and a warm finish. This beer is amazing. Happy Birthday to me!

From a trade with sneakychi. Black color with beige head. Aroma is wood, vanilla, ash, booze. Taste is chocolate, spicy, boozy, roasted malts and bitterness as well. Medium carbonation. A completely overloaded Bourbon Stout with a good balance that has more harmony than it should have. Excellent.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4, 2012 vintage, many thanks! Lots lots of sweet dessert, pastry, berries, vanilla wood. Boozy in a good way, ashy too, also in a good way. Yes, bourbon too. Well balanced, way way more than you would expect from such a complexity and extremity. What. A. Beer!

At home. Bottle kind courtesy of Maakun! Bottle from 2013. Black with quickly dissolving tan head. Deep roasted sweet chocolate malts, bourbon, very syrupy, underlaying melasse base, sweet sweet bourbon, light spices and vanilla. Very sweet! Texture is like a chocolate bavarois with bourbon. Quiet carbonation. Very thick syrupy finish and intense toffee aftertaste. Daaaaamnn. Nice! And big thanks for the opportunity!

Bottle 2013 shared, massive thanks to Santa bytemesis!!  Tried head to head with the 2014 coffee. Black with brown head that lasts about 30 seconds and leaves no trace. Massive bourbon, vanilla, sweet chocolate, dried red fruits, toffee, massive chocolate candy, some spices, light butter. Just loads of sweet desert notes. Very sweet with very light roasted bitter finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Massive. Has better desert notes than the coffee, but is also quite a bit sweeter, almost to the point of being too sweet. Classic.
12 oz bottle pours black with a brown head. Aroma of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon and malts. Taste is chocolate, coffee, toffee, and bourbon.

For a 14.2% ABV Stout, it surpasses my expectations. Aromas of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, and toffee. Fantastic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled from tap at ’Beertemple’, 2015 vintage, 13.4% abv. Pitch black with a thin, tan to brown layer. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty aroma of huge bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee and molasses. Sweet, roasty-malty taste of huge bourbon up front, vanilla, dark chocolate, coffee and molasses, followed by a long, roasty-bitter, warming, slightly boozy finish. Full body, thick and oily mouthfeel, flat. Very complex, maybe a tad too boozy, but overall great!

Thick and oily stout with over the average intensive bourbon barrel aging on top of delicious toffee, coffee, black chocolate notes. Cloying sweet but mellowed by BA. It’s a solid and a very delicious RIS. Mind all the reputation ..it lives up to it. I hope I’ll be able to drink it again some time.

Pitch black color. Modest beige head. Creamy sweet caramel, vanilla, hints of bourbon, licorice, smoke in the aroma. Caramel, hints of bourbon at first. Vanilla, brown sugar in the middle. Smooth bourbon finish. Hints of wood, licorice, and bourbon in the aftertaste. Creamy, silky, very well balanced beer. The bourbon is always there, but it is very enjoyable and do not disturb or cover other tastes. Exceptional.

Bottle. Pours a dark black with a thin tan head that fades quick. Taste is of roasted malt, chocolate, grain, bourbon, hops, vanilla and chocolate. Similar aroma. Has a full body. Easy to drink and rather enjoyable.
2nd lowest alcohol percentage of the series’ history. That’s disappointing. However, it is still one of the best Stouts you can find.

Bottle, 500ml. Opaque dark brown with a minimal, frothy brown head. Intense aromas of bourbon, dried fruits, alcohol. Robust bodied with moderate carbonation. Rich and smooth. Sweet roasted character with a heavy bitter alcohol finish. Very heavy and complex, yet exquisite.

Bottle, 500ml. A dark beer with a small brown head. Intense aroma of bourbon, coffee, nuts, almonds and dark chocolate. Taste is bitter with a roasted malt character. Rich and oily, with a complex character that reminds me of nuts. Strong alcoholic finish, but well balanced considering its high ABV. A world class beer.

Sample @ PGH Beerfest. Pours very dark with little foam. Strong aroma of bourbon. Rich and think texture with too much sweet bourbon flavor and alcohol warmth for my liking. Its OK but not my favorite style.
Aromas of chocolate and vanilla, very long finish, sweet with balancing bitterness.
Van de tap @Uiltjebar. Eindelijk mag ik hem proeven aroma en smaak van gedroogd fruit, pruimen en bourbon. Maar zo ontzettend zacht van smaak. Niets teveel gezegd door de liefhebbers!
Backlog, early amateur rating! @ Havregatan 20130315. Bottle from Systembolaget. [ Vintage 2012 ]. Roasted malty with coffee and chocolate.

Shit tons of booze on the nose, lots of sweet dark roast, dark chocolate, vanilla, bourbon Darker fruit also. Pours black with a non lasting thin tan head that settles out to nothing. Flavors of super sweet boozey bourbon, dark chocolate, roasted malts, wood, vanilla. Big boozy warming imperial stout. A solid BA imperial stout, even though this years version was kind of weak.

500ml bottle (2019) @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie, July 20. Thanks Blackhaddock for this! Good to try the original after the Monk's Cafe version 4 years ago, though it really is a good example of a beer that shouldn't be merged, as they are quite clearly very different beers. This has an excellent grainy chocolatey character, good bourbon presence. Nowhere near as rich or as good as the Monk's Cafe beer which I gave 4.6 overall. Will have to down-rate unfortunately.

Feb 11th 2016: 250ml bottle as Monks Cafe Goose Island Bourbon County Stout, from trade with Omhper! Many many many thanks chap. Pours black with fast-receding head. Aroma is rich, decadent, booze-ridden chocolate cake. Taste is tar slick & oily. Smooth, bourbon-fused but not off-puttingly boozy. The bourbon merely radiates with it’s smooth vanilla and almond tones as the dark malts simmer in the background. This is serious stuff.

Roasted coffee and bourbon notes waft from this obsidian beauty, which seems like the reason for Spiegelau's stout glass to exist.

Rich mouthfeel, as light bubbliness plays out caramels to match the velvet burn.

This is an amazing beer, well suited to lovers of Founder's seminal Breakfast Stout or Firestone Walker's Velvet Merlin. It's not a revelation, it's just good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Thick mouthfeel. Motor oil flow with brown head. Burnt sugar aroma. Doesn’t come off as overly sweet. Not boozy at all. Trail is raspberry and dark fruit. That said, I read some of this batch was contaminated, and I may be getting some of that -- maybe some rubber cement.

Rating #1655 - #CBC2015 Beer 40 - Day 4 - On tap at 10 Barrel Portland w/ Pours an opaque black beauty with a rich tan foam. Aroma is heavy roast malt, mild smoke, toffee , molasses, vanilla,oak. Taste is heavy on roast malt and coffee flavours, lots of burnt sugar, toffee, bourbon vanilla, blackstrap molasses. A lovely beer that hits on all of my favourite things.

A 1 pint .9 fl oz (500ml) bottle with a bottled on date of 22nd October 2015, poured into a snifter glass. It poured an extremely dark dark brown colour with a reddish hue on the sides. Dark tanned head was very thin and did not last long and there was some thin spotty lacing. Rich rich aromas full of bourbon, oak, caramel, salted chocolate and vanilla. Tastes much like the aromas. It was full of bourbon, oak, caramel, salted chocolate and vanilla. Stunning, heavenly goodness. Full bodied, thick motor oil like richness. Low carbonation. Nice light burn as it goes down. Overall… Wow, this was amazing… a brilliant sipper. Even drinking it 3 months in, aromas, taste and feel were already wonderful. It should develop more complexity with a year or two of aging, which is what I’m going to do with the rest of my bottles.

Black color. Dark, tan head that collapses rather quickly. Freckled lacing. Alcohol is really coming out in the aroma. Woody. Smokey. Vanilla. Chocolate. Blackberries. Charcoal. Creamy texture. Light carbonation. Taste like a smoked briscuit. Hickory and maybe some mesquite. Long smokey finish. Alcohol is more hidden in the taste than the aroma. Heavy body. This beer seems to stick with you well after the drink. Tasty.

Heavy black licorice smell. Dark in color as with any traditional imperial stout. Light bourbon or smoke flavor on the tongue, coffee and dense smoke on the back of the tongue. Wonderful. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Look: almost black, opaque and clear.

Aroma: vanilla, molasses, coffee with rum,
Taste; sweet with prominent matured alcohol notes.
Flavour: vanilla, wood, charcoal, prunes, pleasant mature alcohol.

Very good and complex.

Pours jet black with virtually no head. Rich and complex aroma of bourbon, dark chocolate, oak barrel, coffee, roasted malts and some smoke. Very thick yet drinkable. Complex taste of chocolate, bourbon, coffee, liquor-like alcohol and malt that has a bitter-sweet finish. Really great multi-layered imperial stout.

The aroma of bourbon ad chocolate hit you first. It appears almost black with very little head retention, most likely due to the high alcohol. Btw this stuff stains the carpet. Taste/flavor, raisin coffee, chocolate, caramelized sugar note smash your faces and then a slight alcohol heat that is really unwanted. Again the alcohol burn ruins the palate. Understood this alcohol burn should be expected due to the high abv. But still a mellowing of this beer "aging" should be done. I Bet After 2 OR 3 Years. This will be amazing.

After Goose Island pioneered the bourbon barrel aged stout every brewery in the country decided they needed to offer a rendition, similar to the way every brewery now has to offer an IPA in their product lineup. However, none of these offerings duplicate what Goose Island has done. The smoothness and depth of flavor are simply unmatched, which is why all bourbon barrel aged stouts are inevitably compared to the BCBS measuring stick.

As far as stouts go I found this bourbon barrel to be heavy and full of ranging flavor from first sip to final taste. I recommend slow drinking so you can savor the changes as it reaches room temperature. Further recommendations include surrounding yourself with family members, holiday spirit, a full belly, and some stop animation Christmas classics.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nice smooth bourbon flavor which is up front. Nice sweet boozy aroma that accompanies the bourbon smell.

2015 edition. Bottle bought online from Blackwell's. Pours jet black with small tan head. Great aroma of bourbon. Bourbon taste is upfront and well integrated with stout. Balance is excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015 edition. Pours out oily black with a sandy head that disappears quickly and leaves A light ring around the glass. I get some okay lacing as I swirl the glass to stir up some more head. Aromas of dark chocolate, leather, with boozy barrel notes. Silky mouthfeel, with tons of thick chocolate, bourbon, oak, tons of residual sweetness. Really great non adjunct stout.

2014 release - Smooth, low carbonation, bitter chocolate and coffee, syrupy, vanilla, slight bourbon burn in finish, very dark, oak/bourbon aroma. Pairs well with bbq pork and heavy meats, pairs poorly with pork and lighter meats

2012 vintage. 1 finger brown head, black body. Nose: Bourbon and coconut . Aroma: Caramel, brown sugar, bourbon, dark chocolate, coconut, fudge, licorice and the slightest hint of soy-sauce. Smooth, velvet mouthfeel. Long ending with some bitterness and some sweetness. A masterpiece!

Vintage 2012 (Abv 15%).

Pours tar black, totally smooth. Zero head even with an uncontrolled pour. Aroma is treacle dominant, with bourbon woodiness overlaid. Flavour is initially woody and coffee heavy, but opens into vanilla and chocolate with lightly leathery tones. Molasses flavour present throughout. Mouthfeel is creamy smooth, almost melted chocolate like in coating the tongue. Most akin to a fortified wine in regard to ABV & richness. 

This is a superb beer, only made better by aging. It is however a little unbalanced towards overwhelming molasses sickliness at the expense of its other flavours.

2015 Bottle. Pours Black with think head. Aroma is Chocolate and Bourbon. Taste is sweet chocolate bourbon with a bourbon alcohol, vanilla finish. Delicious and excited to let a bottle age another year or two.

(Goose Island Bourbon County Stout) Bottle 355 ml at home,thanks to hackobock! Vintage 2012, served into a snifter. ABV 15%
Pitch black colour on the body, minimal dark brown head on top, with average retention.
Aroma of alcohol, vanilla, bourbon, light molasses, dark roasted malts. 
Intense taste of vanilla, roasted malts and bourbon, hints of dark chocolate on between sips, light alcohol, more bourbon on the finish.
Full body with good carbonation. 
Very good, surely stands up to its fame.

What more can you say, this is one of the best stouts out there, it’s worth the hype. The only thin I can say is if you don’t like the burn stay out of the kitchen because this one is a burner for sure.
Bottle. Dark brown murky pour with a thin tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, some dark fruit. Taste is much the same. Delicious. Wow.

16.9oz bottle, poured into a snifter. The aroma is initially a strong cherry, followed by some caramel, a smokiness, a light vanilla, and leather / charred wood. The beer pours an oily, thick black brown, topped by a thin, dense brown head that has light retention, and a very light lace. The taste is a high bittersweet. The texture is viscous and chewy with a light fizz and a full body. Flavors of chocolate, caramel, nuts, tart, dark fruit, and smokiness are prevalent. The finish is clean and woody with a fruit flourish and leaves and aftertaste of cloying chocolate and caramel, nuts, and sweet fruit. This aftertaste fades and is relatively clean.

Very fine aroma and appearance indeed. Perhaps a few years in the bottle stored in my cellar will do it well but right now too sweet and syrupy for my taste...needs to calm a bit. Wonderful potential though.

HUGE aroma of bourbon and some oak. Jet black color, opaque body, reddish brown head, no retention, no lacing. Thick, heavy full body. Smooth, creamy mouth feel. Enjoying the flavor much more this year. Chocolate, slight roastiness, caramel, and of course sweet bourbon. Very nice over all.

Merry Christmas to me! 2015 Bottle. Black as a coal mine, tiny mahogany head, short lived. Opaque, thick & strong with coffee, unsweetened cocoa, wood, burnt toast and yes, bourbon. It has loads of layers that makes this very complex and tasty. So much going on in this beer. Can’t wait to try other years and compare them.

Pretty amazing beer

Glad I got 2 of them. The other bottle is aging. 

Aroma is crazy strong. Oak, caramel wow. 

Impossible to determine that this is a 13% beer. 

Can’t wait to try it down the road

Bottle. Pours jet oily black with a quickly dissipating reddish brown bubble head. Aroma of chocolate, treacle, sherry, dark fruits. Taste is of chocolate, maple syrup, dark fruits, bourbon, warming alcohol notes on the finish. Sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation. 8.3.8.4.18

3/11/2016 - Draught. Pitch black with an eventually fading coffee brown bubbly head. Aroma is of coffee, rich dark chocolate, raisins, figs, blackcurrant, hint if liquorice, leather. Taste is of dark fruits, caramel, dark chocolate, raisins, blackcurrant, plums, slightly boozy finish. Slick, sticky oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

2015 edition. 16.9 oz bottle. Touch of "smoke" at opening. Served just slightly chilled. Poured in tulip glass, wish i had a snifter. Very thin dark tan head which disappears quickly. No lacing. Aroma is roasted malt and bourbon. Taste is light to medium sweet with a slight acidic bitterness. Roasted malts.Good notes of bourbon, some charred oak and slight vanilla. Alcohol warming is present but taste dosn’t overly stand out. Over all a great barrel aged stout. Very enjoyable. Will age one in tje cellar a few months.

Despite ImBev ownership, I’ve always found this to be in my top 20 best relatively easy to find beers on earth, with a year of age or more. The big bourbon and dark malt aroma, the rich dark chocolate, the warming feeling. Lovely. Today I’m drinking a 2008 and it’s held up well relative to potential oxidation and overall flavor breakdown. The bourbon is not as pungent as later editions but still remains rich and satisfying. 
I’m rating this not from this particular bottle but from 7 or so years of enjoyment. Absolutely fantastic with 1-3 years of age, and darn tasty fresh or in it’s many variations.

Too much flavor. No really excellent beer. Tastes like something aged and high quality.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Christmas Eve Crispy Wings and Family Beer Tasting. Aroma is cherry, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate muffins. Taste is creamy smooth with loads of vanilla, cherry and chocolate. Alcohol is very well hidden. Had this back-to-back with Pugachev’s Cobra... the Cobra was so much more boozy (despite the slightly lower ABV). A great beer...perhaps a bit overrated but delicious and totally worth seeking out.

700th beer rated. A good way to mark the occasion. 2015 vintage. Bottled 10/01/15, 13.7% abv. Pours motor oil with a surprisingly large tan head. Aroma is lots of bourbon, vanilla, oak, chocolate, roasted malt. But for 13.7%, not bad! It’s absolutely Delicious smelling. Wow! Flavor is vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, the body is perfect and it’s 13.7%? Wow, can’t tell at all for such a big beer. This is absolutely phenomenal.

2015 14.3% enjoyed from a bottle in a tulip/snifter at World of Beer in The Villages, Florida. 

Half finger head settles to a ring. Dark tan. Body is dark brown. Little to no lacing.

Raisin. Bourbon. Vanilla. Caramel.

Raisin is strong. Caramel. Vanilla. Chocolate. Char. Bourbon. Smoke.

For some reason doesn’t sit as well as the coffee. Smooth for abv. Definitely warms you up.

Raisin. A lot of raisin. Came from Ohio to get warm in Florida.
wasn’t that impressed this year. they need to up their game. i guess that’s what happens when you SELL OUT!

375ml bottle from gift. Thanks Alex L. (not me) Aroma: awesome bourbon and coffee, chocolate and a hint of vanilla. Kinda woody. Wow! App: really dark black with burgundy tint, small brown head, little lacing. Taste and palate: full body, medium sweetness, smooth, really smooth, nice not overwhelming bitter and alcohol finish. Perfect palate. Overall: wow! This is so good. So well balanced. Just wow! A really awesome beer to start my vacation. Glad some more after coming my way.

Multiple vintages, in bottle and on draft. One of the first barrel-aged beers, and still one of the very best. Strong bourbon taste and smell that you start getting well before you take your first sip. Part of the secret to this beer’s success is the base stout, which is noticeably sweeter than your average Imperial Stout. Combined with the barrel, this is a sweet, boozy tribute to all the best things that can come from the combination of American brewing and American bourbon.

Je n’aurais pu me permettre de me prononcer sur cette bière après une seule dégustation et ce, pour de nombreuses raisons. Une première est que cette bière figure certainement dans mon top 3 à vie. Je pourrais également évoquer la complexité de la bière mais disons simplement que le prétexte est parfait pour en boire régulièrement et en faire mon 100e rating d’imperial stout! À mes débuts dans l’univers de la bière, ce nom évoquait en moi quelque chose de magique; une Force Supérieure transcendante. Ce qui était pour moi le summum de l’inaccessibilité m’émerveillait. Je m’imaginais déguster une "Bourbon County" et j’en frissonnais presque! C’est SlovakSniper (je te salue bien bas mon ami) qui un jour m’a proposé tout bonnement et simplement de m’en apporter une bouteille que je n’ai su conserver bien longtemps. Tout d’elle m’a immédiatement conquis: sa tête de couleur caramel, son corps à la fois soyeux, robuste et délicat. Les chaudes vapeurs de Bourbon du sud américain, de caramel, de réglisse, de café noir et de vanille. Ne sont-elles pas merveilleuses? Puis vient le moment où je porte le verre à mes lèvres... Une chaleur angélique me couvre de sa blancheur protectrice. Un profond sentiment de bien-être m’envahit tant le liquide est complexe et sensuel. Je crois embrasser les cuisses de Mademoiselle Irina. Je ferme les yeux et je déguste en silence, contemplatif. À ce jour j’ai dû déguster cette bière plus de 20 fois. Elle est pour moi la bière des Grands Moments et je ne peux m’empêcher, à chaque fois que je décapsule une Bourbon County, de me rappeler à quel point j’ai convoité cette bière il y a de cela, pas si longtemps finalement!

Poured into a brandy snifter from a 2015 bottle that indicated 13.7% ABV. Completely opaque, black motor oil pour with nearly no head, and an almost wine like aroma that you can smell just pouring into the glass. Once you put your nose in the glass and after it starts to warm, the bourbon & stout characteristics start to come through with a light roast, some chocolate, vanilla, and some sour mash. Wow the flavors! Sweet chocolate and vanilla with a very light roasted edge and only a hint of the alcohol that is in this big beer. Very soft drinking ale with a wonderful bourbon flavor in the background. Each sip reminds you of how big this beer is and is packed with sweet & sour bourbon flavor.  This just gets better and better as it warms and even room temp wouldn’t be too warm to drink and towards the end of my glass, I only want it to continue.  Overall sweet, soft, vanilla forward, port wine like and delicately bittered stout that is a must for any serious connoisseur.

Aroma: bourbon, smoke, caramel
Appearance: black with a brown head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, bourbon, vanilla, smoke
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Most excellent

Aromas of dry fruit, chocolate, tea. Port-like nose. Pours pitch black with foam that dissapears in a jiffy. Port, alcohol warmth, molasses, coffee and chocolate. Absolutely perfect. 2015 vintage. I’m positive it can develop even greater flavor aging for couple years.

Aroma of brown sugar. Vanilla. Sweet not much barrel. Very thick flavors. Toasty dark malt on tongue. Hides the alcohol. Light bitter and lots of vanilla. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at SFO. Pitch black, no head. Incredibly balanced and rich aroma and taste with roasted malty chocolate and coffee and toffee, dried fruits like figs and plums, smooth bourbon and cask vanilla, smokey/roasted malty bitter finish. Long-lasting sweet bourbon-y aftertaste. Huge body, low carbonation, velvety soft mouthfeel. (Dec 2015)
Re-rate 2016 ed. Biggest body and packing mouthfeel thinkable: complex, boozy bourbon roasted malty, dried fruity goodness.
Vintage 2012 @ 10/8/21. Beautiful oily thick black pour, no real head. Nose has a great lot of boozy bourbon with chocolate, coffee, vanilla, toffee, honey tobacco, char, leather. Taste is thick and oily, boozy and sweet, porto vinous tone, caramel, toffee, chocolate, dried fruits, some oaky dry and medium bitter tones to round it of - quite strong and harsh but awesome balance. Super long lasting aftertaste that keeps on building in complexity. Huge body, oily sticky mouthfeel, low carbonation.
The grand daddy of them all. This tastes exactly as I expected. Perfect. The stout to rule them all.

Goose Island Bourbon County Stout is a boozy monster of a beer. Thick dark pour with a brown head. Aroma is surprisingly muted but definitely a light bourbon note. Taste is very boozy like someone put a shot of bourbon in your good quality stout -- not very well balanced. Bourbon County Stout may appeal most to those who like to sip bourbon, but it needs more balance as a beer.
Bottle @ and shared by benzai... small beige head quickly gone.... all the wayz black... smell vanilla coffee bourbon... taste chocolate liqourish some prune coffee....

Type: 500ml (16.9-oz.) glass
Glass: AleSmith Barrel-Aged Reserve snifter glass 
From: Whole Foods in Manhattan Beach, Calif. 
Price: $10.99 
Purchased: Nov. 27, 2015
Consumed: Dec. 6, 2015
Misc.: Bottled on Sept. 22, 2015

Poured an almost pitch black color with 1-to-2 fingers of dark khaki tan, rocky head. Average lacing on the sides of the glass. Average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

First smell was crayon, immediately followed by chocolate, vanilla, boozy bourbon, lightly toasted coconut, earthy figs, faint tobacco, caramel, toffee, molasses and burnt plastic. (Smell - 4.25) 

First thought on the taste was holy shit. Just awesome. Probably even better than I thought it would be. Got milk chocolate, sugary molasses, dark sticky caramel, vanilla, toasted coconut, boozy warm bourbon, light woody notes, cocoa powder, light figs, dates, faint tobacco and toffee. (Taste - 4.75)

Full body. Sticky texture. Average carbonation. Long, smooth finish. (Feel - 5.00)

This was just an awesome beer. As good as advertised and I’m glad I finally got to try it. Can’t wait to try some variants. (Overall - 4.75)

4.61 100 A+

I definitely am conflicted rating this beer. I generally don’t care for bourbon barrel aged anything. However, living in Chicago, and having as many liquor stores in my area who offered this to me early, I had to get as many as I could. Some will be sent to friends across the country in exchange for their local wares. I was surprised how much I liked this beer. The aroma is definitely bourbon-barrel aged. The stout appearance is undeniable, including the head. The taste is bourbon-esque, but it is sweet enough to win over beer-heads like me. It goes down smooth enough for me to double-take when I realized that I had two big mouthfuls left. Where did it go?? I’m smiling as I write this... the 14.3% is definitely in effect, but not affecting my judgement. This is good beer. Overpriced? Probably. Delicious? Definitely. May have to reconsider what I ask for in compensation for my friends’ local beers. :)

Having a 2012 vintage. Pours pitch black with virtually no head whatsoever. A heavy smell of chocolate, then comes the toffee, caramel and vanilla. Dig a little deeper and you can unravel the bourbon and oak. Tastes of so much chocolate with caramel and vanilla. The oak is present along with bourbon but it blends so well with the stout. Finishes with a slight alcohol burn & bitterness. Thick Mouthfeel. This is a great beer. With its ABV it begs to be sipped and rightfully so, because it will help you unravel this complex monster.

2015/12/03 - Pours jet black with a thin tan head that immediately vanishes. Aroma is amazing. Notes of coconut, marshmallow, vanilla, coffee roast, chocolate and oak. Taste is oaky-vanilla-bourbon, with sweet marshmallow, coconut, chocolate and coffee notes. Mouthfeel is oily with smooth carbonation and rich, slightly warming finish. Simply amazing. A perfect sipper. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Well, I haven’t rated bcbs in 1300 beers so I guess the time is now. What more needs to be said? 500ml 2015 vintage bottle pours oily dark drown black with small thin dark tan head that is slightly fizzy. Everything about this beer is as close to perfection as you can be, bursting with vanilla, coconut, deep rich chocolate, roast, dark coffee, bourbon character is intergrated masterfully with dark fruity spice, and oaky sweet vanilla marshmallow. Mouthfeel is big, rich, creamy and smooth. Finish lasts for days and is endless pleasure. The barrel-aged stout by which all others are judged. My favorite beer.

Bottled on September 30th, 2015. Pours deep black, tan head that fades quickly, no lacing. Smell has overwhelming bourbon, lots of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits and a surprising banana or banana bread smell as well as oak. Slightly booze heavy but smooth drinking. Dark syrup molasses taste with bitter chocolates as well as coffee, vanilla and lots of ripe fruit, possibly prune, and tons of oak. Very sweet beer but outstanding flavor and amazing balance of bitter, sweet and booze flavored. I strongly recommend this beer to anyone who can get their hands on it.

Purchased at Albertson in Vegas. Bottled on 20OCT15, batch 1918, 2015 edition. Poured an almost pitch black colour with a darker brown head that fizz away rather quickly, but not bad for such a high alcohol content. No lacing is left. Aromas of bourbon with the cherry notes, dark fruits (prunes, raisins), molasses, nuts and hints of smoke. Taste of the rich dark fruits with the roasted malts and light hops. Lots going on everywhere, but everything is so well-blended that this is a beautiful Imperial stout.

Appearance was opanqe with thin tiny creamy mocha head, no lacing. Aromas are bourbon, chocolate, toffee, soft coffee and vanilla, slight heat in nose. Taste are bourbon upfront then chocolate, caramel backing with slight hints vanilla and port-like fruitiness. Finishing with chewy sweetness of malts with bourbon balanced heat. Palate was soft CO2 with full-rich body with oily chewy lovely balanced finish. Overall a stellar stout, opens up with temperature. Iam going to age a few.

This beer absolutely stands up to the hype. Completely black in color, aromas of caramel and vanilla are intense. It is incredibly smooth to drink, rich in flavor, with an almost creamy texture. By far the best bourbon stout I've ever experienced.

Shared 16.9 oz. bottle. 2015 version. 14.3% ABV. Black color with dark tan head, which almost disappears immediately. Bourbon dominates the noise at cooler temps; as it warms, chocolate and coffee are detected as well. Tastes strongly of bourbon at first. But again, as it warms, other flavors begin to come through: oak, roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, subtle vanilla notes, and a hint of smoke. Will try this again after aging (would expect the bourbon flavor to mellow). A slow sipper for sure.

Aroma: straight bourbon with notes of vanilla; Appearance: pitch black with tan head that completely disappears quickly; Taste: strong bourbon with aftertaste of coffee and malt; some smokiness; definitely unlike any beer I’ve tried before; Palate: full body, average carbonation, long and sweet finish; Overall: delicious if you like bourbon; rich, complex, strong; a bit harsh around the edges that will probably mellow with time; would definitely buy again.
Pours like black oil with very little head. Aromas of bourbon, caramel, and coffee with hints of cocoa, nut, and licorice. Smooth and oily on the palate. Excellent.
Had a bottle of 2015 thanks to jerkane. Good chocolate, coffee, and bourbon flavor. A little overhyped IMO.

2015 bottle, bottled 18 September. Pours viscous black, small brown head, no lacing. Aroma is raisins, campfire, bourbon, vanilla. Flavor is much the same. Sweet, boozy, warming, not hot, the alcohol is very well hidden. Can you call a 14% beer drinkable? This one, you can. Complex, exceptionally well balanced. Will have to grab a few more bottles to age, if I can hold out.

AROMA Bourbon, pitch and ethanol followed by chocolate milk, chocolate syrup and baking chocolate.

APPEARANCE Black coffee with dense chocolate milk head. Just a trace of lacing with very brief head retention.

TASTE Chocolate, unbleached cane sugar, maple syrup, and a hint of buttercream. Unexpectedly sweet with bourbon and alcohol burn on the finish.

PALATE Heavy, malty, rich, well carbonated, coats the mouth and hangs on a good long time after a sip.

OVERALL Very well integrated, complex, sweet, dessert-like, thoroughly drinkable. An unmistakably sweet beer, balanced with malt, roasty coffee bitterness, rich creamyness and lingering bourbon heat. Packs a punch, so much going on and so many contrasting elements to enjoy. A renowned beer worthy of the considerable praise heaped upon it. Great stuff, love to try some of the limited variants some day.

Excellent in every way except I don?t understand the difference in ABV. My bottles are saying 13.7 ABV which is a far cry from the listed 15 % I?m still happy with what I have...just puzzled. This is one of my first purchases of a new release and it?s quite exciting in itself.
Bottled. 2015 edition. Has a milky dark color. The taste is a chocolate upfront taste. Has a hint of bourbon. This is a excellent bourbon stout...

Palate: creamy, slick, lively, long, full
Overall: Crazy good. Bright, but smooth and full. Delicious.

I consider this to be the filet mignon of beer. Or at least stouts. Very smooth, especially if aged, chocolatey, Carmel, amazing!!!

Finally getting around to rating this. Snifter at the source in Chicago for a late bday Rare Day tix I got to buy for Adam and myself. I’ve had this a lot. Dark brown with caramel head. Aroma is bourbon and dark chocolate and some vanilla. Taste is not-too-bitter dark chocolate. Bourbon is underlying but present and notable. Not overwhelming. I love this stuff. Cheers to BCS hunting 2015 in a few weeks!
Enjoyed this every time I have had it. Recently after bottling, after 3 months, after 6 months etc. Just wish it wasn't owned by InBev but I'm still not complaining.

2014 vintage. 13.8% ABV. Bottled 29 Aug 2014. Pours blacker with a dark brown hue and minimal/no head. Oily residue layer floating. AROMA: dark rich roasted malt, dark chocolate bitterness, whole roasted coffee beans, bourbon barrel char, vanilla, soy sauce, burned brown sugar, molasses, slight herbs, roasty, caramel, alcohol, earthy, raisin, smoke, peppercorn, toffee, cinnamon, caramel tobacco, dark stone fruit and faint citrus. TASTE: dark rich roasted malt, dark chocolate bitterness, whole roasted coffee beans, bourbon barrel char, vanilla, soy sauce, spices, burned brown sugar, molasses, slight herbs, roasty, caramel, alcohol, earthy, raisin, smoke, peppercorn, toffee, cinnamon, caramel tobacco, dark stone fruit and faint citrus. AFTER TASTE: rich malt, dark bitter chocolate, bourbon and burned brown sugar with a rich thick oily finish.

Tasting pour at the brewery. 2010 vintage on tap. Aroma is of chocolate, bourbon, nutty, booze. Jet black with no head. Thick and viscous. Tasty bourbon barrel, brown sugar, old wood, sweet and mellow bitterness. Truly outstanding.

Served on tap at Whiskey Tango Foxtrot. Dark black color with a brown head. Sweet caramel bourbon in aroma. Heavy body that coats the mouth. Sweet bourbon cherry choc flavor.

Black, small light brownfoam ring. Stark boubon aroma, overwhelming. Great taste, bourbon all over, warmed by alcohol. Think I have to drink this very slowly. (Chicago 201510)

Black body with no actual head. Aroma is intense bourbon, chocolate, licorice, vanilla, caramel. Taste is very sweet, with bourbon, vanilla and chocolate on front, followed by caramel, licorice, dark fruits. Full body with low to no carbonation. Excellent!!!
Mooie bijna zwarte kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, vanille, alcohol, crème, koffie. Smaakt vol, crème, vanille, alcohol.
Zwart, maar geen schuim helaas. Ruikt heerlijk naar Bourbon. Smaakt ook super! Bourbon, zoetje, zwaar, vol. Toppertje

I get huge notes of coffee at the end. Toffee up front followed by molasses and after coffee chocolate and more molasses. This is exceptional. Would highly recommend and age.

Bottle in Amsterdam. Dark brown body with slight, tan head. Nose is chocolate, vanilla, alcy, coffee. Taste is whiskey, and bourbon and chocolate. Super nice. Bitter and delectable in the finish.
Flaska från 2011 på Monks Café, Stockholm. Mycket god doft av bourbon, vanilj, choklad. Smak av detsamma med en värmande alkohol och sötma. Väldigt smakrik, runda, integrerade smaker. Mycket god!

Draft 0.15l at The Beer Temple Amsterdam Netherlands.Try as Bourbon County 2015 with Potjebier and Zlotta.Pour it dark color with medium white head.Aroma of bourbon,pinch of molasis.Taste sweet sticky bourbon,roasted coffee,dark chocolate,some vanilla.Not good as the last time that I tried but still I think it should be aged for a few years. 8 4 8 4 17 4.1

It is fruity as barley, smoked like a campfire, smells of wood. Coffee that is freshly milled and vinous warming alcohol with clear touch of American bourbon. It fills the mouth with a creamy and thick feeling to follow. Clear notes of smoke, strong vinous character with grapes and raisins, light delicate coffee notes as meet with dark bitter chocolate of the highest quality. It all seems almost too composed and well-founded, but in the aftertaste will find its ferocity in the form of untamed American bourbon that leaves alcohol warming effect down through the throat. The 13% alcohol is well hidden in the aforementioned tasting notes, and the overall impression is a soft, round, tasteful and warm stout as I can safely recommend to anyone. It tastes just too good.

BCBS 2012 on tap at Binny’s Lincoln Park tasting room. Flavor is rich and bourbonny, but with a clean finish. Very nice compex brew. I know I’m late to the party here but this beer is one of the few really hyped beers that I feel actually met its expectations.

2014, bottle. Pitch black, small brown head around the edges. Aroma is a massive amount of vanilla, hint of black chocolate, some oak. Fantastic aroma. Big and creamy mouthfeel, somewhat sticky, sweet, again some vanilla, nice lingering bourbon but not too much. Outstanding and worth the wait.

On tap at Binnys tasting room for this review... But have had countless bottles previously. 

Pour is dark and bold. The nose is... Sweet sweet fudge. I let it sit for a few before sipping. Notes of bourbon and chocolate dominate this behemoth. This is my goto barrel aged stout.
Still one of my faves. Little hot the last few years, but still a remarkable stout.
2012 - This is definitely tasting great now, no wonder why so many FIBs are trying to trade for it. Probably only another year or two before it peaks.

At the 8th tasting (round 2), held in Vranovo and Pozarevac. 2014 bottle courtesy of luttonm from Seattle-USA. Thank you, ciao. Pours a deep dark brown color, small ivory foam...really minimal. Nose: Ouh yeah! A blast of the roundest notes ever of vanilla, Bourbon, bouquet of roasted notes of coffee, fresh, just perfect. Stunning attack of wood and whiskey, close to perfection. Mouth: it feels like chewing some very tasty pralines, vanilla, chocolate, dry bitter end.

2017 vs. 2015 side by side. 2017 has chocolate, toffee and subtle bourbon on the aroma. Sweet milk chocolate, caramel and bourbon integrated very well on the taste. Really smooth and elegant. Rating: 4.5/5
2015 leans more towards dried fruits with a touch of smoked notes. Taste has some slightly smoked prunes and figs, dark chocolate and roasted malt on the finish. Some whiskey and booze as well. It has a similar taste profile as a dark barleywine. Rating: 4.4/5

Review of the 2014 vintage. You can tell from the pour that this is a very viscous beer. Just a small dark colored head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is big on bourbon without having any offensive alcohol burn. Taste is awesome: chocolate, caramel, toffee, vanilla and the specific coconut from the bourbon barrels. Long caramely aftertaste. Dense and silky body with very well hidden alcohol. I enjoyed it more than the 2013 vintage. This might be a "Top 10" beer for me. Rating: 4.7/5

Originally reviewed on 9/27/2011. 12 oz. bottle poured into a goblet. Pitch black with some transparency at the edges. No head, a slight wisp of lace, otherwise lifeless. Bourbon aroma like no other. A lot of booze, too. Bourbon taste up front, with a strong chocolate malt midrange flavor. Really exceptional taste. Not really complex, I suppose, but the stout flavor is there and the bourbon complements it really well. It finishes chocolatey and boozy as hell. Tastes every bit of 13% and possibly more. Tingly in the mouth, so much so that it’s tough to tell the carbonation levels. Definitely a sipper. This is one of those beers where the taste is so good that it outweighs the flaws of the rest of the beer. It’s boozy and it looks the lower side of mediocre, but it tastes amazing.
What I consider to be the golden standard of bourbon stouts. My precious. My love.
Tastes a lot like chocolate and nice a nice crisp feeling to it. Very good. A little better than KBS

12 oz bottle - pours black as night with a slight head that is a desert tan color. The aroma is huge and intense - full of dark chocolate, espresso, black licorice, a hint of bourbon and burnt bread. A mouthful is thick and viscous. Flavor is intense with anise, bitter chocolate, aged bourbon, coffee, prune juice and a hint of boozy heat. Truly a treat.
