Excellent bourbon stout. My only complaint is that it is almost just a little too boozy. It very much is like drinking a glass of bourbon. Can’t wait to try on a cold winter’s night
Heavy bourbon and vanilla smell. Taste is a very boozy stout with bourbon, vanilla, and light chocolate. Thick but too boozy for my tastes.

12 oz bottle, one of four from a $20 4 pack, hope it’s worth the hype and $$ price tag.
 Black, with ruby edges, nice thick tan head that recedes like a nitro stout head.
 Big boozy bourbon aroma hits you first, but as it settles down, you get molasses, vanilla, oak, liquorice. Flavor is equally complex. Smooth, sweet, chocolaty entry, leads to molasses, vanilla, oak, tobacco, liquorice, bourbon, caramel, smoke. High ABV is well hidden, but it starts to lean a little too much to the sweet side before the glass is finished. But yeah, I’d buy it again. Note to Greg Hall.There are several cigars that would stand up to and pair well with this beer. If you are going with cigars legal in the U.S,  Padron Anniversario, Rocky Patel, Alec Bradley Black Market, Montecristo White label, Camacho, Fuente Sungrown, Ashton VSG. As far as the not legal in the U.S for now Cuban cigars, try Partagas serie D no 3, Bolivar Royal Corona. anything Montecristo.

Aroma is chocolate, bourbon, and roasted malts, taste is amazing, huge bourbon, vanilla , oak and coffee, taste really hides the abv well! Not sure it gets much better

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

As much as I hate to say it about hyped-up beers, this one really deserves the hype! Nose is wonderfully oaky, and richly malty without showing much roast or coffee. There is a cordial cherry in dark chocolate aroma that comes through strong in the flavor. Unlike most stouts of this caliber, there isn’t a significant roastiness.

This really is a dessert beer. Some sherry-like oxidation is present that compliments it beautifully. Even after only a year in the bottle, it is really smooth and the flavors have blended almost perfectly, masking the 14% ABV.

As big as the flavors are, the mouthfeel is nice and not sticky. A lingering aftertaste is expected for a 14%, but it ends without coating your mouth, inviting sip after sip.

Aroma is bourbon, black licorice, and oak cask. Taste is milk chocolate, then black licorice with bourbon burn, and some smoke. 
2015-  aromas of bourbon oak, toasted coconut, dark chocolate, and leather. Taste is dark chocolate, whiskey, nice oak flavor and warming in the chest.

Schwarz, kein Schaum. In der Nase extrem komplex: Bourbon, Vanille, minimal alkoholisch, Whiskey, Eiche, Kakao. Am Gaumen süßlich-cremig, Eiche, dunkle Früchte, Röstnoten, Schokolade, Bitterschokolade, Whisky, Vanille, dunkler Zucker. Sehr cremig, sehr gut trinkbar, legt sich im Mundraum aus. Unfassbar lecker.

bottle @ home. 2012 vintage. Pours a brown fizzy head that quickly dissipates above a pitch black liquid. Sweet vinous aroma with oak, bourbon, vanilla, licorice, some higher alcohols, dark fruits, raisins, caramel. Big mouth feel and a heavily sweet palate with long duration, almost cloying with flavors of oak, tobacco, dark chocolate cake, raisins, dates, vanilla, licorice, bourbon, ash, honey, caramel. Aftertaste has booze/whiskey, honey and chocolate.

Pours extremely dark and thick. Lots of alcohol aroma-bourbon with some oak wood notes. Taste is well balanced with dark chocolate and coffee notes. Followed by lots of alcohol bourbon taste and a hint of smoke. Quite a complex brew with lots of interesting flavors!

Goose Island Bourbon County Stout has a thin, tan head, a very dark brown, almost black, appearance, and essentially no lacing left on the glass. The aroma is as expected- a strong, overriding, vanilla/oak/Bourbon whiskey smell, with background malt. Taste is of the same, with lots of sugar, some char, dark, slightly-turned dark fruits, like prunes, and balancing bitterness. Mouthfeel is heavy and velvety, and Goose Island Bourbon County Stout finishes rich and boozy. RJT

On tap at Brick Alley Pub in Newport. Served in a snifter. Deep brownish black color. No head. Very sweet on the nose and at first on the tongue. Flavor builds slowly. Notes of dark chocolate and coffee, with hints of vanilla. Good balance, very smooth. Tell me again why this isn’t a craft brew?
Fast schwarze Farbe, geringe bräunliche schaumkrone. Geruch sehr Schokoladig, Vanille, toffee. Geschmack süß, Vanille, leicht holzig, cremig, lecker,.

Time for one of the great classics of American craft beer culture, the original barrel-aged imperial stout, to which many more recent examples are indebted. This one was actually made to a recipe of which the brewer thought it fitted the added bourbon taste best - let this serve as an example to all the breweries nowadays which believe putting a stout in a liquor barrel automatically leads to a world-class masterpiece... Very dark burgundy colour, blackish but revealing its colour around the edges, with the expected thick yellow ’film’ stuck to the glass as it progresses; quite some fizz for this style, visible on the edges.  These tiny bubbles try to sustain a thin, loose, deep beige head, but cannot prevent it from receding quickly and even all but disappear in the end under the heavy alcohol dosage. Truly mouth-watering aroma, very strong and perfumey and reaching my nose instants after opening the bottle: cold black coffee but in a good, very aromatic way here, bitter chocolate, lots of vanilla-like tannins of extreme elegance, wet wood and obviously some bourbon, moist Cuban cigar, milk chocolate, kahlua, old dry sherry, subtle hints of bayleaf, banana liqueur, liquorice, rhum-soaked raisins, roasted meat and cinnamon, varnish and shoe polish as can be expected from such a strong beer but in an aroma this complex, I cannot see any reason to be bothered by this; if anything, it only adds further complexity. I am flabbergastered: it contains all the good things of a barrel-aged stout, looking for flaws is pointless and even insulting to a beer of this stature, and everything is in absolutely perfect balance - nothing pushes itself forward, nothing clashes with anything else. This is among the most wonderful beer aromas I ever had the honour to smell. The taste is equally amazing: a tangy candied sweetness as expected, setting up a line of communication with the finish, but still restrainedly so; a deep basic grain sourishness, a very fine and concentrated sparkle on the tongue from carbonation, a slight umami accent but remaining in the background where it belongs, a massive body but still elegant and lean in spite of the far-above-average ABV... Deep bitter chocolate malts, absolutely delicious, thick and oily mouthfeel and just the right dosis of coffee-like roasted bitterness in the end, blending in perfectly with the rest instead of manifesting itself too much. All the way in the finish, it becomes even more complex, as a noble ’woodiness’ sets in, drying tannins, a lovely peppery hop bitter accent which balances out the sweetness to the point of perfection, and a warming glow of liqueurish and very clearly bourbon-like alcohol accompanying the liquid down the throat without ever becoming burning or astringent, though its presence is hard to ignore. I had rarer examples of American barrel-aged stouts than this, with all their respective hypes surrounding them, but no matter how great they are, there is always one little detail which prevents them from being completely perfect: just a tad too much of the bourbon or alcohol, just a tad too cloying, just lacking a tad of roasted bitterness... But this one, the grandfather of them all, manages to avoid all that.  This is a truly divine brew - if there is a heaven, and I think there is not so I’m drinking these beers here, I’m sure this will be served there... I am infinitely glad I got the chance to taste this work of art. A great example, not just for its style, not just for beer in general, but for gastronomy in general. Kudos to Goose Island - the fact that it has been taken over by AB InBev worries me a bit, but apparently this 2014 vintage is as good as it could have been, so I assume the InBev bankers are not interfering with production here. Completely amazing and even better than I expected.  Update: I have also tasted last year’s batch in the meantime and it showed this souring infection that has caught so much attention - clearly not a flattering feature, but far less dramatic than I expected.  I nevertheless have to take this second tasting into consideration and therefore painfully have to downgrade my score a bit.

Poured from growler. Pitch black tar-like pour with no head. Vanilla, American oak, cream, coffee, dark fruits. Need a spoon to drink. Wow. Smooth and silky but with depth and complexity. Hides the alcohol well with the big body until the liquid burns your stomach.
This is about as good as a barrel aged stout can get. Holy crap is it good.

Bottle (2012)@ DØE. Appearance: Pours clear deep brown/black with good soapy beige head and lacing. aroma/taste notes: caramel, chocolate oak, brown sugar, vanilla, bourbon and some smoke notes. palette: powerful aroma, low to medium carbonation, full body, notable caramel sweetness, average bitterness, long duration and an oily texture. Overall: Very tasteful and powerful bourbon stout.

Bottle, 2011. Pours black-brown with a small head, leaving fine residues on the glass. Licorice, caramel and roasted, almost smoky, tones in the nose. The taste is all bitter almonds, dried fruits, oak and vanilla. Fantastic. Oily, smooth and just a little bit of carbonation left. Not the best Bourbon County I’ve had. Still very good.

Flaska på begravningsbyrå Stockholm
Svart kulör med ljusbrunt skum. Fantastiskt fin doft av vanilj fat och choklad. Söt smak med knäck, choklad, vanilj och torkad frukt.

Draft pitch dark black with almost no head. The aroma is amazing, vanilla chocolate very mellow. You can really taste the bourbon. Incredible how a 14.2% passes like silk through my throat. 2014 edition

I am. It a stout guy but I can respect what this beer is all about. Ypi can really taste the bourbon barrel and would be good for a nice cold noght

Version 2013, bue en 2014. Tout est là. Chocolat, café, bourbon haut de gamme, grande complexité, rondeur excellente, effervescence parfaite. chaque gorgée est mémorable.
This is pretty good although I prefer other bourbon county offerings. Coffee and barleywine are better

BIF project. Pours pitch black, no head, no lacing. Aroma is divine... bourbon, vanilla, roasted cacao nibs, dark chocolate, mild coconut, intense roasted coffee. Flavor is immediate bourbon but gives way to an amazing complex flavor bomb... Coffee, chocolate, vanilla, back to chocolate then some coconut then back to bitter chocolate with some good bitterness sneaking through right at the end with the alcohol warning. Fantastic.

Tasted a 2014 bottle on 4-12-2015. 
Wow, it has a huge bourbon barrel flavor! Tons of vanilla, dried coconut and dried fruits with a super silky mouthfeel. 
It's easily a top 10 bourbon in my opinion. It deserves to be alongside other great stouts such as the Firestone 18th, KBS, and Old Rasputin Barrel Aged.

Pretty amazing. Pours thick black with dark brown gead. Smells of soy sauce, vanilla, cola, chocolate. Tons of bourbon flavors. Coconut, vanilla, leather. Only aged 7 months, so this has tons of booziness. It is so warm in my chest. Mouth feel is almost sickly sweet, but sip this one and you’ll be fine. Really complex stuff

Fantastic Brew! Pours black thick with beige thin head, creamy. Wonderful port wine aroma, black currants and wild cherries. Velvety on mouth, with vanilla bourbon kick. Marvelous!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The perfect bourbon barrel stout. Smells of bourbon, sweet oaky vanilla, black licorice, cocoa, and some caramel. Very thick on the palate, the bourbon is the main focus but you also get some coffee, honey and vanilla. A bit more whiskey heat on the back end and leaves a chocolate taste on the tongue. Overall it’s an awesome beer, the king of bourbon barrel stouts. One of the must try beers for any beer lover
Pours straight black no head or carb. Nice blend of coffee and dark molasses. Overall great coffee stout.

Wow!! Huge beer, crazy. 2014 bottle from farmhouse.. Pours jet black limited head and no lacing. Nose huge bourbon and sweet syrup. Flavours massive vanilla and bourbon molasses and dark fruit. Taste massive sweet big bitter. Big thick body med carbonation.
2015 is so smooth, not feeling hot at all. Expresso, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. 
2009 at 2015 Xmas gathering, thanks Stephen!! So drinkable. Alcohol is totally hidden. So nice.

2017 bottle nye 2020 fromJohn. Tons of fudge and bourbon. So good!

Must have had 2013 back then. Just updating this app. I recall enjoying it a lot and thinking the bourbon was balanced well. It didn’t over power anything. Update: Had a bottle from 2017, drank in Oct. 2020, bourbon bite without being overpowering, thick palate, 3.8
Another year another win. Best beer of the year. Hints of coffee, chocolate, and good days ahead. Well done!

[2013] 355ml bottle. Pitch black with a thin ring of brown foam. Flavors are roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel, vanilla, smoke, oak and bourbon. Pleasant alcohol warmth, but never too boozy. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

Year old bottle. Pours black with a dark tan rim. Aroma is dense with fruit and malt: sweet fig, date, raisin, some fruity esters, bourbon, caramel, toffee, tobacco, oak, a hint of smoke, chocolate, and vanilla. Taste is sweet, raisin, fig, more dried fruits, alcohol, toffee, toasted marshmallow, chocolate, and a bit of smoke/roast. Syrupy thick, full body, lingering sweetness, boozy afterburn. Rich, delicious, perhaps a bit too hot even after a year. Definitely a "dessert beer".

Flaska från SB, 2012 vintage, 15 abv. riktigt stor och kraftig IS där inte bourbonlagring tillåts ta över eftersom grundölet är så kraftigt. Aningen tjära, men annars mest söta smaker av russin, melass, vanilj, bourbon, choklad och fudge. En hel del värmande alkohol men inte alls spritig. Riktigt gott, men kanske inte lika sensationell som när den kom 2002.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av choklad, vanilj, farinsocker, mandelmassa, marsipan, russin, karamell, bourbon. Stor sötma, rund, oljig, kraftfull, fruktig med fin beska. Riktigt gott!
This is a sipping beer. Six ounce pour of the 2012 vintage. Very sweet. Alcohol flavor. I taste the vanilla and oak. Outstanding.

the older BCBS are much smoother and sweeter. strong sweet bourbon flavor with a roasted malt backbone. no bite in this bad boy even at 15% alcohol. pours black with no head. smells of chocolate, coffee, and bourbon. one of the best stouts i have ever had.
Earlier Rating: 12/18/2013 Total Score: 4.4
This is actually the baudoinia from goose island. Really strong 15% alcohol and has a sweet finish. Pours black and smells chocolately. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This was an off year. Way too ash and soot tasting. Purchased from two stores. Normally a favorite, not this year.

2014 Bottle at home, obtained in a trade with huskertan. Thanks! Pours opaque black, brown head dissipates quickly into a thin film. Aroma is faint bourbon, a bit of vanilla and licorice. Black coffee and hints of chocolate. Honestly a bit underwhelmed by the aroma. Taste is milk chocolate and coffee, transitions to mellow bourbon, licorice and a bit of fruit. Semi sweet with a bitter finish. As this warms the bourbon mellows a bit more and more of the barrel complexities come out, oak and vanilla. Palate is thick but silky smooth, a bit of alcohol detectable on the palate. Medium carbonation. This is a fantastic beer, and one of the best barrel aged beers I’ve had. There is quite a bit of hype, and there are definitely better imperial stouts out there but this is one I would drink time and time again. Got another 2014 in the cellar, excited to see how it develops over the next few years!

355 ml bottle, 2012 Vintage, 15 abv. Poured in to a Snifter. Pitch black with a thin, tanned head around the edge of the glass. Roasted aroma with dark malts, caramel, vanilla, bourbon barrel, ripe fruits and liqourice. Taste is sweet and roasted. Full body with an oily texture and a near flat carbonation. Long lasting dry and roasted finish with rich, dark malts and soft vanilla notes, chocolate. No sign of the 15 alcohol. Excellent Stout, really well balanced and a lovely barrel ageing.

-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tasted from draft at Hunahpu day. Pours black with dark brown head. Aroma is bourbon, coffee and chocolate. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, caramel. Full bodied thick beer with a moderate sweetness and mild bitterness. Had it along with several other bourbon barrel aged and its up there with the best. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

30.5.2014. 2012 version. Black, thick, no head. Sweet bourbon aroma with vanilla, oak. Flavour has plenty of roasted malts, coffee, some cigar(?), going towards bourbon, vanilla, oak. Also as can be expected with this abv, alcohol is present and warms a lot. Heavy and delicious stuff, deserves time.

Botte pour at Tørst. Pours like oil. Black and smooth with no head. Strong flavor. Palate is a bit watery. Pretty intense.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from 2014 Batch of 13.8% alcohol. Appearance is black, thick, oily. Smell is of bourbon, roast, chocolate, but mostly bourbon. Taste is a blast of bourbon alcohol that transitions into a delicious chocolate, roasted stout. This bottle tasted less boozy than the previous times I’ve had it on tap this year. I don’t know if it’s this particular batch that tastes smoother than the other which was 14.4% ABV but it sure seemed so. If you’re not a huge fan of bourbon barrel beers steer clear because this brings the barrel front and center. Delicious!

BOD 8/29/14. Pours dark as a starless night. Almost no head, but being barrel aged, this is acceptable.

Tremendous nose led off by bourbon. Underneath are dark chocolate, vanilla, caramel and hints of dark fruit (plum) and oak.

Heavy full bodied with a texture that goes beyond creamy to the point of being thick. Above normal carbonation with effervescence from the middle on. Palate perfection.

The flavor profile is World Class. This is quite intense in terms of bourbon and alcohol and results in the complexity being slightly muted by these intensities. Balance is reasonable, all things considered, as the other flavors pop in the middle. It begins with bourbon over a rich caramel and chocolate sweetness. As the bourbon fades, alcohol comes to the forefront. In the middle, the alcohol flavor masking effect fades and the complexity of this stout becomes discernible. Waves of vanilla, sweet chocolate and slight plum cascade over an oak background. The finish is a slow fade of sweet caramel and vanilla over a receding oak. The finish leaves that burn at the back of throat, an astringent alcohol pucker and a touch of sweet caramel and chocolate.

Couleur d’un noir profond avec un col brun mince mais résistant. Arome très complexe de café, chocolat noir, vanille, alcool, bois, pain grillé. A boire lentement. Une explosion de saveur, une très bonne imperial stout!

Bottle from aleigator. Black body, with almost brown short lastest head. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, wood and bourbon and bit smoke. Very good, but strong stout stout, takes a while to consume :)
Great , rich beer. Coffee, fruits, vanilla, chocolate ... Perfect combination. Smooth , warming finish.
Bourbon aged barrels give this stout a unique twist. Better served at room temp vs chilled. Definitely good with a cigar. Very strong and sip slow. Highly enjoyable session!

This beer made me sleep like a baby I even forgot to rate it while drinking it last night. The aroma was just fantastic. Definitely charred oak and vanilla came to mind as I sipped down this thick full bodied monster. I loved it more as I drank the glass half full. Carmel and light notes of chocolate splashed my tongue along with the bourbon smoke to it. Very interesting IMO beings I haven’t had this beer in any version before. Just loved it! Cheers
Probably good thing bud took over as this is more readily available. Great coffe notes great roast aroma great mouth great super big imperial stout flavors of coco roast and heat excelltn.
2013 tap at the Tap House, IL. Black with light brown ring. Smokey, vanilla, woody bourbon, alcohol and caramel. Tastes dry with a smokey aftertaste. Body is heavy with a sticky feel.

On tap @ Amsterdam café, San Francisco - CA. Color: dark opaque black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: coffee domination with vanilla balance. Caramel notes and roasted malt. Alcohol finish. Taste: nice oily sensation, full body. Really smoothy. Aftertaste: vanilla notes and roasted malt. Alcohol finish with coffee.

2012 bottling. 
Goose Island Bourbon County Stout
Goose Island Bourbon County Stout
I am not sure if I can add anything to the overly numerous reviews. This is a splendid, solid stout. Incredibly high ABV -- yet not boozy at all. Recommended, highly.

On tap. Black pour with small dark beige head. Aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, oak, chocolate, faint coffee, touch of smoke and faint bourbon. Taste of roasted malts, caramel, sweetened chocolate, hint of smoke, touch of coconut, and a nice bourbon finish in the far background. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, perfectly balanced, absolutely delicious!!

2/7 (Home) - 2014 Bottle. Have been a big fan of this beer since the first time I’ve had it. Whiskey is my non beer alcohol of choice. Distinct whiskey and carmel smell and taste is what I love about this beer. The beer is very strong, and pleasant to drink, The texture is smooth, and the blend of flavors works very well. Excellent beer and I look forward to continued drinking of the stout, and their other offerings (have a BC coffee on tap)!

Tasted on tap at Grape & Grain (SFBW). Pours black with toffee head. Nose is caramel, vanilla, molasses, smoke, and sweet malt. Flavour is well balanced sweet dark malts with hints of figs, raisins, molasses, vanilla, oak, and bourbonesque flavours. Medium to full body. Awesome Stout!
Pours dark black with a thin cocoa head. You can really really smell the bourbon in the aroma with just a touch of smoke. An intense oaky taste with a smokey middle and strong bourbon finish.

12 bottles dated 10/22/15. Sour aroma, sour flavors, hard to drink. Chicago Tribune article suggested blending them with something similar. I tried Dragons Milk from New Holland. As expected, it improved the BCBS, but it screwed up the Dragons Milk.
This is my favorite beer! I really enjoyed it before string cheese in Chicago this past Sat night..

2014 bottle. Aroma of raisins, chocolate, some toasty oak vanilla, maple syrup, a hint of a citrusy hop, and alcohol. Opaque coffee brown, watery, no head or lace. Tastes of grassy european hop up front followed by roasty malt and a slightly charred campfire marshmellow, and chocolate - a very mellow vanilla tip toes in the background the entire time; slightly more bitter than sweet with a strong alcohol presence. Palate is watery and fizzy with a large gulp, but feels oily in small sips. Overall, good in small doses, i would prefer to drink this like a spirit, in sips.
Bottle. 2014. Super raisin nose. Headless dark brown pour. Thick body. Tastes of raisin, plum, dark fruits in general. Sugar sweet. High alcohol flavor without being super boozey tasting.
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомендую его всем. пожалуйста, обратитесь его. очень хорошо!
13.8% abv. Heavy, slightly overly sweet, malty. Good beer but very heavy. Wouldn’t go out of my way to buy again

A monster stout w/ monster flavors! Sad it is seasonal, but glad to have it!

2012 vintage, 35.5cl bottle @ home. Pours black and oily with a tiny dark brown head that very quickly fades. Aroma is clearly bourbon, prunes and wood. Taste is sweet but not overly sweet, slighty bitter and a little roasted. Body is full, texture is thick, carbonation is soft to medium. The finish is big and long, bourbon, coffee, brown sugar and roasted malt dominating.

** Bouteille 2013 **
Une faible mousse brune se sauve rapidement d’un liquide noir comme la plus sombre des nuits. Un bouquet réconfortant de carrés aux dattes, de biscuits graham et de chocolat m’a replongé dans un doux souvenir de desserts concoctés avec amour par ma grand-mère. La faible carbonatation permet d’apprécier les saveurs sucrées de la bière dans toute leur splendeur. Du chocolat onctueux et des fruits confits sont emportés par une vague de chaleur alcoolisée gracieuseté du bourbon. Une pointe de bois se pointe à la fin. Un véritable dessert liquide qui se laisse apprivoiser lentement, mais sûrement.

Draught. Inky black with small creamy chocolate colored head, caramel-mocha aroma with undertones of whisky, robust body, low carbonation, sweet mocha - bourbon taste, longish finish with bourbon aftertaste. Such a great experience, like drinking a chocolate pudding!

13.8% ABV 2014 edition.
Bottled 09.29.14.
Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip on 12.11.14.

A: Very strong bourbon. That’s it.

A: Small tan ring for a head. Midnight black body with no red in the glass.

T: It’s bourbon syrup. Bourbon dominates. Dark fruit, coconut, marshmallow, chocolate, a barely there bit of oak, nuts, and a weird artificial slightly bitter sting on the back end, are all subtle.

P: Silky smooth. This is the most syrupy beer ever, by far. There are some bubbles in the middle and on the back end, but not many. 

O: The bourbon was nice, but it was unbalanced. It was icky sweet like eating chocolate frosting with a spoon from the container. (Of course, err...I’ve never done that). The mouthfeel is way too syrupy. It feels almost flat. The alcohol heat is not bad for it being 13.8%. Another thing that bothered me was what tasted like an artificial edge that I’ve found in other AB-InBev beers. I hope, like a lot of people, that they aren’t messing with the recipe. Overall, the hype didn’t live up to the actual drink as I think that there are better BBA stouts. It was good, just not world class.

Randonly on tap! Aroma is lighter. Really nothing. Looks fine. Black. Taste is amazing. Hate to admit but better than kbs. Vanilla. Boozy. Stout. Whiskey. Good balance. Palate is surprisingly medium. Overall the taste is amazing but everything else is ok. Not a bad beer. 

Take it back. Not as good as kbs... Too boozy. Still good tho

Pours a jet black color. This has next to no lacing or head retention, due to the near 14% ABV. Tastes of vanilla, chocolate and bourbon. A fantastic drink and one that is apparently hard to find. Quite a treat!

2013 on Draft: Intense aromas of bourbon, chocolate and black fruits. Incredibly smooth on the palate, with initially sweet black fruit flavors of plum, fig and licorice, giving way to a blast of dark chocolate, bitter black coffee, bourbon, vanilla bean and molasses. Layers for days. Finish lingers long with hoppy spice and dark coffee, picking up the intensity as it opens. Bourbon barrel flavor is there too in the end but it is understated and in balance with the other elements, with the high abv covered well.
Great color. Rich chocolaty head. Bursting with fruity alcohol aroma. Damn, what a kick of alcohol in the taste.

Bottle, 2014 - not much head, pitch black color, definite bourbon and roast malt aroma and flavor, fair amount of woody vanilla flavor too, maybe a very very mild whiff of alcohol at the very end but not nearly as much as you would expect from a 14+%, pretty smooth finish, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I am drinking the 2013 right now, and let me say....WOW! The complex flavors of an imperial stout blends well with the bourbon barrel. This is truly a treat.

Bottle on 1/9/15. Pours black in color with less than a finger of head. Good lacing. The aroma is roasted malt, bourbon, caramel, and chocolate, and vanilla. Good mouth feel. The taste is roasted malt and bourbon with some chocolate, vanilla, and caramel. Very nice bourbon barrel stout.

Sampled from a bottle purchased in Chicago. This is an exceptional strong, sweet stout. The bourbon influence come through very powerfully, the charred flavours giving a rich espresso coffee and dark chocolate complexity. In addition there are sweet flavours - caramel, vanilla, coconut and dark fruits. There is also a pleasing amount of bitterness and much warmth from the high alcohol content. The whole comes together exceptionally well, to create a rich, complex and unique beer. One of the best that I have sampled.

27th June 2021 Sampling the 2014 edition once again. Even better with bottle age!

Pours like syrup a dark, opaque brown with no head......aroma is coffee grounds, booze......taste is -whoa- raisins, dates, dark chocolate with a thick mouthfeel and booze permeating through it all. One is definitely the limit on this beast.

On tap at The Daily Pint. Deep dark black, with a small head little lace. Strong bourbon aroma up front, with support from rich caramel malt, vanilla, oak and a hint of smoke. Taste is similar, with big bourbon flavors bursting through a base of caramel sweetness with hints of vanilla, oak and dark fruits. Full body, minimal carbonation, silky mouthfeel and a slightly boozy finish. Definitely a big boy beer, but very drinkable.
bottle. thick pour, almost no head, smells of soy sauce and coffee. overall very good although getting a little too pricey to justify the cost.
Very bold and flavorful brew. One of the best bourbon aged brews around. I only wished it wasn’t this heavy on alcohol, which would have made it a lot more drinkable. Great flavor and aroma, though.

As a bourbon and a stout lover this is a great beer! Great aromas of bourbon and sweet stout and intense flavors! Sweetish and almost port-like as it warms up. One is enough due to the high ABV, I didn’t realize this until I was on #3!
Great bourbon nose. No lacing. Pours black. A little carbonated. Would be amazing after it sits for awhile. Can't wait to try it next year!
2014- huge chocolate Toffee and of course bourbon by the best i have had from them since 2009 drinks silky smooth with a slight boozy finish burn love it
bottle 2012...veryvery (portish) sweet, loads of bourbon, dark fruit, bit of bitter chocolate, wood, alcoholic, bit of vanilla and low on hops. Flavourbomb but not a lot of flavours.

Bottle--I get it, it’s high quality and a good beer, but I’m not much if a bourbon fan. Like all the bourbon beer, it’s hard to drink until it warms up an then it smooths out and becomes a fine sipping beer. Total wine 26/ 4 pack.

A sledgehammer of a beer, it tastes, and should be drunk , like a spirit. The vanilla is there, but not as pronounced as some "industrially aged" beers that are on the market. A beer for nye, sipping slowly.
’12 BCBS at Whirlyball. Thanks Reed for putting this on in Austin’s honor. He deserved nothing less. Yum. Bourbon then choc-caramel, then fruit. A touch rough. 16.4

2012 bottle. Pours oily and black, no head but thick lacing. Aroma has prunes, bourbon and brown sugar. Flavour is similar, thick and satisfying. Bourbon is clearly present but perfectly controlled by both bitterness and sweetness. Fine, light carb, alcohol burn and lasting bittersweet and sticky finish. Yummy.

Aroma of figs and whiskey. Strong malt at the beginning. Figs and cinnamon. Chocolate and burnt wood aftertaste. Sweet boozy finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Had it on tap at Eli Cannon’s, Middletown.

I’m convinced someone must have dropped a shot of bourbon into my snifter before tasting.

Of course eventually the rest of the qualities will seep out in the forms of chocolate, vanilla, plum, raisin -- but always smacked to submission by the bourbon. 

Pair it with lots of meat. Pretend it’s a matter of survival. Be a man.

The perfect Stout. Smooth from start to finish. Not too boozy. A sip'r to enjoy slowly, if you are lucky enough to find one anywhere. Quite possibly the best imperial stout you could possibly have the privilege of tasting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I’m fortunate to have found this elusive brew at my local beer store. Real high expectations so the anticipation was evident. Poured aggressively but no head and only a slight few bubbles of carbonation made it to the surface. Black as night and thick like molasses. The aroma had subtle hints of vanilla, licorice, phenol, wood, and of course bourbon. Taste was sweet, big and bold like the smell with maybe even raisins mixed about. Thick, creamy, and coated the palate beautifully. I must say I had my doubts since I’ve been let down before; but BCBS did not disappoint! I loved the experience and since it’s a rather big beer it is a delightful sipping stout. Goose Island hit this aged brew right out of the park, awesome!

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured black, small brown head. Lots of bourbon on the nose combined with roasted malts wood and some caramel. Taste of bourbon (again), a bit of coffee and some malts. Awesome beer, extremely enjoyable.

From a bottle shared by jheath99. Pours very dark brown with a fizzy light brown head. Tastes like booze, strong raisin, very roasted malt, earthy, woody, tobacco, and light ash. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like sweet roasted malt, booze, tobacco, woody, earthy, and lots of raisin.
2014 bottle. Rich black pour. Lots of vanilla, oak, and alcohol on the nose. Quite hot, burns on the way down. Great balance at something so large. It’s well worth the hype surrounding it.

It’s terribly hard to argue this is not a perfect beer... Because in a few years in a cellar it would be in 3-5 years. Let it warm and enjoy this sweet bourbon stout. This beer is as dark as oil, smelly, tasty, sweet.

Christmas day beer 2015, let’s go. Deep black pour with a thin, tan head that hangs around. Burnt malts and bourbon assault the nose. This is damn well crafted beer. Alcohol is completely hidden and it’s smooth all the way down. Flavor has a ton of roasted malt notes and some cocoa, as well as the woodiness of the bourbon barrels coming through. Definitely something to try at least once.
355ml bottle from 2012. Color is black as night with almost no head. Aroma is bourbon bourbon bourbon... Taste is dark chocolate, roasted, boozy, cherries.

Bottled August 2013. 355ml, shared with friends in snifters. Very boozy, filled the room when opening. Pitch black, very little carbonation. 

Toffee malts, brown sugar and big bourbon flavour and burn. slightly out of balance. Would benefit from some time in the dark. Great introduction.

As advertised. Pitch black, little tan head that faded fast. So many aromas and flavors. Very surprised at the smoothness for ABV. Want to try the coffee.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at blend. 5 oz sampler w 2013, 2014, and barleywine. 

2013 is very bold, with boubon. 2014 is less in your face, but a little less flavor. Depending on your mood, either would be better. 2014 would usually be my choice but i recognize the greatness of the 2013. 

Aroma bourbon, toasted malt. 
Taste brown sugar, coffee, bourbon of course.

Good beers.

’14 version, many thanks to Tom!

Pours a thick, syrupy, completely black color, with a small, soon disappearing dark brown head, leaving a very thin lacing at the edge of the glass.

Has an intriguing nose of earthy, scorched malts with hints of molasses to it, along with milk chocolate, vanilla notes and a gentle barrel infusion, providing a convincing amount of wood and slightly hot Bourbon, blending outstandingly well into the sweeter notes of the beer, building up a fantastic, complexity. A generous amount of toffee and cocoa nibs complete the inviting aromas of this beer.

Tastes of earthy, wooden, toasted malts, mingled together with an unbelievable chocolate creaminess, giving this beer its incredible smooth mouthfeel. Even though this is a sipper, it drinks fairly easy, as the alcohol isn’t hidden, but a fundamentaly, well integrated aspect. The Bourbon builds up on the palate above the malt and chocolate foundation, inviting sweeter flavors of molasses, toffee and nougat to the taste, which not only provide a well fitting depth, but also are responsible for wrapping up any alcoholic burn in a very pleasant way, providing a rich, complex, slightly burning Bourbon character with oaken qualities to it. These then again blend well into the malts, leading to a sweeter finish, with a subtle coffee bitterness in the end, calmed by lots of bakers chocolate, exiting with a short, sharp bourbon bite.
Pours black with almost no dark tan head. Aroma is all bourbon. This is not my type of beer. Doesn’t really taste like beer, more like liqueur. Taste is sweet bourbon and that’s about it.

Great nose....perfect body for a stout. The taste is a little boozy, but after aging it for a year it becomes absolutely amazing. Keeping yourself from drinking it and allowing this one to age is not the easiest thing to do.
Not much on aroma, but full on taste. Black in color, pours thick. Very sweet taste, though not a malty sweet. Tastes of chocolate, vanilla, and raisin. Sweet chocolatey finish.

2014 12oz bottle. Pours dark black with minimal ring around the top. Strong caramel and toffee notes with some bourbon. Taste the same with slight booze. Nice balanced sweetness. Really amazing stuff!

12 oz. Bottle of 2014 from a 4 pack. Pours a midnight color with a slight opaque tan rim with a frothy dark tan head. It’s all bourbon on the nose with a hint of caramel. The complexity of malts, toasted caramel, bourbon booze, vanilla bean, and roasty earth flavors go in and out. The palate is smooth and full bodied.

2012 bottle pour into a snifter the darkest brownest of black with almost not head.
Aroma is like boozy molasses.
Taste reminds me of dark Karo syrup. Like thick distinctive molasses. Age makes this even distinct. Love the bland of vanilla dark fruits as well.
Truly an outstanding imperial stout. Every. Year.

Aromas: heavy bourbon, vanilla, dried currents, bread, roasted aromas, alcohol, wood.

Appearance: dark brown, almost black, no head.

Taste: lots of alcohol sweetness, bitterness under the alcohol.

Palate: heavy body, a bit oily, creamy. Fairly carbonated mouthfeel despite the lack of a head. 

Finish: lots of alcohol, some carbonation, coffee, lots of bourbon, a little burning like they added pure bourbon to the beer.

Overall this a complex interesting beer. It’s the first bourbon barrel stout I’ve had that has a burning sensation in your mouth like it has pure bourbon added to it. Still it’s a bit over the top too, almost like a mixed drink rather than a beer.

Bottle (12oz $7): Vintage 2014. Black with small head that disappears. Aroma is mostly bourbon. Taste is bourbon with bitter sweet chocolate. Nice sipper that I will pick up when available.
Update 2/3/2015 vintage 2014 (was 4 now 4.2)

Kind of too strong on the bourbon side. These seasonal blends are tough to do right, and they leaned a bit left with the liquor taste. Definitely meant to be sipped. Still tasty, but can’t touch Backwood’s Bastard.

2014. Appearance is jet black with no apparent head. Aroma is an intense bourbon, oak, vanilla, chocolate, cherry, roasted malt, and molasses. Taste is amazingly complex. Starts with rich malt and dark fruit, giving way to layers of fruit, chocolate, molasses, toasted oak, and roasted malt. Mouthfeel is a rich creamy viscosity, hint of alcohol warmth, with little carbonation. Finishes with a malty finish and lingering flavors of oak, vanilla, and chocolate

Pours thick black with a brown head. At first smell I almost could have been convinced I was about to enjoy a glass of bourbon! Also has subtle notes of chocolate that came to the forefront as my nose grew accustomed to the initial alcohol. The mouthfeel is as rich as I expected from the pour. Sweet chocolate and subtle fruit oils, and strong enough to make me reach for some crackers! Overall a fantastic, albeit heavy stout.

Bottle produced in Sept 2014, 13.8% abv. Pours pitch black with thin tan head. Nose is heavy on the bourbon barrel sweetness. Thick mouthfeel. Lots of boubon on the taste, vanilla, warming booze, sweet dark fruit, a bit of lingering chocolate in there. Very sweet, but smooth and balanced. Long finish. Lives up to the hype.

Most recent 2014 november vintage although i’ve had earlier versions. Extremely smoothe and drinkable for a stout. Aroma is heavily oaky, slight bourbon and vanilla, dried fruit/prune. Flavor is deep acidic dried prune and cherry, bourbon, slight vanilla. Very full, smoothe drinking and mouth feel with a velvety finish. Very satisfying stout.

Black color with small beige-brown head. Aroma is bourbon, wood, roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, raisins and alcohol. Taste begins sweet, it becomes bitter and it is almost like the aroma with flavors of bourbon, chocolate and vanilla. Full body with creamy feel, soft carbonation and bitter alcoholic finish.

Pour is pitch black with a tan head that dissipates very quickly. No lacing whatsoever. Aroma is bitter coffee, vanilla, chocolate, bourbon soaked wood, raisin, plumb, sweet alcohol. Very inviting. Taste is mostly the same as the nose, not much coffee on the tongue, however. There’s an almost overwhelming bourbon flavor though. For me, the bourbon is too strong. Velvety mouthfeel. Pretty good, but I’d rather drink PLENTY of other stouts. Gonna let this sit a year or two.

This beer is phenomenal. Definitely one of my favorites. A friend graciously shared it with me and it was worth every sip. Tastes of dark fruit, vanilla, and bourbon. Luxurious mouthfeel, very thick on the palate. A very deep mahogany in color, minimal head.
Best beer ive ever had. Find it if you can. Only compliant could be it is too syrup tasting.

Pours jet black with small tan head and no lacing. Aroma of bourbon, dark chocolate, dark fruit, cherries, and some cider. Taste is the same with soy sauce, slight alcohol burn, with chocolate and bourbon that lingers. Wow this is good.

Too sweet for my palate. Yes black-hole. Yes great nose. But it flattens out during taste and it was 21$ for 4.! Bitter coffee aftertaste. But I do like it. I will not buy it again as there are better options out there. Think Kentucky. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours pitch black. Aroma of slight cofree and heavier on the bourbon side. Taste is amazing. It’s just like the way it taste, coffee with a aftertaste of bourbon.

It pours very dark brown with a brown head. Head retention is good. The initial aromas are bourbon, chocolate and roast. There are low vanilla notes with some dark fruits. It has dark chocolate flavor with roast and bourbon. There are some burnt elements with vanilla and dark fruits. It has a full body with very strong alcohol warming. It is warming, not hot. The flavor last long into the finish. Overall, a complex blend of multiple elements with powerful alcohol without being hot.
Poured jet black , chocolate, roasty, alcohol, very Hot but good. Not at all disappointed with this one. I can’t wait to try the others.
The perfect beer. Founders KBS comes in a close second, but this one is better balanced, more oak, more true to its name.

The nose was detectable from like, three feet away as soon as I started to pour. This is definitely a Winter holiday beer. Fig, date, raisin, and cherries soaked in bourbon on the nose, some oak wood and spice in there too. Taste is phenomenal, with some leather, cigar wrapper and nuttiness adding to the aforementioned aromas. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy and the flavors linger for nearly a minute. Great beer, not for everyone, a sipper and Goose Island’s best that I’ve had.
Excellent. Everything I expected and more. This will age well and be even better in a couple of years.

Bottle poured into tulip. Started out around cellar temp. Thin tan head fades quickly to persistent ring. Opaque, though you can see through it at the margins. Aroma of peat, wood fire, vanilla. First sip is silky and vanilla, smooth as can be. Slight buzz on tongue, slight warming in throat. Medium carbonation. Incredibly easy drinking. Almost too mild or maybe i am sipping too daintily. Vanilla had checked out but checks in again. Bourbon influence is growing as it warms. This beer is growing on me over the course of a leisurely 40 minutes. I don’t mind a boozy beer but those who do will really appreciate this because it is oh so lenient.
Best imperial stout i have ever tried...alcohol very well hidden almost scary how good this tastes...i love the sweet caramel finish....damn this beer is good!

Large snifter pour of black. Aroma of alcohol and caramel mostly, some chocolate. Flavor comes through with vanilla notes and caramel with alcohol presence of course. Really a well made stout even if it is just gasoline and motor oil. Girlfriend says it tastes better than the vanilla rye, regardless if I agree or not.

This fucking crazy. Haven’t been knocked over by a beer in a bit. Near perfection. Only place it faulters is nose. Its so dark and caramelized that it has one dominating aspect. Shoyu like. Other than that it guys all the notes fashionably. New beer added to my favourites.
Great. Smooth with mild bourbon flavor finish. A little more alcohol noticed worth this one compared to other two. Alcohol prominent in nose

2012 vintage on tap. It’s taken too long to have it. Aroma is roasted malt, bourbon barrel, licorice. Appearance is black, dark khaki head. Taste is roasted malt, licorice, oh my word. Mouthfeel is perfect, great carbonation, thick and oily, and it does this magical thing after it leaves that is hard to explain. Overall, I’ve been looking forward to this since I started drinking craft beer. Well worth the wait.

12 oz bottle pour. 2014. Finally have the chance to give this one a go. Pours a jet black cola color with an interesting orange head that barely lasted long enough for me to notice it. Really soft chocolate aroma. For every in the teens ABV beers that I have called smooth in the past, this one is smoother. Really nice chocolate flavor with a nice toasty finish. I expected a big bourbon finish, but it finished mostly dark chocolate flavor. Can’t say enough about this beer, it was well worth the wait the last few years. Sweet all throughout but not a bad sweet. Extremely drinkable. Incredible beer.  UPDATE - 2018 bottle poured.  Even sweeter than before, with a burnt wood aftertaste.  Still has great features for sure, bit this isn't quite the standout gem it used to be for me.  Still a top percentile imperial.

Pours black with an absolutely beautiful brown head. Aroma is awesomely realized bourbon, chocolate, heavy, heavy, heavy malts, and some kind of wiskey-esque liqueur. Taste is initially sweet bourbon followed immediately by chocolate that quickly transforms into really nice rich malts. The alcohol is last, but blended well and not overpowering. AWESOME!!!! This is InBev....this is killing me....

12oz bottle. Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma is dark chocolate with a touch of vanilla and oak. Chocolate flavor with a touch of vanilla and an intense roasty finish. Smooth on the palate. Warming and boozy. A great imperial stout to be sipped and savored.

What is not to like?  Excellent dark chocolate and vanilla flavor with a smooth bourbon finish. Nothing overpowering but the longer it spends in your mouth the more distinct the flavors become. The only way it can get better is to leave it in the bottle for____?
What can I say about bcbs that hasn’t already been said? Nothing really. It’s a world class beer that every stout fan must try at least once in their life.

Probably the best beer I’ve ever had. Went to the local Whole Foods, they brought it from the back to offer it up for purchase. They would not keep it on the shelves. Aged in a bourbon whiskey barrel, you can absolutely taste this through the flavor. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very disappointing indeed given the Black Friday release hype like come get your heroine fix, uh, only one or two bottles please. I got a 4-pack & it was a massive waste of money. At least Dragon’s Milk replicates in modest terms Straight To Ale’s gruel. For being barrel aged & for 2014 at 13.5% I would have expected a powerful hit to the sinuses but all I got was that standard chocolate blandness & not meaty at all by comparison to Straight To Ale’s Laika or Unobtanium. It may be less see through than Dragon’s Milk which is quite light by comparison but at least Dragon’s Milk comes closer in taste to the real steak & potato goodness of Straight To Ale. This stuff is way overpriced & for sissies which like Boulevard’s part barrel aged blends is food for chumps.

2014 vintage. Yo, oh my god. I’ve had it a few times last year. This shit is the bomb. It smells like straight vanilla. Slight bourbon, deep cocoa and toasty goodness. I’ve very happy I was able to get this. One of the best stouts ever.

2014 Vintage
Look: pours a dark black. Very thick. Jet black. Dark brown head that fades extremely quickly.
Smell: heavy alcohol. Bourbon. Fudge. Chocolate. Vanilla. Soy sauce.
Taste: great chocolate flavor! Fudge. Coffee. Whiskey. Very hot alcohol taste.
Feel: very thick mouth feel. Very smooth and creamy mouthfeel.
Overall: awesome beer. Love the heavy fudge notes. Hope some time can weaken the hot alcohol flavor. Love this beer. 
First drank: Mom & Dads 11/28/14
chocolate and vanilla. Caramel, syrup. Velvety, gets sticky as it warms. Enough carbonation to hold it together.

Appearance: Jet black with tan head
Aroma: Now this is what beer should smell like. Where do I start? Incredible bourbon aroma with vanilla, chocolate and butter.
Taste: Wonderful smooth velvety texture and bourbon flavor permeates the entire experience. Fresh vanilla beans, hazelnut and buttered rum. 
Overall: The mothership of imperial stouts. Worth the wait and waking up early on Black Friday. Just an incredible experience for bourbon barrel lovers

2014 bottle poured at home. Wow! I waited in a line this morning (Black Friday) for a chance to try this one; it definitely did not disappoint.
Pours a dark molasses black color with minimal head which dissipated soon after pouring. Aroma is mellow sweetness with bourbon undertones. Taste is amazing. Smooth and slightly sweet, with immediate flavor burst of toasted coconut, chocolate, toffee, oatmeal, gentle coffee notes, with slight bourbon finish. This may be the best beer I've ever tasted! It is SO smooth and drinkable and coats the mouth with flavor that lingers forever. Well Done!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Pours black with thin white head that dissipates quickly. Malty sweet bourbon aroma over mild carbonation. Very substantial mouthfeel. Superior complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Really fucking good. Obviously rated to the style but a really good stout strong w bourbon.

Bottled 10/16/14. Aroma is rich bourbon barrel, smoke, leather, booze, some dark fruit and a hint of black licorice. It has a unique, almost cigar-like quality to it. Very strong, masculine scent that can be detected as soon as the bottle is opened. Appearance is an absolute 5. Jet black and thick with a cap of dark brown foam that recedes to nothing instantly. Tastes slightly sweet and has alcohol heat from the bourbon. It also has strong oak characteristics and everything mentioned in the aroma, to a lesser extent. Great complex taste; the only knock on it is the booze burn, but some aging would take care of that and make it perfect. Palate is a 5+. Thick, smooth and silky. Overall, I think this formula just keeps getting better. This is probably the highest rating I have ever given.

Used oil black with a phenomenal nose. Very drinkable for the high ABV. 

Drink this warm to really get the boozy bourbon notes. 

This is a beer you pair with a big event like hiking to the top of a mountain for a sunset or a Thanksgiving dinner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really incredible stout. The bourbon barrel aging REALLY brought out fantastic vanilla and molasses notes. Its runs smooth and oily over the palate and is lightly carbonated, which makes it easy to drink despite its ABV. I’d attribute this in part to the malt flavor masking the alcohol. Disturbingly good and easy to put down at 14.2%!

Draft @ Crescent Moon. Aroma is bourbon, molasses, maybe a little rust. Jet black color, light brown head that linger around the edge. Flavor of molasses, touch of sweetness on the edge of the tongue, very nice bourbon flavor (not too much). Alcohol is well hidden. Very full bodied, low carbonation. Just slides down easily. Delicious imperial stout!
Aroma is bourbon, wood, roast, dark chocolate. Flavor is dark coffee, dark chocolate, bourbon, wood, figs, dates, booze. Thick body, soft, oily mouthfeel, weak carbonation. Perfect beer.

355ml Bottle from House of Trembling Madness in York (£7.80):

A big beer is every since of the word, this one was absolutely huge & in your face from the second I opened the bottle. I was worried going into this one that the hype might have ruined it for me or oversold it some but not at all, this one was almost perfect & up there with the very best of all the beers I’ve tried. The flavours & smell were wonderfully complex but fell short of being overpowering, the taste in particular being a real treat. Amazing stuff, I’ll definitely be picking up another couple bottle of this when I next see it in the UK; just incredible.

2013 Btl pours a used motor oil color,black and thick. Small brown head that vanishes quickly leaving specks of lace. Aromas of bourbon,toffee,raisins, wood,vanilla,alcohol,earth and a hint of charcoal. Tastes of bourbon,sweet caramel,vanilla,dates,molasses,woodiness and dark chocolate. Massive full body,chewy yet smooth mouthfeel, low carbonation(due to age?) and a sweet syrupy alcohol finish. An amazingly complex beverage that definitely gets better with some age. A beer that begs to be savored and coddled! Truly glorious!!!!

12 oz(2014) bottle pours dark black with a little head. Aroma is bourbon, oak and dark malts. Taste is amazing at first sip. Chocolate, bourbon, oak, vanilla, molasses and near perfection. A slight syrupy mouth feel. A descent burn at finish. It doesn’t get much better than this. Near perfect impy stout.
(tap) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of wet wood; stewed fruit; rich, balanced flavour, well hidden alcohol
Pours dark brown brown with a brown head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, and alcohol. Flavor is much the same. Good stuff.

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown to black color with a medium brown head. Aroma is light roasted malts, bourbon, vanilla, touch of chocolate. Flavor is huge bourbon, vanilla, with a nice background of light roasted malts. Not overly roasted bitterness. Lingering bourbon and vanilla. Fantastic as always! Although maybe a bit lighter than previous years.
Don’t drink this if you do not like bourbon or stouts or bourbon. High abv is very prevalent. Should have let this one age. Drink at the right temp for full effect.

2014 12 oz. bottle purchased from our local beverage market. Coffee black with tan head. Aroma is coffee, leather, wheat, chocolate, and bourbon. Silky smooth taste with profiles of dark chocolate, coffee nibs, roasted sweetness. Slight booziness. Very good stout. No longer needed my jacket after drinking. Would like to let a bottle age a few years.

Bottle, as a gift from the Dennoman, vintage 2012. Pours deep brown to black with a dark brown hue, quickly dissapating head. Intense and rather intruive bourbon scent, lots of vanilla, coconut, Medium body, immediate alcohol attack, little sweet undertone, but hell... it buuuurns. Taste is dark chocolate, vanilla, toffee. Frankly... I am not impressed.

2012 Bottle at home from drinkstore. Pours deep oily black. Tan head which disappears. Aroma is coffee, oak, whiskey, earth, tannin, leather. The barrel is in this beer. Not too much on the bourbon side which is good. Flavour is so full. This is a huge beer. Creamy, lactose, coffee, whiskey flavour. A syrup dry sweet alcohol finish. Little to no carbonation. ABV is there but managed well. Will sip for a while. Wow.

2013 bottle.Smells like bourbon, tastes like bourbon. I’d like a little bit more of the bitterness to come through. Tastes like bourbon, oak, tobacco, leather. A little too sweet. Not sure if it is worth the hype. Very good nonetheless

2013 bottle from trade. This is an amazing beer. The high alcohol is disguised by incredible flavors. Very dark pour with a small dark head. Virtually no lacing. Aroma of molasses, chocolate, toffee, and wood. Bourbon cask, cola, maple, ginger, and chocolate. Very enjoyable.
One of the most complex beers I ever have tasted. Very heavy! Long and distinct taste. I have only one bottle left from 2012 to be shared at a special occasion.

Bottle, 2012 vintage. Pours black with dark brown tints. A brown head disappears fairly quickly. The aroma is rich with roasted malt, bourbon, woody notes, caramel, liqourice. A bit boozy but it is 15%. The flavour is well balanced with a good amount of sweetness to roasted notes. It is heavy on liqourice and molasses and I don’t find it particularly unique although the barrel character is impressive. The body is medium to full and the texture is oily. A lovely stout.

Dark brown, fairly opaque, tan head, low/moderate carbonation. Aroma of nutty-sweet malt, toffee, ripe dark fruit, leather, bourbon barrel. Flavor: huge, thick maltiness with toffee, burnt sugar, plums, raisins, some leathery age, big bourbon character, vanilla, a light smokiness, nutty and toasty notes. Huge mouthfeel. A big, chewy, syrupy barleywine with loads of dark fruit and burnt sugar/molasses-like sweetness.  Definitely on the syrupy side, but I’ll forgive that because of the great complexity.  A sipper.
Poured from bottle with a nice dark chocolate color. Aromas of sweet caramel with a smooth mouth feel and a nice balanced alcohol finish. Superb beer full of complexity and balance.
Easily the best dark beer I ever had. Just the smell is amazing. When I first had it, we drank other beers in between taking sips to make it last longer, just so we could still smell it.

Bottle shared from 2012. Tasting side by side with a KBS. Pours a deep dark opaque black with a thin layer of toffee colored head. Aroma and taste of chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, and coffee. Excellent beer.

"I love the style. The bar was set high. This one is great, but not the best. Not a ton of balance here, not that that is necessarily a bad thing, but the bourbon with a side of stout was ALMOSTa little too sticky sweet by the end. i would have given it an even higher grade if I’d split a bottle. Score upped a tenth upon multiple revisits :)"
2017 at 14.1 definitely too hot out of the gate.  4.1

A great job by Goose Island. This 2013 bottle did not disappoint at all. It had a smooth bourbon aroma and flavor that never overpowered the underlying beer. Wow, nice job guys, can't wait to have another one!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
2018 Edition. Bottled @ 10.07.2018. 15.2% ABV. 
A: Pours an creamy oily black color forming a minimal beige to brown head with minimal retention and only few spotty lacings left in the glass. 
S: Absolutely delicious nose. Strong notes of oak and bourbon. Sweet candy. Vanilla, licorice and dark chocolate and coffee beans notes. Roasted malts. A bit booze. 
T: Sweet upfront followed by a roasted bitterness. Strong notes of oak, coffee, dark chocolate and bourbon. Licorice. Extremely creamy and molasses. Impressive. Good bitterness caused by roasted malts, mainly. Perfect taste. 
M: Heavy body. Extremely creamy and smooth: Impressive. Low carbonation. The thickest beer I’ve ever tried. Perfect body. Bittersweet aftertaste. 
O: Excellent drinkability. No more comments...

330ml bottle served in a snifter glass.
2012 Edition. Bottled @ 23.08.2012. Thanks to stevedore for bringing this one from US!
A: Pours an absolutely black color forming a minimal beige to brown head (and I’ve poured quite aggressively :)). Minimal retention and no lacings left
S: Absolutely delicious nose. Strong notes of oak and bourbon. Sweet candy. Vanilla and chocolate notes. Roasted malts. A bit booze
T: Sweet upfront followed by a roasted bitterness. Strong notes of oak, coffee, dark chocolate and bourbon. Licorice. Extremely creamy and molasses. Impressive. Good bitterness caused by roasted malts, mainly. Perfect taste
M: Heavy body. Extremely creamy and smooth: Impressive. Low carbonation. The thickest beer I’ve ever tried. Perfect body. Bittersweet aftertaste
O: Perfect drinkability. One of the best Imperial Stouts ever! No more comments...
