Pours a really, really dark brown with NO head (expected, really, from a 15% stout). Aroma is almost all bourbon but with a little roasted malt peeking out. Taste is quite sweet but it balances out the heavy alcohol bite quite good. Flavors are chocolate, vanilla, toffee and so on, think of a really decadent dessert. Really drinkable for such an extreme concoction. This 12oz was split 3-way and it was more than enough for me. Not because it was bad, mind you. Only because it is so savourous that it saturates your tastebuds quite agressively.

I’m stunned! Now it’s time to give up and die. This is absolutely fantastic! 
Color: Brown, almost black. A very small head. Flavour: Vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, dark bread, brown sugar, wood and coffee. 
Taste: Oak, vanilla, cream, chocolate, licorice, brown sugar and dried fruit. 
Do I have to say GREAT!?
I really like this beer.  Doesn’t seem to have lost quality since the ab inbev buyout.  Smooth boozy flavor

Hard to drink a 12 oz alone.  This beer is so boozy and rich plan on spending a long time drinking a bottle trying to figure out all of the complexities. This is definitely a sipper. Dark chocolate vanilla and dark fruits.

Clear dark, almost black colour, beige dissipating head. Aroma of Bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and alcohol. Sweet flavour, light astringent, alcohol, Bourbon, vanilla. Wood, chocolate, sweet. Full body, thick, maybe even too thick. Finish Bourbon, alcohol, lots of vanilla.

Great beer.

(from 355mL bottle shared with friends. Thanks Benzai for bringing it for me!)

17-JAN-2016. Vintage 2015. Pitch black, espresso head. Complex aroma, tons of malts, coffee, chocolate, whisky, vanilla, dried fruit, berries, a bit smoky and salty? The taste is as big, but a bit more straightforward. Strong sweetness, dried fruit, toasted malts, warming alcohol. Excellent. 



16-MAY-2013. Head: beige, minuscule, no retention. Colour: deep amber, practically black opaque.

Aroma: sweet, dark fruit, molasses, syrupy, vanilla, a bit of alcohol.  Taste: starts very sweet and syrupy, some roasted sourness follows and finishes with a spicy alcoholic bitterness. Not much bourbon or wood detected. Intense, fine, but a bit overrated imho. 8-4-8-4-16=4,0

Bottle @ benzai. Thx for sharing! Pitch black colour with a lovely brown head, which unfortunately doesn’t last very long. Smells vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, lots of bourbon, caramel, nuts. Tastes lots of dark chocolate, lots of bourbon, some vanilla, lovely roasty, nuts. The taste keeps on growing after the sip. Lasting taste. Full body, silky, soft carbo. The aftertaste is lovely. Slightly warming but not too alcoholic. Love it.

Pour on tap at bricks. Viscous black with thin dark mocha head. Burnt oak and vanilla, rich bourbon, cinnamon and cloves nose. Taste is rich vanilla and hard charred oak, slight cream, coffee and chocolate mid palate, dark dried fruits. Body is big, but not crazy, with a creamy texture and light carbonation and alcohol slightly showing through.

Poured a viscous very dark brown with a minimal, rapidly disappearing tan head. Aroma of coffee, mild dark chocolate and roasted malt. Full. smooth body, flavour of sweet vanilla smooth milk chocolate and sweet alcoholic goodness. Very sweet alcohol end. Lovely.
2012 bottle from timfoolery. Really great. Cracked it for my mom on Mother’s Day. She loved it

2008, poured black with this tan head. Aroma of chocolate bourbon and hints of vanilla. Aged perfect! Taste is velvety smooth chocolate, vanilla all blended awesome with a rich bourbon backbone. Carbonation is spot on with a thick body to hold such a complex taste. Awesome! Wow. Thank you Foppa!

Pours pitch black with light brown head surprising amount of carbonation given the percentage. Aroma is Bourbon, hints of chocolate and hops.
Taste is creamy chocolate, caramel, dark malts and fruit and of course bourbon : extraordinary beer.

Bottle acquired through trade - thanks Kevin! Aroma big bourbon, chocolate, smoke, vanilla. Pours viscous, near black, no head, no lacing, just viscous black bourbon. Taste: nice bitter finish, chocolate, smoke, big sticky sweetness. Viscous, sticky texture, full body, practically no carb. Overall: meets expectations. Fantastic.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 Vintage. Pours BLACK into the glass with a minuscule tan head that fades quick without any lacing. Aromas are Barbecue smoke, licorice, bourbon, wood, caramel, chocolate and alcohol. Flavors are intense and satisfying; sweet bourbon notes, acidic roast and wood hints, creamy chocolate, pain perdu, molasses, toffee and just a touch of coffee all stacked on top of a nice lingering warmth that spreads in the mouth and down the throat. The palate here is awesome, thick and rich with a noticeable heaviness on the tongue and a big chewyness to it. Overall, this is one of the most solid, sipping beers I have ever had. A wonderful drinking experience that only gets better as this warms in the glass.
I love this beer, one of the best I’ve ever tasted. So great. Really awesome.

Bottle at bar. Black color, almost no head. Bittersweet taste with bourbon, caramel, coffee, toffee, chocolate, plum and roasted malts. Very aromatic smooth body. Bittersweet finish with bourbon, nuts and coffee. Magnificent imperial stout.
2012 year edition, 330ml bottle. Pitch black and oily. Complex, with notes of burnt malt, bourbon, dark chocolate, alcohol and red berries. Quite nice already, but will probably get better by age.

The color is a motor oil. The nose is raisin, date and fig. There are notes of licorice, and fruit cake. The pallet is amazing. He pallet is date and fig with peaks of licorice and vanilla. There is lingering flavor of bourbon and brown sugar. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance-  Thick, dense black....like a black hole. Medium fluffy brown head. Not much lacing.
Aroma- Sweet, dark chocolate, bourbon, alcohol, vanilla, caramel
Flavor- WOW....where to begin. Huge Bittersweet chocolate with bourbon, Vanilla,charred oak, caramel. Big, huge,massive flavor!!! My pinnacle. It can’t get any better than this.....Can it?

Pours inky black with a quickly dissipating mocha head. Aromas of raisin, toffee, coffee, and chocolate. Smooth, rich mouthfeel. Nice warmth from alcohol. This is one smooth sipping stout!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 vintage - notes from 1st night this batch was available in Kansas this year, 11/16/12, and after about one and a half years of aging at 55-60º



Pours coffee black with brown seems and folds into a black hole body with a 1/8" dark khaki head which crackles and pops to a swift moon phase death. A transparent ring encompasses the light crushing body with vivid amber highlights. Swirling reveals a wall of alcohol while dark brown stain surrounds the snifter. Looks as intimidating as a beer can. 



Nose of rich dark chocolate, coffee, and bold bourbon. The oak component attempts to smooth and blend, yet the hot alcohol and sweetness builds. Taste reveals a bourbon and chocolate bus rolling up to a metropolis of licorice and chocolate cake. Next stop, mocha cheesecake. Rum soaked dark fruits straight ahead. Syrup drizzled french toast sits on the horizon. I can’t help but recall the whiskey butter I enjoyed this week at Nica’s. Body is full, very liquor-ish, somewhat thinned by the massive alcohol content. Stinging, dry wood finish with sticky lips. The intensity is nearly unmatched.



After two years, the weight has increased, along with the sweetness, banana runts have made their way in, and the off-flavors are a little more obvious, the intensity is high, but the flavor transitions are unorchestrated, this is like drinking a death metal band, interesting, but not as enjoyable as the best barrel aged imperial stouts which offer much more finesse, pure flavors, and a balance of sweetness and drying components



12oz bottle served at 60º into Orrefors Difference Porter snifter

Uploading from Beer Buddy App. Notes from memory. Might be the best stout I've ever had. Not as crazy as Dark Lord, but so rich and smooth and drinkable. Lots of chocolate notes. Alcohol is present but not overwhelming considering ABV. Truly brilliant. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Great BA beer.  Pours like motor oil. Pitch black with a small tanish head. Smells like bourbon, vanilla, oak, and candied fruits. Tastes like everything in the aroma but multiplied.  Strong alcohol which I like. Great beer.

Bottle, many thanks to BlackIPA. Black color with medium beige head. Aroma of dark berries, roasted malt, milk chocolate, oak bourbon. Taste, roasted malt, caramel, bourbon, wood, vanilla, notes of coffee, milk chocolate. Sweet finish. Little bit thin bodied for 15 ABV beer. Alcohol was dangerously hidden.  Too much on sweet side for me, but I am very glad, that I had chance to taste it. Big thanks, Shawn.

Bottle shared by Cuso, thanks. Aroma peat, roasted, dark berries (blackcurrant) strong nice milk chocolate. Pitch black colour, dark brown head. Taste initially really strong chocolate with strong sweetness. I have not yet encountered so much chocolate in a beer yet. Then the wood kicks in, light peat. The chocolate is still there. Despite the IBU, it is sweet all the way through. Late coffee, dark fruits. Finish is long in duration, roasty and chocolate. Alcohol is clearly there, but not unpleasant.
Bottled. Aroma is piercing alcohol, dark chocolate, wallnuts. The taste is phenomenal. Dark chocolate pudding, sweet chocolate, liquor. Very pleasant motor oil imperial stout. Absolutely great!

Vertical tasting ’08-’12.  2008 was mellow complexities with low carbonation, creamy-delicious, absolutely amazing.  Other vintages didn’t stand out nearly as much, effervescence increased along with heat as vintages increased.

Pours an oily black that thins out to a dark cola. Has half a finger of caramel head, that dissipates quickly, leaving a light ring of thin lacing. Smell is very strong of caramel, bourbon, sweet wood tannins, vanilla bean, molasses, and heavily sweetened, light-roast coffee. Taste starts with rich vanilla, mocha, and brown sugar before exploding into bourbon, deep caramel, maple, copper, sweet pipe-tobacco and even some notes of fig.  Finish is sweet and metallic, with a very mild bitterness. Mouthfeel has a light fizz at the start, but smooths out to a light stickiness.

2012 vintage, served in snifter. 
I’m not into bourbon at all but I thought this beer was delicious. Black colour, small brown head. Huge aroma of bourbon, caramel, chocolate, molasses, dark fruit and alcohol. Sweet taste of bourbon, milk chocolate and caramel. Alcohol isn’t hidden well at all but that’s no problem with this beer. Some bitterness in the aftertaste which lasted forever. Syrupy and creamy texture, love it!

Pours inky (the sun won’t shine through it) dark brown with a medium coffee head.  Nose is very complex.  Starts with vanilla, cream, oak barrel.  There is a charcoal note.  There is chocolate, cherries, and dried plums.  Flavor is very sweet but not cloying.  This is a sipping beer. There is a little bitterness.  Alcohol is hidden in the mouth but present in a warming as it goes down, and in a head rush.  Heavy, oily mouthfeel.  Long charcoal aftertaste.  Brilliant.

poured from a 12oz(9/20/12) bottle into a tulip. big thick foamy head almost like soda as it dissipates you can hear it. a thin brown layer remains. the smell is oakey and bourbon. creamy mouthfeel that sticks around and lets the complex flavors absorb and change as you try to restrain from taking another sip. mouth and glass gets sticky about 1/4 of the way through. chocolate, bourbon, dark fruit, oak, a lite burn that lets you know you are drinking alcohol but its perfectly balanced and youd never guess 15% abv. what an incedible stout.

Pours out a pitch black slick used motor oil look with absolutely no head. Smells like oak, bourbon, vanilla, char and very vaguely of liquor. Taste is huge vanilla, toffee, coffee, coconut, and tobacco smoke. Complex as hell! Mouthfeel is very rich and full unlike some other bourbon stouts. Overall a beautiful bourbon stout drinking experience.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow, what a day. Arrived at 7:15am, sat and waited until about 12:15 and then by 13:00 it was all over. Nice beer to toast the arrival of the boy, courtesy of Cotteridge Wines with much kindness. I’m a bit all over the place mentally tonight so forgive my rambles. Wow.

Definitely worth the attention it gets. Comparing this brew to others of the style/hype/etc, I rate this one pretty high because it is quite balanced, not overly hot, and the bourbon/oak component is far more subtle than in others. It feels like an 11 or 12% brew, not something in the 15 and up range. Damned good stuff, sir.

2012 bottle. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: completely black beer, small beige head.
Nose: some wood, alcohol very noticeable, fruity though.
Taste: wood, alcohol, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, some tannines.

Amazing beer!

Vintage 12’’. Pours a pitch black with small brown head and no lacing. Aoma of milk chocolate, vanilla, oak, roasted malts, big bourbon notes. Taste is about the same as aroma but with very very little oak tannins, some booze but its definitely part of the experience. A thick, full bodied stout with low carbonation. A real sipper but at the same time i had no problem finishing my bottle alone. Definitely one of my favorite stouts out there. This vintage doesn’t need any age IMO. Will have again for sure!

Served on tap at Cannery Row Brewing Company in Monterey, CA.
Pours jet black with almost no head.
Aroma is a face full of bourbon with dark malts, anise, molasses, and toffee.
Flavor is boozy, sweet malt up front with a moderately hoppy, spicy trail-off.
Hints of pepper and cinnamon.
Thick, creamy mouth feel with moderate carbonation.
This is a huge beer! Impressive. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012. Pitch black. Quickly disappearing dark brown head with lasting ring and some swirls. Powerful aroma; balanced and complex; light Smokey, burnt malty, oak, touch of vanilla, chocolate, roasty. caramel, mild dark fruit, smooth pleasant bourbon. Flavor has the same qualities. Sweet and toasty and bourbony. Full body, viscous, partly creamy, partly slick, lights up the palate, my whole mouth. All sorts of flavors. Lasting finish. Wow. Good bourbon character through the finish. Lives up to the reputation; even better than I expected. One of the Best beers Ive had to date. 
UPDATE: 2013 Fresh. A little sweeter. A little more bourbon. Palate not quite as big or rounded or complex (in relation) but absolutely still a fantastic beer. UPDATE: 2012 vintage, poured 1/3/14; aged over 1 year. Mellower bourbon on the nose. Flavor seems to have more alcohol. Hot alcohol. Less sweetness. Didn’t enjoy this particular bottle as much as others.

2012- 4/4/2013. aroma is full of bourbon and malts.  chocolate, roasty.
Taste starts off a little heavy, but just for a second.  Lightens up...into silk in your mouth.  Very smooth.  A slight bourbon/bitter aftertaste.  
9/3/9/3/18

2013 - 1/3/2014. Aroma is sweet, bourbon, malt, smoky, dark fruit, a little chocolate. Taste- very smooth, oatmealy, dark fuity, malty,  warm, slight bourbon sting of a finish..lasting strong, finish. 

2012, aged for about a year, 1/3/2014. The bourbon aroma is weaker but taste is stronger. A little more tingly on the tongue.
Nice aroma, heavy bourbon.   Strong pleasant taste of whiskey/bourbon.   Very thick consistency.   Very chewy.    Would pay pretty much any price for a constant supply.   Unique.

2012 bottle thanks to joromiller trade! Pours an opaque black with no real head or lacing, but a nice dark brown film on the glass. Aroma of heavy bourbon, vanilla and chocolate notes, a slight hint of roasted malts. Taste follows, big and thick with a boozy burn on the way down. Wow, intense but really good.

650ml bottle [2009 vintage, 13.0% abv]. Pitch black colour with small, reawakening, frothy, dark brown head. Intense dark malty aroma has notes of chocolate, treacle, molasses, vanilla, oak, leather. Taste is moderately sweet, delivering the same flavours; sirupy palate, lasting finish with some warming alcohol.

Bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours opaque black with a nice crema. The nose has intense chocolate and nuts. The taste has deep chocolate and toffee flaours and the same same on the taste. Also, coconut flavours from the Bourbon barrel. The palate is rich and textured all the way through. Great beer.

How does a beer this big fit into a bottle so small? This beer is why bombers and growlers were invented. So unassuming in its drab label and 12 oz. classic-style bottle. Pop the top--kaboom! It pours a very dark grayish brown, with a mocha head that barely forms before it completely attenuates. Chocolate syrup, vanilla extract, and oaky coconut on the nose. The mouthfeel is quite viscous and chewy. Smooth flavors of chocolate, vanilla, tobacco, minced meat pie, and oaky bourbon. Alcohol appears midway, bittering the last half and finish a little too much. But, it does temper all the sweetness. Very Parabola-like.

Pours jet black, like motor oil, with a very small but oily brown head. Aroma is booze, vanilla, bourbon, berries, chocolate, tobacco, and hints of what seem to be banana and cinnamon. Taste is wild, rich and explosive; espresso, coffee, tobacco, chocolate, fruit, BOOZE, bourbon, vanilla, licorice. Thick, huge, dense, aromatic, massively full-flavored. This is a remarkable experience. Resilient lacing. Laces, spots, legs. Full-bodied and sticky mouth feel. Medium carbonation is wildly appropriate for both the aromatics and the mouth sensation

A great beer for sharing to separate the worthy from the unworthy. Full rich taste. Lots of bourbon in this one. A bit harsh but that's what makes it great. One best sipped on a cold winter night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Chocolate on the nose. Chocolate and vanilla with an oaky backbone. Very complex beer. Pitch black. No head.

I don’t miss Indiana... but I miss being able to drive to the Windy City and order one of these. Holy crap, this beer is amazing. You can really taste the bourbon (Jim Beam) on this, and with an ABV from 12%-14.5%, you can really taste it. Imagine carbonated whiskey. Oh, and toss in some chocolate flavors, too. This is a GREAT dessert beer, and will get better as the beer heats up. Ages well, too.

I will be letting a few four packs age and hopefully at some point I can put together a vertical tasting of this beer, but as I was sipping the last one, (about 2 weeks ago), and as it warmed, it might have been the best barrel-age I’ve tasted. The aroma of the vanilla shines through the longer this beer sits, and as I finished the last half of it, it started tasting like a liquid form of an almond joy candy bar. Anyone else get that flavor? Such a great beer to sit and sip on, especially on a cold winter night! The alcohol warms you up nicely but does not overpower the fantastic flavor of this wonderfully well-crafted brew.  Cheers!

REVIEW

Style: Imperial Stout

ABV:15%

Purchased at: Hy-Vee

Pour: Viscous black pour, very thick.

Aroma: Bourbon sweetness, vanilla, coconut.

Flavor: Chocolate flavor, the bourbon is there, coconut is well. Liquid almond joy (that can get you drunk)

Bottle from Kris Wines, 2011 vintage. Jet black colour, thin brownish bubbly foam, vanishes quite rapidly. Strong aromas, malt, treacle, hint of marmite. Full mouthfeel, ever so slightly oily, enough carbonation remaining to keep it drinking smoothly. Surprisingly smooth, for me felt a big beer but not overly so for 14.5%, roasty, hint of wood from the bourbon. Very good.

12 oz bottle from sherm1016.....thanks!  Pours jet black with very thin, almost non-existant.  Nose is sweet bourbon / caramel / vanilla...initial taste was more bourbon; vanilla and quite a bit, for me. of the booze.  Very very good....

12 oz. 2012 bottle split 3 ways.  Thanks Ryan.  Words can hardly describe how good this was.  An unreal amount of oak and vanilla and more oak in this one.  Thick, heavy, oily.  Visually viscous but lacking head.  Major warmth in the exhale. (15% is not hidden and I’m ok with that.)  Probably the best beer I’ve had to date.

Pre-Leicester nightcap. Viscid pitch with a hissing deep tan head retreating instantly to the edges of the glass. What wisps of head are left churn like boiling tarmac. First impression; fierce heat, little complexity, high alcohol as from neat spirit. Aroma saki-like chocolate, soy and oyster sauces, semi-dried black grape, vanilla, oaked red wine...overpowered by bourbon. Feels a bit like a thinnish stout with spirit added; bullying hot whiskey; the burnt custard of bourbon demolishing dark chocolate, vanilla, dried black grape, fig, soy, grape-based spirit notes. Slightly souring background tang. Raki and custard finish with an unsophisticated waft of tongue-numbing, retronasal high alcohol. Raki and custard sums it up for me. Not especially pleasurable.

Bottle.  Happy St Pats!  Pours thick black with almost no head to speak of.  This is clearly oily, heavy, and manly.  The aroma is full of coconut, vanilla, chocolate, virtually no alcohol in the nose.  The taste has big chocolate notes, a good bit of coconut, some vanilla, more chocolate.  This guy is big on the palate.  Tons of body and only mild booze on the finish.   This is truly outstanding.

Very dark brown, small brown head.  Aroma caramel, molasses, wood, very nice.  Full body, alcohol there but overall pretty smooth.  Flavors of chocolate, vanilla, malt which is roasted but not that roasted.  Mostly sweet but drier at finish.  Big but drinkable and all works together harmoniously.

Pours jet black, head dissipates immediately. Just looks like a beast right off the bat. Aroma is molasses, chocolate, and of course Bourbon. One of the sexiest smelling beers ive ever had. Taste is again chocolate, with coffee hints and slight vanilla coming through...and again, Bourbon. Even with the monstrous ABV, alcohol is well hidden. Just a perfect stout.

Pours black with brown head. Aroma of bourbon, wood, alcohol, dark chocolate and vanilla. Taste of bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate. Oily texture and gives a warming feeling in your body. Alcohol well hidden. Delicious.

Pitch black with a head that dissapears quickly. Heavy aroma with strong notes of vanilla, bourbon, chocolate and cofee. Mouthfeel is almost sticky and the taste is full of bourbon and vanilla and the alcohol is well hidden. Some nice bitterness at the end. An amazing stout and almost a bit to much if that is even possible.

At the moment not my favourite aroma, but very complex for sure. There is something interesting with raisins, vanilla, liquor, bourbon, I think cherries and something more. Very strong aroma and almost no head. It taste and feels luxurious but I think there is too much alcohol at the moment. Bought 3 so I will keep 2 for ageing. A bit bitter. This could last for over an hour and frankly its too much. I prefer other well-made RISs but it will be very interesting to drink this in 1-3 years.

Appearance: Black color with a short lived bubbly small beige head. 
Aroma: Slightly sweet fruity, some bourbon and chocolate.
Palate: Thick oily body. A bit sweet and a mild bitterness. Soft carbonation. Oily texture.
Taste: A round well balanced fine fruity sweetness. Chocolate. You can easily feel the bourbon in the background. Unbelievable well hidden alcohol. 
Overall impression: Solid lovely tasty evening cup.
Personal stats: Bottle (2012 vintage) from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden.

Imperial Stout #50!
Very dense black color without head. Smells of roots, mud, licorice, sweet. Taste coconut, chocolate and of course bourbon. Very smooth and you dont really notice The alcohol.

3/4/13 15% 2012 bottling LOOK: motor oil BLACK...no head NOSE: raw licorice, charcoaled wood, burnt toast, molasses, yep...the toasted coconut is there, German chocolate cake, Mary Jane peanut butter taffy, sweet smoke/tobacco, mocha espresso, vanilla extract, big/dry red wine like a Syrah or Cabernet, butterscotch, tarry railroad ties, hot oily blacktop road, wintergreen mint, charred grill rack after cooking a good steak TASTE: rich & creamy yet dry, mocha espresso, chocolate mousse, sweet wood, burnt molasses, malted milk balls, prunes/raisins, vanilla, long-tingly-mocha coffee-cool mint finish FEEL: thick, heavy, nice fizzy carbonation, perfect amount of burn going down OVERALL: the huge alcohol is very much hidden by all the aromatics and flavor, awesome beer!!! ...Room temp ...Great with beef tenderloin or New York strip!

This is a flavor bomb. 

A bit boozy, it lives up to the label - bourbon shines through, in rich, smooth way. Probably the model for all bourbon stouts and some of the richest beers out there, this is a really, really good beer. I’ve had it on draft and in the bottle, and I fall in love every time.

[Ölprovning @ my place 20130301] Sällan har det varit lättar att exakt förklar aroman på denna ölen, finns bara ett ord och det är Bounty, jag som chockladet ! Smaken inte lika kraftig men, ja cocos och choklad och en rätt lång stänk av alkohol

2009 vintage. Well laced brew with jet black colour. barnyard aroma, pepper, licorice mix with chocolate, whiskey and mint.  Rich & creamy brew with butterscotch, chocolate, toffee and a hot buttered rum finish. Extremely tasty stuff.

Höga förväntningar kan vara riktigt jobbigt men även om denna inte fullt fyllde mina förväntningar så varden galet bra. Smaken bar mycket toner av choklad och cocos men jag tyckte även mig kunna känna någon form fiskighet(?) i smaken. Som sagt en mycket god öl som vinner lika mycket poäng på innovation och komplexitet som smak.
Totally astoundishing beer, countless different flavours and aromas, always changing from sip to sip.

Wow. Black with minimal head. Aroma of sweet chocolate, licorice and bourbon. Taste is the same. Very creamy this is a great desert, but I can’t drink a lot. Had to rerate. Yes, still good, but the sweetness was overwhelming by the end. I had to lower my initial rating. Original rating was 2013. This update 2020. Similar notes. Still sweeter than I would like, but still a great beer.

Bottled, thx rlgk. Pours pitch black with no real head. Smells salty, licorice, dark chocolate, bourbon. Tastes dark chocolate, licorice, dark chocolate, abit sweet, bourbon, alcohol, very creamy and well balanced.

2009 Vintage. Pours almost black with just a ring of toffee coloured lace. Spicy barnyard notes with licorice, chocolate and a certainly mintiness. Dark chocolate and bourbon on the palate with a rummy booziness and that mintiness is still there. A lot of alcohol warmth.
This beer is full of many flavors. One of the best bourbon brews I have tested.

Dark opaqueness with thin tan head; aroma is bourbon notes of vanilla; Flava is rich and full with bourbon, licorice, vanilla , alcohol; finishes long & rich and complex blend of the above flavors leaves the to tongue zinging

Sampled a Ghost Pepper version of this gigantic stout at Brixies in Brookfield, IL.  Everything was like a stout on steroids.  Heavy coffee notes and an ever present burn, but not alcohol.  Smooth mouth feel allots oily.  No head.  The multitude of tastes is so over powering you really could only enjoy one of these in a sitting.  Tingly warm sensation after drinking.  Great winter warmer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2012 Bottle thanks to TheBeerSommelier. Poured from a bottle to a tulip. The pour looked like used motor oil. No head whatsoever. Carbonation is bubbling up from the surface like a bubbling crude. When a few feet away I can smell the sweet malts. When up close you get the bourbon, loads of it. Definitely a sipping beer. On the front end of the sip I get the warming alcohol feel. On the back end I get the sweetness of malts, chocolate and some coffee bitterness. The beer feels like oil in my mouth. Great warming beer on a cold night after work. I can’t wait to try their other varieties. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Scored a log of this, drinking it nightly off the tap at 14psi CO2 only.  All flavors listed below combined into a sticky sweet hammer you beat your taste buds with.  Flows over the tongue like thick silk drapes dissipating into waves of tiny alcoholic needles stabbing at the tongue.  Roasty bitterness on the sides of the tongue and a final puff of boozy vanilla oak up the nose.  Alcohol cools the sinuses for several breathes after each swallow.  Very unique, very impressive, impossible to fully explain in words.  A wonderful experience, a nap in every bottle, best at nearly room temperature.

Bottle 9/26/12. Consumed 2/20/12. Pours jet black, like motor oil, with a very small but oily brown head. Aroma is booze, vanilla, bourbon, berries, chocolate, tobacco, and hints of what seem to be banana and cinnamon. Taste is wild, rich and explosive; espresso, coffee, tobacco, chocolate, fruit, BOOZE, bourbon, vanilla, licorice. Thick, huge, dense, aromatic, massively full-flavored. This is a remarkable experience. Resilient lacing. Laces, spots, legs. Full-bodied and sticky mouth feel. Medium carbonation is wildly appropriate for both the aromatics and the mouth sensation. This is an experience.

Very little to add to the other 1969 reviews. 12oz bottle. It pours an extremely dark brown, almost black, colour with a very small brown head. Fizzy small brown bubbles that dissipate quickly. Lots of lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is sweet and bold. Big bourbon aroma with chocolate, leather, licorice and tobacco notes. Boozy. Taste is mostly sweet with a slight roasty kick at the end. Lots of dark chocolate and bourbon in this one. Crazy boldness here. There’s some licorice, espresso, tobacco and coffee. A lot of vanilla notes from the bourbon. Body is thick and sticky, full, with good carbonatipon. Overall, outstanding. This beer plays in a different league. Truly a love affair for a bourbon lover.

On tap at crunchy's. I had this side by side with the coffee version and this one had a slightly better aroma but I liked the coffee slightly better overall. Splitting hairs with two of the best beers available. Love this stuff.

THX! to Kraddel. 355 ml bottle shared. Black very quickly disappearing head. Very sweet booze, bourbon in the nose, caramel, sweet molasses, brown caramelized sugar, huge, crazy sweetness, sweet mocha, wonderful, not to different from King Henry the bourbon, the Pappy is not so different in the beer I would say. Sweet alcohol, boozy, sweet bourbon, dark sugar, molasses, light burn, chocolate sweetness, lots of malt sweetness, warming, creamy, touch alcoholic, thick malts, thick caramel,… sweet creamy, thick, little carbonation, if this was supermarket beer would maybe give this 5. //// You can say whatever you wan’t about the AB InBev / GI thing, if I could buy this anywhere at a good price, I would

Bottle shared with ships . 2012 version ( fresh ) 
Pours black , no foam at all 
Smell is bourbonish , yet not too much 
Taste is much bourbon , aftertaste is bourbon , Followed by stoutish taste .. Ok , yet too much bourbon for me 


Rerate . Ironically , 77Ships now shared the bottle with me . 2013 version ( almost a year old ) maybe my palate has changed. maybe the batch is better. maybe its the age . But this one is quite nice ! vanilla and oak overpower nose and taste, in a very nice way . still more bourbon than beer , but this time it is positive . 
Quite good . I’ll rerate this 0,3 higher 


rerate. A few bottles and a few from keg in NYC, wasn’t impressed. 2012 bottle shared by kurt, in 2015. Now teribbly jummy again . Weird. Updating 0,1 up

Bottle at home - 2012 Vintage. Pour is pitch black with a small brown head, that quickly dissipated. Big coconut, anise, obviously big bourbon, figs, oak, slightly boozy, black licorice, and espresso in the aroma. Taste is big bourbon, dark chocolate, wood, light spice, huge notes of coconut, molasses, light vanilla, and raisins with an alcoholic burn on the finish. Slick/syrupy mouthfeel with medium-to-soft carbonation. Complex, damn tasty and hard to believe this one is 15% ABV. Nice stout, but a bit overpowering.

Wow! Had this on tap. Drank one a couple months ago, and the alcohol has really mellowed out. Lots of bourbon on the nose. Taste adds vanilla, brown sugar, chocolate, and raisins. Full bodied with a mouthfeel like molasses.
Bottle steeped with coffee. Pours a near black with small head. Huge bourbon nose on it. Smooth feel, though the bourbon really comes through.

@basunen: Vilken fantastisk och komplex doft och smak. Len men full av  allt. Choklad, lakrits, whiskeyfat, mycket vanilj snyggt balanserad med tydliga arrak-toner. Herregud va gott. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Riktigt fin öl, på alla sätt och vis. Svart som natten, lagom sötma och en underbar eftersmak.

En fröjd att hälla upp! Svart som natten med mycket choklad och kaffe doft! En KIM(kn***a i munnen) öl helt enkelt!
